story:
Hello Everybody,

We are Mr. & Mrs. S, a Texas couple who enjoys taking erotic photogrpahy. Mrs. S is the lovely lady and Mr. S is the photographer, obviously nobody wants to see this guy dress liked Mrs. S. Our campaign is to give us a little freedom and take our photos overseas. We would like to travel around Europe, make some new friends and take photos in interesting places. My end goal is to produce a photojournal of our trip with the photos we create along with little stories of what we get into. We not only want to take photos but meet some of the people who follow us. They are people whose photos we admire and would love to spend some time with them and get to know our differences but also the thing in common that brought us together. 

With out help there is no way we would be able to take the time off necessary to produce this. We are not coming into this looking to just take phots although we will produce great work for you look at and admire. I also want to create a great story that we can tell. We want to find the interesting and meet the interesting and have an experience to share and put it onto a platform where evrybody can enjoy it as well. Everything we get from the funding is going into the trip, the more we earn the longer we can stay and more we can do, plus the better the book. We are going to keep up to date with all our sites and our blog to keep you up to date of what's coming. If you cannot donate please share to help spread this around. The more people we can get involved the better chance we have at making this a great project.

story:
Hello

The time has come for our end of year show, we are a group of third-year photography students, studying at the University of Cumbria Institute of The Arts who as the final part of our degree are required to produce and fund our own photography exhibition. We are asking for your help with raising money to cover the costs of the communal expenses for the exhibition so that we can produce a professional show. The exhibition we produce will be part of our final grade and will be our opportunity to show off the photographic skills we have learned over the last three years and hopefully kick-start our future careers as photographers.

All contribution to our show fund will help us make this exhibition something to remember and will be greatly received.

 

What Is Needed

 

What will your donation pay for?

  •         Exhibition booklets                                                         
  •         Painting and repairing walls in exhibition space       
  •         Advertising (posters, fliers and business cards)       
  •         Artist statements                                                           
  •         Communal photography project for wall display     
  •         Refreshments

 

Perks

What we will give you for donating

 

For £5 or more you will get a personal thank you E-mail and a thank you on our social media as well as a photographic screensaver of your choice of one of the exhibiting photographer's photographs.

 

For £10 or more you will get an A4 print of one of the exhibition photographs. Please chose from the categories what type of photograph you would like. You will also get a personal thank you e-mail and a photographic screensaver. A choice of screensavers will be given to you at a later date via email.

 

For £20 or more you will get an A3 print of one of the exhibition photographs. Please chose from the categories what type of photograph you would like. You will also get a personal thank you e-mail and a photographic screensaver. A choice of screensavers will be given to you at a later date via email.

 

For £35 or more you will get a personal thank you e-mail and guided tour of the arts campus during the exhibition by one of the exhibiting photographers Nanna Jensen.

 

For £45 or more donation you will get a personal thank you E-mail and we will send you a signed copy of our exhibition booklet as well as a photographic screensaver of your choice of one of the exhibiting photographer's photographs.

For £50 or more donation you will get a personal thank you E-mail and your name or business logo on our thank you page of our exhibition booklet and a photographic screensaver of your choice of one of the exhibiting photographer's photographs.

For £55 or more you will get a personal thank you e-mail and a photographic screensaver. A choice of screensavers will be given to you at a later date via email. As well as exhibition gift bag which will contain sweets, exhibition mementoes, a signed exhibition booklet and more.

 

 

 

Categories for Prints are

1, Landscape/Nature

2, Documentary

3, Still life

4, Other  (fine art, night photography, vehicle, street photography)

 

We will email you at the end of the campaign with more details about the perk you have bought.

 

The Impact

 

The successful production of this exhibition will impact on our final grade so all donations to our show fund can and will help us in producing an excellent show. 

As well as for our family, friends and prospective employers this is a public exhibition aimed at getting people from the local community to come to the university and take a look at what we do. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you cannot donate then please share our campaign and also please feel free to come along to our exhibition and show support in person.

 

Exhibition details

The exhibition will be part of a campus wide public event which will open to the public on 3rd June until 9th June 2017 at the University of Cumbria, Brampton Road Campus, Carlisle.

story:
Update September 18th:

New goal added! If we reach $1750 we will boost all perks over $15 to include an additional 5x7 print of a character of choice! And we got another one in the works once we reach that goal! Just a few days left! Time for the big push!

Update: September 16th:

New Perk! With five days left in our campaign, we've added in a photo session with FightGuy Photography! Not quite as elaborate as our Sucker Punched shoots, to be sure, but a solid photo session that will show you (or the recipient of your choice) at your best. For examples of our work, please check out our gallery on Flickr. 

Update August 26th:

Our video is up! Long time coming, but it looks amazing! Huge thank you to Jeremy Maline for his work editing that together. Don't blame him for the interview part at the end, that was all me. Now Sucker Punched has a soundtrack!

Update August 22nd:

A mock up of our "Choose your Character" poster is live! Scroll down to catch a glimpse! We've broken our 15% funded barrier! Please continue to spread the good word! And stay tuned for some big news this weekend!

Update, August 12th:

We've added in a digital perk!

For all donations $10 and up, you'll also be receiving  a digital, hi-res copy of our "Choose Your Character" style poster! Featuring a shot of each of our characters! It's gonna look fantastic!

Update, Aug 9th:

For any contribution $10 and up, we will be posting a Shout Out to our fans by whatever means at our disposal (including, but not limited to: Our Website, Facebook Page, Flickr, Tumblr and as a tag on our email!) This gives you a chance to have your business/project/campaign/charity/self promoted to the hundreds of people who regularly view FightGuy Photography's work. Just let us know the details!

But wait, there's more! For any contribution of $150 or more, we will promote you and/or your project/business/campaign/charity every month for a year! Imagine the exposure!

 

Sucker Punched

FightGuy Photography kicks off its first crowdsourcing project!

A small photography company based in Northern Virginia, FightGuy Photography is looking to bring some fresh and dynamic artwork to life.

Inspired primarily by the images and themes of the Zack Snyder film, Sucker Punch, we've launched our own project based on that tone and style. Why limit such a bold and dynamic world to the story of 5 young women?

More than just a traditional "ladies with weapons in skimpy outfits" project, Sucker Punched is looking to showcase women at their strongest. There is no need to sacrifice femininity for strength. The women of this work are strong, powerful, beautiful and deadly. By subverting and reworking the stereotypical archetypes of "sexy girls" into powerful icons, we create a world where women aren't powerful in spite of their gender, but because of it. The goal is the celebration of empowerment, not debasement.

 

Drawing from sources large and small - the Valkyrie mythos, Sarah Connor, Johanna Dark, Aeon Flux, The Hunger Games, Kill Bill, Tomb Raider, Firefly, Appleseed, Resident Evil, and many more - we've crafted a series of characters and set ups that we think showcase a strong, solid and fun concept.

 

 

 

We currently have five characters created and three shoots completed (from the top: Domino, Princess and Cherry). However, there is NO LIMIT to how far we can take this project! Reaching our goal will help us create ten shoots, with ten different characters. If we push beyond our goal, we'll keep adding on. We can make 20, 30, 50 different set ups. We can have an army of SP characters.

 

If you're interested in seeing more pictures from these shoots or FightGuy Photography in general, check out our portfolio on Flickr.

 

What we need & what you get

To make this project a reality we need funding for costumes, makeup, props and studio time. We're also very keen on paying our models for their time, energy and tremendous contribution to the project.

To that end, we offer some of the project's final products in gratitude for your support! We're looking to make prints, posters, photo books and a calender!


Donate to unlock additional characters! (Photo of Jessi, in the top right corner, provided by Bold Sheep Photography)

SPECIAL MILITARY PERK!

For all active service members, any donation over $15 will include a bonus personalized print and letter from the character of your choice. Just our way of saying "thank you" to all who serve.

What we're working towards

If we can make our goal, we'll have funding to build a full ten costumes down to the smallest detail, get props, rent studio time, hire make up artists and pay our models. If we exceed our goal, we'll keep expanding the project, working to bring in additional models, and do group shoots involving multiple characters.

Our goals for this project exist on several levels:

  • First, we're working to promote the careers of local models, actresses and artists involved in the project;
  • Second, we're building and promoting our small, budding photography buisness;
  • Third, we're building a project based on empowerment and strength - things we can all use more of in this world. To that end...

10% of all money raised will be donated to RAINN in the interest of protecting and empowering others.

From RAINN's website -

RAINN (Rape, Abuse & Incest National Network) is the nation's largest anti-sexual violence organization and was named one of "America's 100 Best Charities" by Worth magazine. RAINN created and operates the National Sexual Assault Hotline (800.656.HOPE and online.rainn.org) in partnership with more than 1,100 local rape crisis centers across the country and operates the DoD Safe Helpline for the Department of Defense. RAINN also carries out programs to prevent sexual violence, help victims and ensure that rapists are brought to justice.

Donations of all sizes are welcome and appreciated, as are all signal boosts, shares and friends that are sent our way. If you know people who might find this project appealing, please use the Indiegogo share buttons to help us spread the word.

Thank you for your support, everybody!

About FightGuy Photography

FightGuy Photography was launched in 2010 by Craig Lawrence, a professional actor, stunt man and fight choreographer. Building on his extensive performance skills, particularly in the realm of movement and theatrical violence, Craig set out to develop a photographic style that could capture the energy, grace and story of any subject. FightGuy Photography has worked with a number of different companies and individuals, providing event, promotional and production photography. For more information, contact us through our website fightguyphotography.weebly.com

**FightGuy Photography and the Sucker Punched project are not affiliated with Warner Brothers, Legendary Pictures or the film Sucker Punch. The work presented is original material inspired by a number of sources.**

story:
My name is John Andrulis and I've been photographing the Jersey Shore during the winter and the summer for the last eight years, since returning to New Jersey after studying photojournalism in graduate school.  I grew up in the Princeton area and spent much of my youth going to the beaches around Manasquan and Mantoloking (Central Jersey), first with family, then with friends.   It was a place of fun, games, friends, family, sun, seafood and the ocean surf.   When you become grow up, you realize what a respite and retreat the Jersey Shore is from the grind of work, city and daily life.  Inspired quite a bit by the work of the photographer Mary Ellen Mark, I sought to capture the people, places and imagery of the Jersey Shore that make it so special during the summer months.  For me, black & white photography has that timeless quality I find so special in documentary and fine art photography.

I moved to Philadelphia 8 years ago and began to visit and vacation at the beaches of South Jersey - a new Jersey Shore experience that seemed familiar but different (Ocean Grove and Cape May; Seaside and Wildwood).  Nonetheless, the same magic was there - beach bikes, boardwalks, rides, restaurants, the dunes, surf and lots of smiles.   I opened a small art gallery in Philadelphia that showed my work and the work of some great emerging painters and sculptors.  I studied documentary and street photography in graduate school and took that approach with the lens when photographing the Jersey Shore with black & white film and an old Nikon camera.  

I'm currently finishing up shooting some of the beaches around Central Jersey (Bay Head, Lavallette, Mantoloking, Chadwick)  this summer and also revisiting most of the other beaches on the Jersey Shore to see what else catches my eye.   The general layout of the book is now up on my John Andrulis Photography Facebook page (minus the photographs I still have left to shoot this month).   My Jersey Shore Summer book does not focus on the tragic destruction caused by Hurricane Sandy (some of those images will be shown when I print the Jersey Shore Winter book in the coming years).  In fact, I feel fortunate to have some photographs of places that have now changed from the hurricane or development, such as the Highlands Drawbridge and the Seaside Pier and Jet Star roller coaster.  The summer book is about celebrating the beauty, joy and laughter the shore brings to people who live or vacation there during the summer months.

Future Plans and Details:

I have other books ready to go on Philadelphia, Manhattan, The Hamptons, Los Angeles and South Beach, Miami.  I will also continue working on a long term project on photographs of New Jersey.  I plan to expand this project into a small press that publishes the next generation of fine art, documentary and street photography.

The Jersey Shore and Philadelphia will be at least 11x12 inches in size, hardcover, 400 pages long and bookstore quality binding and paper with a Sponsorship and "Thank You" page in the beginning to list people who contributed financially to launch these books.  See the Perks.  A $50.00 contribution will get you 1 book and your name on the "Thank You" page.   The books will retail for $75.00 when completed and delivered in December 2014.  Limited edition / signed prints are available for purchase.

I need about $20,000 to print the books in addition to money to help fund the completion of the photography and the advertising, storage and shipping fees when they are completed and distributed.  You can help by contributing $25, $50 or more or by spreading the word to your friends through social media.   Achieving or surpassing my funding goal of $25,000 will enable me to pay for the photography I need to complete this summer, publishing the book and its marketing and distribution.  If I fall short of my funding goal, it will simply take me longer to pay off the shooting and publishing costs.

Thank you for your support!   I hope you enjoy the photographs.

story:
A mother of 4 wonderful, crazy, hilarious kids, and a Grandmother of a very energetic Grandson and precious beautiful Granddaughter, They all make my world complete. But I have a dream, and that dream is to have my own Photography business..oh and to have Stephen King Call and want to use one of my images for a book cover.
     About 7 years ago a wonderful friend opened up my world when she showed me her digital camera, I was so amazed that you could see right then and there the picture you took and delete it if it didn't come out right, I had to have one, so two days later I had my first camera in hand.  Now I look at the world around me through a lens and I love what I see, there is beauty in everything, from the abandoned to the rusty decay of metal, things I would pass up and see as garbage is now a beautiful piece of art.
     I can't limit myself to one thing when it comes to photography, there is just too much out there to snap at, I love people, textures, detail, and decay and I just want the world to see what I see.

The Impact

    
    
    


What We Need & What You Get

     I need to get my work out there for people to see, one thing I know is you have to sell yourself, your work, your talent and to do that you must advertise "You"  from business cards, to flyers and ads, and you have to have the right equipment..I am in need of funds for a Flash, advertising, and lighting equipment, backdrops for Portrait sessions.  
     Anyone that contributes $25 or more will receive a free 8x10 of their choice from my photo site
http://www.redbubble.com/people/kimcalvert


Other Ways You Can Help

    Spread the word, let your friends and family know about my work

camera, I was so amazed that you could see right then and there the 
picture you took and delete it if it didn't come out right, I had to 
have one, so two days later I had my first camera in hand.  Now I look 
at the world around me through a lens and I love what I see, there is 
beauty in everything, from the abandoned to the rusty decay of metal, 
things I would pass up and see as garbage is now a beautiful piece of 
art.     I can't limit myself to one thing when it comes to 
photography, there is just too much out there to snap at, I love people,
 textures, detail, and decay and I just want the world to see what I 
see.
The Impact 
               

What We Need & What You Get     I need to get my work out there for people to see, one thing I know is you have to sell yourself, your work, your talent and to do that you must advertise "You"  from business cards, to flyers and ads, and you have to have the right equipment..I am in need of funds for a Flash, advertising, and lighting equipment, backdrops for Portrait sessions.        Anyone that contributes $25 or more will receive a free 8x10 of their choice from my photo site http://www.redbubble.com/people/kimcalvert

Other Ways You Can Help
    Spread the word, let your friends and family know about my work

story:
Hi! I'm Angelina and I've always loved taking photographs. I thought I had a pretty good eye, but I never saw myself going anywhere with it, it was just something I did for myself. Well, on a whim I decided to enter a photography competition, never dreaming that I'd get accepted. But I did, and now I need to get that photo framed for the exhibit!

After talking with a professional framer, we decided on a beautiful 8 ply cream colored matte, a wooden frame with a bronze-y finish that really brings out the color of the violins hanging in the luthier's shop window, and museum grade conservation glass to prevent any glare from the frame glass interfering with the reflection of the shop window. It will be a beautiful piece once framed and I would be so thrilled if someone took it home after seeing it in the show!

With this campaign, I'm hoping to recover the cost of printing, submitting, and framing the photograph, as well as the cost of printing and shipping the perks offered in this fundraiser. If I don't reach my goal, what I do raise will still go toward the above costs. If by some strange chance I exceed my goal, I will use the extra money to buy a new lens for my DSLR! New toys are fun, right?

Please help spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends and family. Every share and/or contribution means so much to me!

story:
PLEASE NOTE YOU CAN STILL PURCHASE PACKAGES EVEN IF THE "GOAL AMOUNT" IS EXCEEDED.  THANK YOU SO MUCH!

 

Short Summary

With cold, gloomy weather upon us, I would like to take my photography business to the next level and bring it indoors to a studio setting.  This campaign is put together as an effort to build my studio in a more timely fashion by having clients prepay for upcoming Holiday Photo Mini-sessions.

 

What I Need & What You Get

I have had such a wonderful summer meeting new families and photographing their incredibly photogenic children.  I would love to offer clients the option to have their sessions at an outdoor location and/or in an indoor studio setting. 

I am asking clients to prepay their upcoming Holiday Mini-Sessions as a way to fund the purchasing of studio lighting, backgrounds, stands, and additional lenses.  

Once you purchase a Package through indiegogo.com, I will contact you to schedule your session.  


Sessions will be scheduled for (starting with the earliest date and working progressively as time slots fill up): 

Saturday, November 24th, 2012 and Sunday, November 25th, 2012

Saturday, December 1st, 2012 and Sunday, December 2nd, 2012

Saturday, December 8th, 2012 and Sunday, December 9th, 2012

 

You will receive a 25-minute mini-photo session with 3 backgrounds.  Please visit my website (www.stacey-mcintosh.com) to view background selections.  Clothing changes are allowed.  No extra sitting fees for parents.

$75 - Package 1 includes a high resolution disc with 10-8x10 images with printing rights.  

$100 - Package 2 includes a high resolution disc with 10-8x10 images with printing rights, 2-5x7s, and 2-sets of wallets.  Prints are of 2 poses.

$150 - Package 3 includes a high resolution disc with 10-8x10 images with printing rights, 2-8x10s, 4-5x7s, and 4-sets of wallets.  Prints are of 2 poses.  

Images for the discs will be chosen by the photographer.  Discs will be mailed out to the address provided the following Wednesday.  Images for the prints will be chosen by the families.  Prints will arrive dependent upon shipping times of my printer.  

No editing may be done to the images once you receive them.  Please give credit to Stacey McIntosh Photography if posted to a social networking site.

 

The Impact

I am working constantly to improve and build my skill set.  I would like to broaden my scope and offer my photography services to high school seniors, pregnant moms/newborns, and weddings.  Every stage of life is beautiful and needs to preserved.

 

You can contact me at: hello@stacey-mcintosh.com

Website: www.stacey-mcintosh.com

Facebook: Stacey McIntosh Photography

(http://www.facebook.com/pages/Stacey-McIntosh-Photography/334014263357913?ref=hl)

PLEASE NOTE: Campaign is directed towards clients in Montclair NJ and surrounding areas.  If you would like to contribute to my campaign, but are not in the area, I apologize, I do not have any packages to offer you except my heartfelt thanks at helping me achieve a personal goal.

story:
Short Summary

Trains, Tracks, and Smokestacks is a series of articles, books, and documentary films dedicated to chronicling railroading in the United States of America.

  • Author/Photographer Alley Evola holds a Bachelor of Science degree from Middle Tennessee State University in Mass Communications and has been a staff writer with The Tennessean and Nashville Business Journal newspapers.
  • She is the author of the short story "A Simple Warrant Service," appearing in Ed Nowicki's "American Blue" published by the Varro Press and represents the third generation of an American railroading family that has served the New York Central and Penn Central railroads for over 100 years.

This project is important to me because railroads and their infrastructure are disappearing across Middle Tennessee and the United States at an alarming rate. It is important to document their legacy and value and to attempt to build awareness regarding their plight before they disappear entirely.

Through the assistance provided by your generous contributions, "Trains, Tracks, and Smokestacks" will begin the difficult work of chronicling railroading in the United States, beginning with the geographic region of Middle Tennessee where the area is bleeding track mileage at a furious rate.

What We Need & What You Get

We need an infusion of capital to aid with production costs and to cover regional travel expenses for on-location photo shoots.

Each person who contributes $15 will receive their choice of an 8" x 10" photo from the book, signed by the author. Each person who contributes $25 or more will receive an autographed copy of the first edition coffee table book.

If we don't reach our goal, all funds received will be donated to the Nashville, Chattanooga, and St. Louis Railroad Preservation Society to benefit their continued effort to preserve the heritage of railroading in Middle Tennessee. Visit them at: http://ncstl.com/

The Impact

Your donation will make a difference!

  • Your gift will help ensure that railroading in the United States does and will continue to provide a viable alternative to cars and trucks for moving products and people throughout the United States.
  • With each contribution you can feel good about being a part of preserving America's rich and vast railroading history for yours and many generations to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute funding, but may still want to help with our project. We appreciate your support too! Here's what you can do:

  • Follow us on Twitter at https://twitter.com/AlleyEvola and make sure to retwteet our posts.
  • Visit us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/TrainsTracksAndSmokestacksAStoryOfTrainmen and like us there too.
  • Finally, follow us on Tumlr at http://www.tumblr.com/blog/trainstracksandsmokestacks

Plus, don't forget to use the Sharing Tools provided by Indygogo to help get the word out!

Thank you so very much!

Sincerely,

Alley Evola

story:
Who am I?

I’m Max Archila, a Black and White Landscape Photographer, living and working in Montana.

Impressed by the beauty of the Northwest Rockies (United States and Canada), I’ve started to capture its beauty with black and White photography. Spending my summers in Glacier National Park, I’ve become and enthusiastic photographer, a devoted fly fisherman and adventurer.


What is the project?

After a few years of building my portfolio I am ready to put together a book that I can be proud of.  "From the Crown to the Coast; Northern Rockies and Pacific Rain Forest" will contain more than 50 stunning black and white (in majority) photographs of landscapes and wildlife. The project will capture the Beauty of the United States National Parks (Glacier, Olympic) and Canadian Parks (Alberta and British Columbia)

You can check my work on my website, www.maxarchila.com and facebook page;

When will the project be released?

The Project is currently under progress, The Canadian footage and Olympic peninsula will be on the works in October 2013, and the Photo Books and photographs will be ready by early December. 


Why you should participate?

·  You're a good friend or a loving family member

·  Because you love Black and White photography

·  Would be a great Christmas gift

·  But mostly because you think my work deserves to be published, and you love my photographs and postcards.

The cost for printing 100 high quality books is $6,000.

It is not cheap but this is what it takes to make a great quality book.

The total Budget for the project is of $11,250.00

·  Multi Media Equipment $1,800.00

·  Travel Expenses - $2,500.00

·  Book Prints - $6,000.00

·  5% - 9% Indiegogo fee.

How can you get involved?

By obtaining any of the perks listed you will be contributing to the project, and you will receive some of my artwork.

If you cant help economically at the moment,  please share this campaign on your facebook, twitter, website, anything that helps to spread the word and could help me to finish the project.

Thank you for your time, please share and if possible donate.

Max Archila

story:
Welcome!

  • My name is Samantha Fairfield Walsh and I'm a New York City based artist, writer, and actor.
  • I started The Womanish Project to investigate what it means to be a female identifying person in the world today. How gender is so hard to define, yet in turn, defines so much of our lives.
  • I've been working on The Womanish Project for the past seven months and I'm at the point now where I want to expand the market that sees it. This entails submissions for magazines, applications for grants, etc. But before I can do all that I need to trademark the name 'The Womanish Project' and buy a domain so I can move off of Tumblr.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I'm looking to raise 600 dollars to cover the following costs:
    • Trademarking the name 'The Womanish Project'
    • Purchasing a Domain 
    • Getting the website up and running
  • Anything I earn over 600 dollars will be set aside for the project as well. I've been going out of pocket for tolls, gas, transportation, and time off of work to interview people. I'd also love to set aside some money for submissions and grants that cost money to apply to.
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, all of the funds I do receive will be going towards the project. I'll keep putting money away until I'm able to accomplish my goal!

 

The Impact

  • The Womanish Project has made me a better person. It's opened my world view, made me check my privilege, and expanded my definition of what it means to be a female identifying person in today's world. I hope to share it with more people in the hopes of spreading that change to people outside of myself and my immediate circle.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I understand that sometimes we're all strapped for cash so if you can't donate it would mean the world to me if you could share The Womanish Project with the people in your life.
  • www.womanishdoc.tumblr.com
  • Instagram: @womanishdoc

story:
My Inspiration.

This is an ongoing photo project, exclusively for children with Down Syndrome, launched after years of anticipation. It is inspired by my youngest brother, Joel, who was born in 1987 with Down Syndrome and my life was forever changed...for the much, much better. 



Why Now?

Down Syndrome is in the spotlight and getting more attention than ever these days! This is very exciting, but I want people to really SEE how amazing, beautiful and "not so different" these children are. As a photographer whose mission it is to focus on capturing the pure essence of babies and children, I wanted to do the same with people who have Down Syndrome and show the world how incredible the spirits of these children are.


What I Am Working Toward.

Throughout my photographic journey, I will be displaying the images on a blog, facebook and twitter. The ultimate goal for this project is to compile the photos with stories and highlight them in a coffee table book.


Learn more about my photography on my main website and blog


What I Need To Make It Happen.

In order for the families who have expressed interest to be involved, I need to travel to 6-8 major/easily accessible cities in the United States. During each visit, I will have several days worth of shooting with these families. Up to this point, the project has been self-funded, but for it to continue, I need some help from you! I want to make this book a reality and raise awareness about Down Syndrome.


Most of the money raised from this campaign will go directly toward travel expenses, which I estimate to be approximately $1200 per city ($500 for average roundtrip airfare, $200 for rental car and $500 for 2-4 days in a hotel). The more money raised, the more families I can work with! 


Other raised money will cover production costs of the book, as well as cost of printing for prints, postcards and calendars sent to supporters ($2000). Once this goal is met, I will have a separate campaign to fundraise for the cost of space rental and printing for the anticipated gallery show.


This project is very important to me, my brother, thousands of families, and the entire Down Syndrome community. You can be a part of making this happen! Thank you so much.

story:
Back the Greens to keep Scotland UKIP-free

Scotland elects 6 MEPs on 22 May. How we vote sends out a clear message about the kind of Scotland we want.  A Green Scotland or a UKIP Scotland?

That’s why we are asking for your urgent help in making sure that the Scottish Greens’ Maggie Chapman wins the race against UKIP for the sixth seat.

Donate now. Sign up to our campaign. Vote Green on 22 May.

Green Scotland: defending public services, welcoming migrants, standing up for peace.

The Green vision for Europe  is forward-looking, reforming and deeply-rooted in Scottish values.

UKIP, by contrast have a lead candidate parachuted in from London, whose main aim is to raise his profile for contesting the Westminster seat of Bexleyheath and Crayford in 2015.

But make no mistake: the sheer volume of fawning coverage which UKIP is getting from the UK press  gives them a boost which their contempt for Scotland does not merit.

That’s why a Green vote is so important.  There is no bigger contrast in politics than the Greens’ Maggie Chapman and UKIP.  But not only that, a Green vote is simply the best way to ensure that UKIP does not get a Scottish foothold. With the Lib Dems out of the race and SNP and Labour expecting to get more than one MEP each, a Green vote is what really counts in the voting system used for European elections.

Help our campaign

But the Green campaign is a grassroots one.  We don’t have millionaire backers or big business chums. We urgently need £1,500 to make sure we get the message out before 22 May.  Please help us do that by donating to the campaign.

•£20 pays for 1,000 “week of election” cards

•£50 gets our message out on election day across an entire council area.

•£100 supports door-to-door work in local neighbourhoods

Other Ways You Can Help

•Follow Maggie and the Scottish Green Party on twitter at @Maggie4Scotland & @scotgp

•Link up with us on facebook

•Vote Green on 22 May

story:
Who Am I & What Am I Doing?

Hello there! My name is Matthew Justin Rupp and I currently reside in Charlotte, NC. I am a freelance graphic designer, photography and fine artist while dabbling in the literary arts. I love all things art, music, film, literature, nature, animals, philosophy...you name it! So enough about me and onto what I am doing...

Seven years ago, I was diagnosed with Bipolar Type II Disorder, Major Depression and Severe Anxiety. Each and every day has become a struggle to live a normal life while dealing with my illness. Throughout the past seven years, I have hit rock-bottom and ended up being admitted into the hospital. There is a person inside of me who knows that I should not allow my disease to control my life and I am giving it my all to live wholesomely, positively and be on my way to a better life.

My goal is to travel throughout the United States to cities I have never been through to meet inspiring individuals and experience a world out there that I didn't know existed. I will be sharing my journey on the way via Facebook, Tumblr and Instagram! This will have a major impact on my outlook of life as well as my artwork. You are giving me the opportunity to show myself that I am larger than my illness and I can and will live my life.

What Do I Need & What Do You Get?

I will be traveling over 8,000 miles by bus, stopping in over 20 cities in the United States over the duration of two months. I am estimating that the cost of transportation, food/beverage, shelter and everyday needs will be around $100 a day. 50(days) x 100(dollars) = $5,000. This money will also be going towards some of the wonderful perks I have in store for you!

Perks include postcards, wristbands, t-shirts and original poems and artwork by me. Not only will you be supporting a good cause, you will get something awesome in return.

If I do not reach my goal, I will still go forth with my journey but shorten the route accordingly.

The Impact

It is difficult to express in words how much this project means to me. This trip will allow me to feel free from my ailments and to live my life as it should be. It'll teach me that there is a better life for me to be lived. It's incredibly valuable as well to you, the contributor, because you'll be the reason a human being is living a much better life. The spark of life that lights my candle can light many many more without my burning out. I've had a passion to help others with their difficulties and I ask for your support so you can help with my difficulty as well at those of many others.

Risks & Challenges

This trip will be immensely challenging and full of risks. I have to organize each day perfectly so that I am able to reach my buses' arrivals and departures. I must also find a way through cities I have never been to. I will be doing this solo so every single thing depends on myself. There is a risk of my well being if I am not wise and cautious.

I believe with my street smarts, tech savviness and organization that I can manage to have everything run smoothly.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some of you are unable to contribute to my project, however, you can still help. Please share this with your family and friends via the sharing tools Indiegogo provides. Most of all, you can help by living positively and telling yourself "I am on my way to a better life."

story:
Hey, I'm Kara! This is Intimate Portraits:

Inside is an untold story.  Something under the layers of clothing and skin, in the soul that wants to come to light.  There is an entire world of depth within the emotions of the mind, wherever they currently rest.  Everyone has something to share and whether painful or playful, there is so much beauty.  The identity of subjects is protected with anonymity as the most important focus point is the expression of their soul within.

I've been doing photography for 12 years and this project for 2 of those years.  It's been made through LA, SF, Portland and Seattle with locals and travelers.  Its a dream of mine to bring this project to the public through book and exhibition. Before photographing, I had a different way of dropping in with each person (i.e. an activity, eye gazing, questions, etc).  The project within this book/exhibit shows the space between camera and subject as healing.  To be captured in this way can bring out a variety of emotions: sad, erotic, fun or heart warming.  It's an honor to hold space for everyone and show them how beautiful they can be.

Support ART! Buy a book or contribute...

This project requires a lot of love and some money to get it out to the world.  Because of the content, it needs to be published/printed through private companies.  When you support this project, you receive a ton of love from me as well as a great quality coffee table book, prints or a session of my work. 

Art + Self-love movement!

Celebrates art, sexuality, beauty of all shapes and ages, the LGBTQ community, breast cancer awareness and life challenges along with YOU for being a big part!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help financially, you can follow me and share this project with your friends.  Tag me + add the indiegogo link:

IG/Twitter: @karacooperphoto
FB: https://www.facebook.com/KaraCooperPhotography/

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who am I? What are my goals? What did I do so far to achieve them?

Hi! My name is Danielle Shitrit,  I'm 23 years old, living in Israel and my goal in life is to become a photojournalist with a focus on conflict and war zones.
These days I'm photographing concerts, performances and doing small projects while working at Cafe XoHo in Tel Aviv (the nicest place ever) just to make some money to achieve this goal.

In the last couple of years I've been working extra hard to become a photojournalist and started doing independent projects, taking major steps towards this dream - trying to make it a reality.

I've been photographing for Amnesty International, focusing on the issue of asylum seekers in Israel, for a very long time. In the near future we are continuing our work and going into serious in depth projects together.

I've been covering for a while the issue of Palestinian-Israeli conflict, trying to show people in Israel sides they are usually not exposed to, and to open their minds - a small step for more peaceful times. I believe change is in the small things these days. It is in people’s awareness and in discouraging prejudice and stereotypes.

I participated in an amazing course taught by one of my favorite journalists, Itai Anghel, about conflicts around the world. This gave me a big push to chase my goal.

Besides the projects I do in Israel, I try to dedicate my time and money as much as possible to projects abroad to gain additional experience and information in the field of photojournalism.

Last year I traveled around east Asia for four months and started realizing the process of connecting with people through my camera. During this time I worked on many small projects.

In April of this year, I was in Amsterdam and did a piece on squatting, which has become illegal in the last couple of years due to capitalist legislation. 

In July I attended the Foundry photojournalism workshop in Bosnia and realized even more how much this is what I'm supposed to do with my life.

I did a project there about ex-addicts and planning to come back and continue a piece about gay community in Bosnia.

What do I need from you? How would you contribute to me?

Photojournalism, unfortunately, is the kind of profession where you spend more money than you make. That becomes a major obstacle in your first steps as a photojournalist, AND THIS IS WHY I NEED YOUR HELP:
On November 6th I would like to attend an amazing workshop that takes place in Spain - a conflict photography workshop. The workshop simulates a war zone and would provide me with valuable tools: learning how to photograph in these hard conditions and how to protect myself as well. The information and experience I’ll get there is priceless and it would be a significant mark on my long way to become a professional photojournalist that focuses on war zones.

How much?

The cost of the workshop is 1500 EUR (I set the goal and perks in dollars so it would be more comfortable). I cannot afford this sum of money. If i can get to the 1500 Euro goal I will use all of this money to go to the workshop. If I don’t achieve this amount but get close enough to it, I will still go to the workshop, but I’ll try to use some of my savings. If (worst case scenario) I don’t get anywhere near the goal, I’ll invest all the collected funds in different aspects of my photography studying - i.e. put it aside until the next workshop, pay for applications as an undergraduate in photojournalism abroad, and so on. 

The Impact

I feel the camera is a way for me to bring important issues to the general knowledge of others. I feel a lot of people around the world have stories to tell and I believe there is a huge influence in telling these stories - both on the subjects and on the readers. Ignorance is our biggest disease in a generation that has all the information in one click. I feel my biggest contribution to the world would to become a photojournalist. I think I can make a difference. I truly believe it.

Thanks

The only way I could apply to this workshop is with your help!
Your contribution will take me another step closer to my goal of becoming a photojournalist. 
Every small donation means a great deal for me.
Spread out the word about this project so it would get as much exposure as possible in the limited time I have.
And in the long run, help me help others.

story:
Salted Wounds

... Is a small book or "zine" style collection of photographs that I've put together of pictures  I took in the wake of Hurricane Sandy. The size of the finished book is 9" wide by 7" high. As of right now, the plan is that it will be a soft-cover magazine-style book that will come packaged in a comic-book style sleeve.

I am a local photographer, living on Long Island all my life. My passion is photography, and I've been doing a Picture-A-Day (PAD) Project for over 1500 days now. I love where I live... I am a true New-Yorker at heart, and was affected deeply by the damage I saw around the area after the storm.

I am honored to have the cover photo being featured in a show called "Rising Waters" on Governor's Island, in collaboration with the Museum of the City of New York, and the International Center of Photography. The show features photos from Hurricane Sandy and will run through the end of September. You can get more information on the show by clicking here.

Pre-Sale of Book

My goal is simple... I need to pre-sell a certain number of books so I can afford to have them printed. I want to keep the cost down so that everyone can afford to buy one. Large, hard cover coffee table books are beautiful, but they are often expensive to print and very expensive to buy, so I chose to go this route instead, keeping it more cost effective for both myself and those who wish to purchase my work.

If I receive enough pre-orders, it's possible it will be upgraded to a true soft-cover book with flaps and a much heavier cover (more like a real book and less like a magazine)... but I need to sell at least 500 books for that to happen!

UPDATE: I've decided to make "Salted Wounds" available as an ebook! Starting at $7, all levels of contribution will get a digital version of the book, including everyone who already signed on to get the printed book and other perks!

In other words, everyone who contributes $7 or above will get the ebook!

First 150 Contributors...

I just got some great news that will allow me to include a unique surprise for the first 150 or so contributors -- SO GET IN EARLY and you'll get a very special gift from me shipped to you along with your other perks!

Ways You Can Help

  • Contribute and pre-order a book!
  • Follow me on Facebook and on Twitter and get your friends to follow.
  • Share this campaign with your own friends and family so they can buy a book too!
  • Share on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, MySpace, Tumblr... everywhere!

Good Cause

I'd like to donate partial proceeds to a Hurricane Sandy charity, so if I raise enough and have enough left over after printing and shipping and all that, I certainly will, and will keep everyone updated on the status. I was laid off fairly recently myself and still have repairs I've yet to do from roof damage that caused a leak into my own home, but I'm absolutely the type to share when I can! The more books I pre-sell here, the more I can keep the production costs down and the more I'll be able to donate!

UPDATE: Now that I've reached the goal, I'll definitely be able to donate partial proceeds to a Hurricane Sandy relief charity... I haven't decided how much yet, or which charity, so keep your eye on the updates! The more books I sell, the more I'll be able to donate, so share with everyone you know :D

UPDATE 2: See the updates page for more details, but I've decided on the organization where part of the proceeds will be donated to... it will be The Robin Hood Foundation. They do great work, and have assured me their Hurricane Sandy grantees will continue to receive money as long as donations are coming in. They have already granted millions of dollars to many worthy organizations helping people impacted by the storm.

FYI on PayPal:

My husband and I share a paypal account, so if you see his name (Antonio) when you go to make your contribution, don't fret! That's the right place :)

story:
The Plan:

We are planning to move a five person team 2,737 miles over 14 days.  The desired result is 12 images for my senior thesis project at NYU Tisch School of the arts.  This site is to help pay for rentals, film costs, transportation costs, food, props, wardrobe, lighting, fireworks, post production, printing, and more for the production.  Any donation is greatly appreciated, and will be used to help pay for the above expenses.  

The Photos:

We will be shooting on 4x5 color film(Kodak Portra) using a Wista 4x5 camera to create the photographs.  The pictures will create a 12 piece narrative discussing the leaving of old technologies and the introduction of new ones, in an attempt to freeze and show a time of transition where both are present.  The sodium vapor street lamp will be used as a core symbol of the transferring of old technologies to new ones.   The series hopes to serve as a document of the transitioning time from sodium vapor lamps to LED's, akin to broader movements of analogue to digital platforms in our current world.  Using color film and view camera technology in combination with digital scanning and processing, the images will be produced in a process of transition from analogue to digital photography, reflecting the content of the photographs.  The work will be printed and displayed Spring of 2016 in the Tisch School of the Arts Lobby.

Location:

As an environment and location, the Midwest is perfect for the project's goals and content.  The middle of the country allows for open landscapes, the great lakes, large homes, and the atmosphere of the midwest, where the series takes place.  In addition to this our producer, Mary, is originally from Nebraska, and our photographer, Leo, hails from Wisconsin.  Heading to an area where we have roots allows for access to various locations, everything from the inside of a newsroom to a public pool on a bright sunny day.  

The Team:

Leo Purman- Photographer/Driver.  Leo loves lights.  He takes in moments and their details like no one else can.  Leo stops to notices the person who stopped to notice the person who stopped to smell the roses.  His passion for cinematic imagery and intuition for these 12 moments will create a photography exhibit you'll want to spend some time looking at. 

Mary Kerrigan- Producer/Driver.  Mary has been working on budgeting, locations, actors, and travel coordination since the beginning of the project.  She brings energy, and a relentless positive attitude to the creation process.  Without her coordination of the production the project wouldn't be a reality in the slightest, her efforts are the back bone of the operation.

Cory Fraiman-Lott- Gaffer, Grip Extraordinaire/Driver.  Cory has a comprehensive knowledge of the equipment and execution needed to provide naturalistic lighting.  Leo and Cory have begun test shoots with the film and camera, so once on set precise and accurate lighting can be done.  Having the ability to augment light during the shoot will allow us to fully take advantage of our medium, 4x5 color film.

Jayne Clark- Production Designer/Driver.  Jayne has a natural eye for composition, color, and design.  Her input on how we shoot in the midwest, and how we can most accurately depict it in 2015 will freeze the photos in time period and location.  Jayne has begun looking through our locations, as well as gathering wardrobe and essential props for the photographs. 

Maddie Pflug- Unit Production Manager/Driver.  Maddie has been working closely with Mary as the shoot dates get closer; preparing our sleeping accommodations, meals, as well as scheduling our shooting times with location.  Maddie hits the ground running, and is always willing to lend a helpful hand.  Her presence on the project will allow us to execute the plans we have created in a seamless fashion.

Questions?  

Email - leo.purman@gmail.com

Phone - 1(414) 687-1386

closer; preparing our sleeping accommodations, meals, as well as scheduling our shooting times with location.  Maddie hits the ground running, and is always willing to lend a helpful hand.  Her presence on the project will allow us to execute the plans we have created in a seamless fashion.Questions?  Email - leo.purman@gmail.comPhone - 1(414) 687-1386

story:
We're all made of star stuff

Do you love astronomy? Have you ever thought of getting into astrophotography but are just daunted by everything you need to get started?

I love astronomy, physics, science, and astrophotography. I love that I can point my telescope at a patch of sky, tell it to acquire images all night long and wake up every morning looking forward to the data I collected. I'd love to share this with people like YOU!

There is nothing better than waking up to a gift of the cosmos after every clear night.

I'd be thrilled to help you love this hobby as much as I do!

Not only do I want to make astrophotography more available, I want to make it more open. The beauty of the cosmos is up there waiting - waiting for it to be captured, shared, and enjoyed by all.

We often get so busy with our lives we don't stop to look.

We often live in parts of the world where we forget what it means to look! If you live in a city center and you look up at the night sky you may only see the brightest of stars and brightest of planets. It's easy to take our skies for granted when we forget what is up there!

We want to give you the gift of the heavens.

We'll make sure you have high quality data, tools and resources needed to process this data and the rights to use the data as you see fit with minimal restriction!

  • We grant you the freedom to use the data and enjoy the benefits of using it.
  • We grant you the freedom to study the data and to apply knowledge acquired from it.
  • We grant you the freedom to make and redistribute copies, in whole or in part, of the information or expression.
  • We grant the freedom to make changes and improvements, and to distribute derivative works.

Share the works on social media, use it on your blogs, make prints, hang it up on the wall. This is your cosmos!

All data will be licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. We just ask that you link back to the source (our website where you download the data)

I'm new to this - what exactly does "Data" mean?

Digital Astrophotography uses high end cooled cameras to image the cosmos with precision. The images are saved as individual "Sub exposures" often a few minutes long. These sub exposures are then "Stacked" (consolidated) and processed to reduce noise, improve signal and then these integrated images are then post-processed to pull out the faint objects we're imaging to produce beautiful photos.

** Update:  Check out one of our latest blog posts to download some sample data and see one of our guides of processing the Heart Nebula.

Why this campaign?

We want to share the cosmos with you.

It's in my DNA to share. I've found the best way to learn something and experience something is to share it and teach it to others.

Waking up to beautiful data I can integrate & process is great - but helping people like you get into the hobby, learn to process data and have access to data acquired by great equipment in great skies is what keeps me going.

I've already invested heavily in some amazing gear - the only thing left is amazing skies! I want to share these skies with you!

If this campaign is successful and there is interest in opening the cosmos, we may seek out not for profit status to make a sustainable long-term project and outreach program to broaden our reach.

No telescope required!

All you need is a computer.  We'll provide how-to guides, data, and resources to help you get started. 

If you choose a reward that includes raw data, you will need tools to calibrate, integrate and process this data. We'll send you guides on open source, commercial and free software you can use.

Do you already have a telescope?

If you have a telescope, you can keep using it! In fact, you can use our data to supplement data you get from your own location.

If you live in the southern hemisphere, we'll happily image targets you can't get!

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this campaign is to get our equipment to dark skies and share the privilege of such beautiful skies to all. And I mean ALL.

It's that simple!

When it comes to astrophotography "Signal to Noise Ratios" mean everything.  In dark skies, we get more signal. With more signal, we have better data. With better data, we spend more time collecting more targets than we do having to spend time to overcome the noise to capture those targets.

Darks skies is "Win-Win".

To show what dark skies mean, check out this approximation of the bortle scale.  Most of us live/work in bortle ratings above 6 here in the US unless you live in a rural area. Even if you live in rural areas, you see the "light domes" of the cities that are near you. Light pollution is a real problem, but since we can't solve light pollution, we can open dark skies to more people by taking advantage of observatories in these bortle 1-2 zones.

If we make our goal

Our goal is to raise at least $6k to be able to co-locate our fully automated scope in a dark sky, secure and connected observatory for 1/year. The entirety of the $6k will be used to pay for the pier, power, electricity, and internet connectivity in an established & secure observatory with on-site staff to assist, as necessary. 

All the observing equipment is already owned, setup and fully integrated & automated. 

Stretch goals

If we make 10k, everyone will get 2 years of open data from dark skies!

If we make 15k, everyone will get 3 years of open data! from dark skies

Share this campaign with your friends and family - the more we raise the longer we can have access to dark skies, the more targets we can image and the more data we can share!

If we don't make our goal

We're still going to dark skies.  If we don't meet or exceed our campaign goals then we'll have to restrict our shared data to those who contribute since the costs of making it free for all would be more expensive than I can self-fund. 

So yes, if you commit to any of our rewards, you will get data.  If we don't meet our total goal, then we'll see about other ways we can work on making it happen.

I'm not giving up that easy ;)

We either surpass our goals and help astrophotographers in general, or we raise enough to help those who contributed.

We want to exceed our goals!

That's right, if you share this campaign and we exceed our base goal and hit stretch-goals then everyone receives the extra rewards!

Stretch Goal 1:  10k Raised - 24 months of open data from our dark sky observatory,

Stretch Goal 2: 15k Raid - 36 months of open data from our dark sky observatory,

Our goal is to keep our telescope collecting data every night we can operate. 

Perks

Rewards will start upon conclusion of this campaign, however, there will be a short break with imaging to move our equipment and set up at the new observatory. We'll announce that timeline as we figure out the contract and availability of pier/adapters needed from our vendors.

All Perks

All persons who contribute in any Perk level will receive login access to our website, an ad-free experience when logged in, early access to all content, processing guides, how-to guides and special insider access to everything Astrophotography. We'll share videos of how we acquire images, our scopes operating, how things are set up, how we image, how we choose targets. Our goal is to open the cosmos, but also ensure open access to it.  Not just so you can consume it, but so you can learn from it.

Email

Want to just pitch in a few bucks to help us out? Select an email reward and we'll write you a personalized thank you letter with a little surprise within it! We'll also make sure you never see ads on our website, it's the least we can do!

Open Images

Looking to help us with a bit more money but not interested in processing the data? We'll give you full access to our full high-res images on our fast cloud storage. No more chasing around how to right-click download target or any of that. You get access to the library of all processed images, ad-free access to our content and first access to all our guides and content. One day we will surely turn you into a master image processor ;)

Student

Permanent access to as many raw integrations and processed images as we can get. Forever. This is highly discounted for students/kids.  We love students and we want you to enjoy the cosmos.  Enjoy high speed cloud downloads, ad free web content and first access to content.

Hobbyist

This campaign is for you!  Don't spend 10k+ to get amazing gear and dark skies, supplement your own efforts or just use data collected here and start creating beautiful images! You get access to our imaging calendar, pending requests and first access to all our content and ad-free access to the website. Hobbyist contributors get high speed access to individual subs, calibration frames, calibrated stacks, and any images that we process. 

How it's made

This is a premium all in one comprehensive insight into how to do AP, how to everything works with an intimate one on one comprehensive class on Astrophotography.  We'll set up personal sessions with you where you can request specific targets and we'll run through the entire process of acquisition and basic processing with you over a 6-8 hour period of sessions (we're flexible!) - We request that you have a copy of PixInsight already - there is a free trial if you don't already own the software. A computer with Windows 10, Linux or MacOS is required for PixInsight.  We're limiting this session to PixInsight since we're already familiar with the tool and we can help you become familiar too!  You will also get access to everything in our Hobbyist perk for the lifetime of the operation so you will get a ton of data to process!

  • PixInsight - Calibration, Integration & Processing
  • Sequencing - Planning, Optimizing, Monitoring
  • Tracking - Calibration, "Seeing", Understanding
  • Understanding SNR & Astrophotography
  • How/why we have our configuration the way we do + More
  • Collaborative on one one!

Addon

How do I do this?

We'll help you figure it out. Buy this addon-on and we'll do a 1:1 online/chat/zoom/virtual collaboration to show you how to process data collected from our observatory!

Custom Target

Want to get a specific target with custom parameters? Choose this addon and we'll get your target on our calendar with your requested parameters! We'll let you know when it's in season, optimum filters, exposures and integration time for best data and you will be the first to get access. If this custom target requires a hardware configuration we're not operating in, we'll let you know when we can swap over.  (Such as 840mm focal length for galaxy season or 545mm focal length for wide field imaging)

Observatory

Our equipment is already automated and fully operational. Our goal is to image as often as there is clear skies. 

  • 120mm Triplet Esprit Apochromatic Telescope
  • Apex .65x Focal Reducer & Flattener (widefield configuration) F4.55 speed at 454mm Focal Length
  • Esprit Flattener (longer focal length - 840mm)
  • Optec Flip-Flat - Automated Flats, Flat darks, and robotic lens cover
  • Pegasus Power - Remote control of power, USB, and automatic Dew Prevention 
  • ZWO ASI2600MC Pro Color APS-C Camera
  • Triad Ultra,  Optolong L-eXtreme, and Optolog L-Enhance Filters.
  • Optec precision Robotic Focuser
  • ZWO Robotic Filter Wheel
  • Computer with acquisition, weather, sequencing, and cloud-sync software

We use the ZWO Cooled ASI2600MC Pro Camera. This is a full color aka "OSC" Color Camera. We dither between every exposure, run autofocus through temperature changes, and seeing changes.  Our integrations are fully bayer-drizzled so you receive very high-quality data.

The 2600mc pro color camera provides extremely deep well, 16bit ADC, extremely low read noise and high quantum efficiency. It's a very modern sensor that provides extremely detailed, rich, and high-resolution data.  

Risks & Challenges

Since we already have the gear and we're already doing observations in our backyard, the biggest risk is just being up front with what we can achieve. Our goal is to image as much as we can, but that goal is limited by mother nature.

Funded/Unfunded

  • If we receive enough funding to set up in a dark sky, there will be a short intermission of imaging to move our equipment and set up.
  • If we don't receive enough funding to set up in a dark sky, we'll continue to image however the imaging sequences will be slightly longer and more involved or we may have to target specific weekends at dark sites for those who purchase custom sequences. 

Weather Risk

  • Clouds, Smoke, Bad Weather, Natural disasters.  Heading out to dark skies will make our data much better than I can get near the comfort of our house, but it won't mean mother nature won't strike.

Weather Mitigation

  • Community - While there may be nights that we can't collect more photons, we'll be happy to collaborate share and be creative. We'll be sure to create content, update guides and just share the cosmos with you. If you purchase a "How do I " add-on reward, we'll create an online meeting to collaborate with you on learning the ropes of image processing. Perfect for those rainy nights!
  • We'll keep an updated observation calendar and notify you if there are long term impacts from weather/smoke/fire/natural disasters.

Moon Risk

  • The moon goes through waxing and waning cycles. It goes from a new moon that is great for broadband imaging (galaxies and dark nebula) to a full moon, which pushes us towards narrowband imaging.

Moon Mitigation:

  • Narrowband Imaging - Our set up currently uses an APS-C cooled astro camera that is full color. We use a Triad Ultra Quadband Narrowband filter during bright moon phases to target objects that emit light in Ha, Hb, OIII and SII.  We love imaging when the moon is up & we'll never waste a cloudless sky.
  • Broadband Imaging - If most of our targets that are "in season" for that month are broadband targets, we'll persevere on. We use the Optolong L-Pro filter which helps mitigate moonlight and skyglow from impacting our ability to image.
  • Our telescope has a robotic filter wheel that allows us to change filters depending on seeing conditions and imaging parameters.

Equipment Failure

  • Things break - our telescope & gear is high quality gear, but it is also running for long durations on a nightly basis. Sometimes bugs will get in, dust will hit, or smoke will dirty our lenses, or we'll have a mechanical or electronic failure.
  • Covid shipping delays - if anything breaks or needs servicing, there may be delays due to restriction during COVID. 

Equipment Failure Mitigation:

  • Images are backed up, any consumable parts will be on-site (batteries, USB cables and things that tend to fail open to the elements through the nights), Computer parts.
  • On-site staff available to respond as needed
  • Observatory has automatic controls for weather, storms, dust, smoke. Our scope has additional capability such as a robotic cap that can close should we detect any issues before the observatory closes.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone loves to image or wants to stockpile up a bunch of data, but we'd really appreciate if you could share with friends and family who may be interested! I want to share the wonders of the universe with everyone ;)

story:
Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear - a photobook

 

A story of a small community in Narva set in the larger context of post-industrial cities worldwide

 

Dear friends and strangers, 

Milda Books is so happy to announce the pre-sale of Maria Kapajeva's book Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear. With this book we are inviting you to look at the recent historical changes in the region through the individual, deeply touching and personal stories of the working community in Narva, Estonia that once existed. The photobook will guide us through the narrative and give us more of a sense and understanding about what happens when the surrounding system collapses and how it impacts people in the area, how they are struggling to adapt to capitalism, integrate into a new society, shift their scope or to find a new job. They are still feeling nostalgic about the past and long gone community, but the wheels of history show no sign of stopping and people have to move on quickly. We believe in such strong stories. They have a unique quality to be relatable to other stories of various post-industrial communities all over the world who went through difficult times when industries' closed.

Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear

Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear is a multi-layered and multi-disciplinary story of the relationships between collective and personal memories by looking at the community surrounding a textile mill in Narva, Estonia, now closed, of which Kapajeva's family was a part. The story of one small community is set in the larger context of post-industrial cities worldwide, as they seek new identities. It depicts a mill filled by powerful rhythms of looms and lively collectives of women workers that, in today’s competitive world seems like a bright and distant dream. Maria has focused on women, with a heightened sensitivity towards social and political matters in post-Soviet culture.

As the daughter of a textile designer, she spent her childhood at the mill, drawing fabric patterns and dreaming about the same job her mother had. She tries to interweave her mother’s work, her childhood dreams and their failures with the workers’ collective ones to underline the division between personal and collective memories that together form our historical narratives.

The title Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear is borrowed from the lyrics of March of Enthusiasts, from the Soviet movie The Bright Way (1940), starring Lyubov Orlova in the role of a female weaver, who made her ‘Cinderella’ journey from peasant to Stakhanovite, a heroic worker. This line of the song was later censored because of doubt raised by the word ‘unclear’. The idea of a wonderful dream is intended as a common thread throughout the book but so too is the lack of clarity that characterises our memories of the past.

 

The photobook and its production

Maria Kapajeva worked closely with Estonian designer Jaan Evart to create a book design that would combine all the complex layers of this story - archive pictures, diary entries and present-day interviews conducted by Maria. In the end, it's not only a beautiful object but also an incredible source of information about the experiences and lives these people led. It was very important for Maria that the book is in 3 languages - Estonian, Russian and English. The book also includes a story told by Elena Semyonova on the Retraining of Former Workers and texts by Liisa Kaljula I Keep Questioning What It Means to Be a Woman from the Post-Soviet Area, Philipp Dorl My pink and blue eraser. The book is printed using Heidelberg Speedmaster XL 75. The book will have an open style Swiss binding. Each copy of the book will be a unique artwork as each cover will be hand printed by the artist as part of her ongoing site-specific work titled Mapping My Mother.

Designer Jaan Evart (on the right) with the press specialist Raimonds Grants overlooking the printing process

A freshly printed spread from Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear

 

Who we are

Maria Kapajeva (Estonia/UK) received MA in Photographic Studies at the University of Westminster (UK, 2013) and BA (Hons) Photography at the University for the Creative Arts (UK, 2009). She won numerous awards including A Woman’s Work Award via Creative Europe Programme (2020), Runner-Up Award at FOKUS Video Art Festival (Denmark, 2018) and her first title You Can Call Him Another Man has been shortlisted for the Aperture Photobook Award in 2018. She was invited to various residencies including the most recent at Laznia Centre for Contemporary Arts in Poland (2020). Her work has been exhibited and screened internationally including the most recent Estonian Museum of Applied Art & Design (2020), Vilnius Gallery of Photography (LIthuania, 2020), Latvian Museum of Photography (2019), CBS Digital Art Space (Denmark, 2019), RIBOCA Biennial (Latvia, 2018), Kaunas Photography Gallery (Lithuania, 2018), Luminocity Video Art Festival (Canada, 2018), Narva Art Residency (Estonia, 2017), WOAK Gallery (Poland, 2017), Detroit Oloman Gallery (USA, 2017), NexT Film Festival (Romania, 2017) and Berlin Feminist Film Week (2016).

www.mariakapajeva.com

 

Jaan Evart - (1981) lives and works in Tallinn and Amsterdam. After studying at the Estonian Academy of Arts and the Gerrit Rietveld Academy in Amsterdam, he received a Master’s degree from the Werkplaats Typografie in Arnhem in 2009. Evart is a freelance graphic designer who works in Estonia and internationally, mainly in the field of culture. 

www.jaanevart.com

 

Milda Books is a non-profit, non-commercial, Baltic-based publisher of documentary photographers, visual writers, artists, and poets from the CEE region, founded in 2017. Milda Books produces one to three new books each year by contemporary artists, and also focuses on authors from abroad who have made their work within the Baltic region.

www.mildabooks.com

 

Perks

In addition to the pre-sale, we have made a series of posters and postcards with some images from Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear. Their sale will also contribute to covering the costs of production of the book.

A3 poster with an image from the series Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear

Double-sided poster

Why do we need your support?

This campaign is a pre-sale of the book that will cover the last remaining production costs of the book (printing and binding it) and shipping. All of us have previous experience working with photography books, both on an artistic and production level (printing, binding, and distribution). We're confident that our combined knowledge and skills will result in a quality book. We have already worked with Green Print, a print house in Latvia offering high-quality offset and digital printing, which will produce the book, and will be visiting festivals and book fairs to increase the visibility of the project after its launch.

We are planning for a production of 600 copies of the book. All together from translating the texts to designing the book and in the end printing it, amounted to €12097,64. Although we have managed to raise most of the funds needed, we are still missing €4000 to finish producing this book. That's why we are launching this pre-sale and asking for your support and contribution.

Indiegogo's platform fee on all funds raised is 5%. The book has already received support by the Cultural Endowment of Estonia, British Council in Estonia, Creative Europe Programme of the European Union A Woman’s Work and Gallery of Photography Ireland.

 

Share

We understand that it's not possible for everyone to support our campaign, but we would be really grateful if you could share this beautiful story with your friends, family and through your social media. Thank you!
story_txt: Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear - a photobook A story of a small community in Narva set in the larger context of post-industrial cities worldwide Dear friends and strangers, Milda Books is so happy to announce the pre-sale of Maria Kapajeva's book Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear. With this book we are inviting you to look at the recent historical changes in the region through the individual, deeply touching and personal stories of the working community in Narva, Estonia that once existed. The photobook will guide us through the narrative and give us more of a sense and understanding about what happens when the surrounding system collapses and how it impacts people in the area, how they are struggling to adapt to capitalism, integrate into a new society, shift their scope or to find a new job. They are still feeling nostalgic about the past and long gone community, but the wheels of history show no sign of stopping and people have to move on quickly. We believe in such strong stories. They have a unique quality to be relatable to other stories of various post-industrial communities all over the world who went through difficult times when industries' closed.Dream is Wonderful, Yet UnclearDream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear is a multi-layered and multi-disciplinary story of the relationships between collective and personal memories by looking at the community surrounding a textile mill in Narva, Estonia, now closed, of which Kapajeva's family was a part. The story of one small community is set in the larger context of post-industrial cities worldwide, as they seek new identities. It depicts a mill filled by powerful rhythms of looms and lively collectives of women workers that, in today’s competitive world seems like a bright and distant dream. Maria has focused on women, with a heightened sensitivity towards social and political matters in post-Soviet culture.As the daughter of a textile designer, she spent her childhood at the mill, drawing fabric patterns and dreaming about the same job her mother had. She tries to interweave her mother’s work, her childhood dreams and their failures with the workers’ collective ones to underline the division between personal and collective memories that together form our historical narratives.The title Dream is Wonderful, Yet Unclear is borrowed from the lyrics of March of Enthusiasts, from the Soviet movie The Bright Way (1940), starring Lyubov Orlova in the role of a female weaver, who made her ‘Cinderella’ journey from peasant to Stakhanovite, a heroic worker.
