story:
Heather deserves a Walkabout.

Hello.  My name is Aaron.  In early 2010, my wife and I separated, and eventually divorced.  I had to move in with my father on Whidbey Island in Washington State.  For the first year I was quite depressed, and I had no desire to have any real friends.

But then I met Heather.

We hit it off right away, and started working on various projects together.  It started with theater set building (her passion at the time), and later on we were doing odd jobs together.  She was the best friend that could have asked for.  She helped me through so many things.

In the Spring of 2012, I was offered a job in Oregon, and moved away from my best friend.  It was hard, but it was the best thing for me at the time.

And now, Heather's recent story.

In the last year or so, it was found that Heather had a large tumor growing in her jaw bone.  The removing the tumor with take reconstructive surgery over time.  Currently she is seeing a Chinese medicine doctor, who specializes in reduction of tumors. She also has a tumor in her sinus cavity.  These two tumors cause her to suffer from headaches that are similar to migraines. Her most recent scan showed a decrease in their size, but also revealed a new one in her frontal lobe.  None of them can be treated with chemo or radiation.  The only western medicine option is removal.  She has been on pain medication and unable to work for 6 months.  Acupuncture has been found to relieve the pain. 

Her new pain free clarity has given her a new way of seeing the world.  She is finding beauty in things that she used to take for granted.  She has decided to photograph all the beauty that she sees, so that she may share it with others.  It is her new found passion.  And to be quite honest, she has a natural talent for catching the perfect shot.


What I would like to do for Heather...

I am hoping to fund a road-trip for Heather and her little dog Sophie.  I would like to be able to rent them an RV, and let them explore the Western United States.  Taking pictures along the way.  I would like to raise enough money to be able to pay for the following:
  • RV rental for two weeks
  • Gas
  • Food
  • Additional camera equipment (if needed)
  • ....and any miscellaneous items that she may need along the way.

She deserves it...

I wish that I could express to her how much she has helped me through the few years that I have known her, but I am not as good with words as I would like to be.  She is such a loving and caring people person.  She can strike up a conversation with any stranger, and be their best friend in 15 minutes.  She is always willing to help in any way that she can.  I think it is time that I return the kindness.  If I could fund this journey on my own, I would.  That is why I enlist the help of caring strangers.  I have seen the good that this community has done.

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of diverse students from all different backgrounds, who have been brought together by a mutual love of Photography. We will be showcasing our work in the form of an end of year exhibition and need your help to raise much needed funds. It means so much to us to get our name out there when leaving college, to pursue our dreams and keep creating art. There are many costs associated with exhibiting work which as students we can't cover alone.

What We Need & What You Get

By contributing to our project you enable us as photographers to showcase our first exhibition.

We have hosted a bake sale and are hosting a table quiz on the 16th of February in The Poor Relation  in Cork City.

We need funding to cover a variety of costs including a venue, advertising, framing of all student's work, film, printing supplies and much more.

Risks & Challenges

The success of our Exhibition counts towards our final grade and it is hugely important to us all to do our best and graduate. We would really appreciate any help given. 

Other Ways You Can Help


Please take the time to share this site with friends and family. Your individual help can make a huge difference to the success of this project and is greatly appreciated. So tell your friends, family and others about the exhibition and how they can help us.
Please share our story and this site on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn and any other social media you are familiar with. You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!
 

Our sincere thanks from us all at St John's Central College Photography Department.

story:
A story of change, and we are all connected to it.

A top-quality hardcover photo-book that is 10 years in the making. Photographs of a past way of life, with about 70 people sharing their thoughts about the change.

The Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign to publish the book was a success and the book officially became available for sale to the public at the book launch on November 25, 2015. The publishing was delayed through much of 2015, but resulted in a book that's 240 pages, with debossed cover artwork, printed and bound at Friesens, one of the world's finest bookmakers.

Books can be ordered at this website: www.prairiesunset.ca

If you are interested in buying a fine-art print, or would like updates, please email me at this link: dion@earthpics.ca

You can follow the Facebook page for this project by “Liking” the page: https://www.facebook.com/prairiesunsetbook


The video above tells the story. Please click here for video on youtube.

I'll be posting Indiegogo Updates, which can be seen in the Update menu, and are also emailed automatically to contributors.

Your contribution, and your help in spreading the word is what makes crowdfunding work. Thank you!

            ----------------------------------

The photography and writing for this book are completed. This campaign is to raise enough money to publish this book. 

Professionally designed, it will be printed by one of the highest-quality book printers in North America.

Info about the "Perks"-- (see the boxes on the right). They are closed now, but remain as a reference to the prices during the campaign. Shipping was included in the prices, and during the campaign I subsidizing the cost of mail and GST in most cases. Price for the book now is $59 plus shipping plus GST if applicable. 

                                                            •••••••

The Story

About 100 years ago, people arrived with dreams to begin new lives, and what followed is one of the most dramatic periods of change in recent history in North America. This book tells one part of that story.

It's a book about hope and dreams, hardship and survival, family and community, and most recently, rapid change. Through the words of the people interviewed, this book explores some of the changes over the past 100 years, and it highlights the richness of lifestyle on the small family farm. This is a story we are all connected to.

The words of the people I talked with have great meaning, and are straight from the heart. Hearing what these people had to say helped me understand what they went through, and the importance of this story. Their words are intertwined with full-page photos I've taken of what remains from this fascinating era of rapid change, of the past 100 years or so.

And there were surprises for me. Hidden within the words of the people were details that hinted of survival, self-sufficiency, and food preservation before the days of household electricity and refrigeration. And more.

The photography I've done for this book is of old buildings and other artifacts, left behind from this fascinating era. Much of this is rapidly vanishing. I believe that more of this needs to be somehow preserved, before it is gone forever.

                                                            •••••••

  • 192 pages - full-page photos intermixed with quoted words of people who I talked to about the past (their permission is granted to publish their words)
  • 11 x 11 inches - full-colour, hardcover photography book, professionally designed, with highest quality print and materials
  • Book printed in Canada by Friesens Book Division, one of the finest book manufacturers in North America, in business over 100 years
  • Fine art prints are with fade-resistant pigment inks on heavy archival cotton rag paper, intended for framing or other display
                                                            •••••••

Your support in buying a book, a fine art print, or in helping to spread the word is greatly appreciated.

Also please consider if this book may be an appropriate gift for anyone who is interested in the story or photographs.



Fine art prints

Fine art prints are available now. Please see the Perks on the right. Also if you want a size or combination you don't see, please email me at dion@earthpics.ca
All prints are on heavy archival cotton rag paper using fade-resistant pigment inks, and are suitable for framing and long-term display. Careful count is kept of prints that are sold, and they will be available in limited quantities.
Special care will be taken to protect the print during transit. They will be shipped flat, with reinforcement. Prices listed here include shipping, and are special prices offered only during this campaign.


The cost, and what you get in return:
  • The photography, writing, and most of the work in creating the book are done. This project was self-funded. All that remains is to publish it.
  • You will get a very high quality book. This book will be independently published because I want to ensure the quality of the book is of the highest standard, and the book is as I envision it, and printed in North America.
  • High-quality print jobs like this cost tens of thousands of dollars at a minimum, and a minimum of 1000 must be printed.
  • Delivery date for the book and prints are probably after Christmas, but I will do my very best to make it in time for Christmas. I will post updates to everyone on this Indiegogo page.

Photos below are of a prototype similar to the final version. Cover design will be an embedded photo, with embossed text.


The financial side-- and if the funding goal is exceeded:

  • The  minimum funding goal of $37,000 is needed to print a small run of 1000, and to cover the costs of shipping the books that are pre-ordered.
  • The displayed costs are all-inclusive, and the price of the book is comparable to other photo-books in bookstores. The print quality of this book will be higher than many photo-books in bookstores.
  • I've taken 8 long road trips across the prairies for this project. I've taken thousands of photos (from which I've chosen over 100 for this book). I've interviewed over 70 people, who have passionately told me about the past way of life in the rural prairies, and this project has been entirely self-funded. Most people agree it's an important topic that needs to be captured and preserved, before it's gone.
  • There is no upper limit. If the funding hits higher amounts, then the print run will be increased, and more features will be added to fit the budget. Everyone will benefit from this. This helps make this model of publishing a success.
  • Above all, I need help in spreading the word. The greatest challenge of this entire crowdfunding campaign is reaching enough people who might be interested.


Shipping and delivery info

  • Shipping costs are included in the prices, but in most cases I am subsidizing the cost, because shipping is more expensive than ever. I've lowered the cost for orders of more than one book per shipment, where bulk shipping is beneficial to both of us.
  • Shipping from Canada, to countries outside North America, is absurdly expensive. I've had to create separate categories with prices that reflect these costs. I don't make money from shipping, and it's usually at a loss to me.


My personal background

I grew up on a small farm in Saskatchewan, Canada. My grandparents were pioneers who came from Europe, and settled as homesteaders. While I grew up on our small family farm, exploring the whole area on our bicycles, nothing was beyond the limits of our imagination, and we invented anything we wanted. With all the neighbours, friends, and family who were living nearby, I had a blast.


My professional background
I've always had a blend of interests and employment across the arts and sciences. From the time I was a little kid growing up on the small family farm we had, I've been an inventor in spirit, and continually search for new ideas and personal growth.
I have been involved in photography, writing, prepress, and publishing for over 20 years. In these areas I've strived for high levels of production quality, and in ensuring that the story satisfies our eyes, our minds, and our hearts.
If this book is a success, then I will produce other books of similar quality, and I will help others tell their stories as well.


Please help spread the word, to make this possible

Books of fine quality and compelling stories easily sell thousands of copies, over time. But for this campaign to work, I need to have 500 or more presales before the deadline-- a very short period of time! The hard part is reaching large numbers of people quickly. That's why I need your help.

Your help in spreading the word is the key to the success of this, and is greatly appreciated.

  • tell your friends, family & others why this should be supported
  • sharing on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Pinterest, etc
  • spreading the word to newspapers, radio, and other media, or groups who might be interested
  • please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for helping to complete this long and historically essential project.

For more info visit: http://prairiesunset.ca/ 

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/prairiesunsetbook

Sincerely,

Dion Manastyrski

Their words are intertwined with full-page photos I've taken of what remains from this fascinating era of rapid change, of the past 100 years or so.
And there were surprises for me. Hidden within the words of the people were details that hinted of survival, self-sufficiency, and food preservation before the days of household electricity and refrigeration. And more.
The photography I've done for this book is of old buildings and other artifacts, left behind from this fascinating era. Much of this is rapidly vanishing. I believe that more of this needs to be somehow preserved, before it is gone forever.
                                                            •••••••







192 pages - full-page photos intermixed with quoted words of people who I talked to about the past (their permission is granted to publish their words)

11 x 11 inches - full-colour, hardcover photography book, professionally designed, with highest quality print and materials
Book printed in Canada by Friesens Book Division, one of the finest book manufacturers in North America, in business over 100 years
Fine art prints are with fade-resistant pigment inks on heavy archival cotton rag paper, intended for framing or other display
                                                            •••••••
Your support in buying a book, a fine art print, or in helping to spread the word is greatly appreciated.
Also please consider if this book may be an appropriate gift for anyone who is interested in the story or photographs.




Fine art prints


Fine art prints are available now. Please see the Perks on the right. Also if you want a size or combination you don't see, please email me at dion@earthpics.ca
All prints are on heavy archival cotton rag paper using fade-resistant pigment inks, and are suitable for framing and long-term display. Careful count is kept of prints that are sold, and they will be available in limited quantities.
Special care will be taken to protect the print during transit. They will be shipped flat, with reinforcement. Prices listed here include shipping, and are special prices offered only during this campaign.








The cost, and what you get in return:

 
The photography, writing, and most of the work in creating the book are done. This project was self-funded. All that remains is to publish it. 
You will get a very high quality book. This book will be independently published because I want to ensure the quality of the book is of the highest standard, and the book is as I envision it, and printed in North America.
High-quality print jobs like this cost tens of thousands of dollars at a minimum, and a minimum of 1000 must be printed.
Delivery date for the book and prints are probably after Christmas, but I will do my very best to make it in time for Christmas. I will post updates to everyone on this Indiegogo page.


Photos below are of a prototype similar to the final version. Cover design will be an embedded photo, with embossed text.





The financial side-- and if the funding goal is exceeded:


The  minimum funding goal of $37,000 is needed to print a small run of 1000, and to cover the costs of shipping the books that are pre-ordered.
The displayed costs are all-inclusive, and the price of the book is comparable to other photo-books in bookstores. The print quality of this book will be higher than many photo-books in bookstores.
I've taken 8 long road trips across the prairies for this project. I've taken thousands of photos (from which I've chosen over 100 for this book). I've interviewed over 70 people, who have passionately told me about the past way of life in the rural prairies, and this project has been entirely self-funded. Most people agree it's an important topic that needs to be captured and preserved, before it's gone.

There is no upper limit. If the funding hits higher amounts, then the print run will be increased, and more features will be added to fit the budget. Everyone will benefit from this. This helps make this model of publishing a success.

Above all, I need help in spreading the word. The greatest challenge of this entire crowdfunding campaign is reaching enough people who might be interested.





Shipping and delivery info


Shipping costs are included in the prices, but in most cases I am subsidizing the cost, because shipping is more expensive than ever. I've lowered the cost for orders of more than one book per shipment, where bulk shipping is beneficial to both of us.

Shipping from Canada, to countries outside North America, is absurdly expensive. I've had to create separate categories with prices that reflect these costs. I don't make money from shipping, and it's usually at a loss to me.





My personal background

I grew up on a small farm in Saskatchewan, Canada. My grandparents were pioneers who came from Europe, and settled as homesteaders. While I grew up on our small family farm, exploring the whole area on our bicycles, nothing was beyond the limits of our imagination, and we invented anything we wanted. With all the neighbours, friends, and family who were living nearby, I had a blast.






My professional background



I've always had a blend of interests and employment across the arts and sciences. From the time I was a little kid growing up on the small family farm we had, I've been an inventor in spirit, and continually search for new ideas and personal growth.
I have been involved in photography, writing, prepress, and publishing for over 20 years. In these areas I've strived for high levels of production quality, and in ensuring that the story satisfies our eyes, our minds, and our hearts.


If this book is a success, then I will produce other books of similar quality, and I will help others tell their stories as well.





Please help spread the word, to make this possible



 Books of fine quality and compelling stories easily sell thousands of copies, over time. But for this campaign to work, I need to have 500 or more presales before the deadline-- a very short period of time! The hard part is reaching large numbers of people quickly. That's why I need your help.
Your help in spreading the word is the key to the success of this, and is greatly appreciated. 
tell your friends, family & others why this should be supported
sharing on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Pinterest, etc
spreading the word to newspapers, radio, and other media, or groups who might be interested please use the Indiegogo share tools! 
 Thank you for helping to complete this long and historically essential project.For more info visit: http://prairiesunset.ca/ Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/prairiesunsetbook


Sincerely,Dion Manastyrski

story:
We are Galaxy, a group of photography professionals with almost two hundred years of combined experience in this field. We are lifelong fanatics who built darkrooms in our parent's bathrooms growing up. Our photo paper screening process is tougher than a supermodel's potential boyfriend screening process. We deeply lament the discontinuation of most direct positive paper manufacturers and understand that this void needs to be filled.

A few years ago we came across an Eastman Kodak book that covers the subject of direct positive photography using the company's Super Speed Direct Positive Paper as an example.

Everyone knows about direct positive photo paper nowadays. It has some nice features, but lacks a crucial quality: high speed. Every single shot is too time-consuming for large-format photographers. Fellow pinholers sometimes struggle for hours - needlessly. Plus if there's a moving object in the shot, the object turns out blurred (if it appears at all). And yet, 70 years ago, photographers had already come up with a solution, Kodak Super Speed Direct Positive Paper.

But this valuable paper disappeared from the market in 1970. Its secret was lost. To solve this problem, we decided to create a substitute paper, and we believe that we can make something even more exciting than our inspiration. We don't just want to bring back a discontinued photo paper. We want to make a better one, with higher sensitivity, better dynamic range, and easier development process that would be performed with room temperature solution.

Later, as we had a bunch of photographers on board, but no chemist, we found a production and research partner. By that time a lot of production moguls such as Kodak, Fuji, AGFA and Forte were gone. We had three choices among the remaining companies: Harman Technology, ltd., Foma Bohemia, ltd., and Slavich, Co. At that time, and now again, Harman had their own direct positive paper and we assumed that they wouldn't be eager to help create what could be seen as a competing product. So our choice was between Slavich and Foma. We sent out letters to both. Slavich replied. Foma did not.

We're fortunate to be able to work with Slavich. To begin with, they have a whole Photography Research and Development Institute next door. Also, Slavich lab technicians were quite cordial in helping with research and some of them even served as our photo models!

We're sure other photographers out there are interested in this paper. Greater interest from photo enthusiasts will allow us produce more photo paper packs at a better price. And if the demand is high enough, we will be able continue production of this photo paper on a regular basis.

  • RC-based (resin-coated) positive reversal photographic paper containing the largest amount of silver in the industry that allows to create distinctive half-tones and rich dark tones.
  • Very high ISO-speed which corresponds to about 120 film ISO. High speed enables shorter exposures — no more long sitting in front of the camera!
  • No need for a negative, you can shoot directly on the paper.  Adjusted reversal process. User-friendly.  
  • Fixed grade: contrast.  
  • Glossy embossed surface  
  • Will be available in the following sizes: 4×5″, 5×7″, 8×10″, 11×14″, 16×20″ 
  • Custom sizes may be available: 4×10″, 7×17″, 8×20″, 12×20″, 14×17″, 20×24″  and some rolls of different sizes
  • Very dark red light is required due to high speed.

 Spread the Good Word  
You have more influence than you think. It's in your power to significantly improve the chances of this project reaching its goal by spreading the news among your colleagues.

 Follow us on Social Media 
We'll be posting updates on Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr. Retwritting, reposting and subscribing will increase the chances this project's chances. Stay tuned!

 Keep taking pictures! 
Your loyalty to analog photography is what keeps this industry afloat. So please, keep taking pictures, keep developing them in the darkroom, and keep the magic alive!

story:
The Portrait Bus

Studio :: Photobooth :: Workstation
Business :: Artwork

...on wheels!

The Photo Booth: Enter through the accordion doors at the front of the bus. With a camera mount on one wall and a backdrop on the other, guests can step right up, use an iPad to run the camera, and exit out the back of the bus to retrieve their images: beautiful 5x7 prints.

 

Let me repeat that: 5x7 printed photos!

 

The Studio: Rotating the photo booth backdrop provides a more intimate setting for one-on-one portraiture at the rear of the bus. The bus will be equipped with full studio lights, so I can perfectly capture you.

 

The Workstation: A set of solar panels and deep cell batteries, coupled with my computer, turn this bus into a mobile workstation enabling me to edit while I travel.

 

The Business: With all that The Portrait Bus contains, I will be able to post up with the bus at weddings, events, art fairs, festivals, wineries, and more to produce beautiful 5x7 prints people can take home, right there, direct from the bus.

 

The Art: Given The Portrait Bus's proclivity for long drives, and it's unique containment of everything I need to work, I will be able to pursue my own artistic directives driving across, and photographing, America and the people whose path I cross.

 

Join the revolution.

We can bring back the print!

 

By donating to my campaign you are helping me #bringbacktheprint!

I am a firm believer that people should see their lives and also, be able to hold their tangible memories. Photographs are a way of capturing a point in time, yet we hardly print images these days. You should be able to take a step back in time and have photographic proof that you existed that isn't tethered to our phone.  We have the technology! With your help and my vision we can turn The Portrait Bus from a dream into a reality.

 

Still with me team? Great.

Here is the game plan. My total budget for bus renovations comes to $20,000 - I am here to raise $10,000 and I will match up to $10,000 with my own money.

Your donations will go to building out the bus: custom woodwork, solar panels and power grid, printer, paper, ink and gear that will be required for the photo booth. Funds will also go to website design and marketing. I am already halfway there and preparations to build have already begun but I need your help to finish!

Perks!

I have some amazing perks that I am excited to offer! If you donate as little as $15 you get stickers of the bus logo and #bringbacktheprint. If you have an event in your future you can book it through this campaign to get a discount on services. I am also offering tickets to the launch event where there will be music, snacks and most importantly a fully functioning photo booth bus that prints pictures! I will also be creating signed post cards of my special wanderlust series, specifically designed for this fundraiser. You can view these images in the gallery under the video. These are the 5 images you will receive in the post card pack.

What happens if you don't reach your goal? (Great questions everyone)

If I don’t reach my goal...(thoughtful pause)...  well that’s ok! I’m still going to take the funds generated and continue to build my dream. I believe in the bus and I believe in giving people tangible memories of themselves. I believe that everyone should value who they are and where they have been. I want to be the photographer who can give you prints, right then and there.

If you can’t help with a monetary donation, no worries! There are many other ways you can help The Portrait Bus. You can share this page with your network, you can tell your friend who is getting married about this sweet wedding combo deal. You can drop me a line and say that you enjoyed reading about this, because all artists who are putting their work out there need the validation to help makes us produce more art. Really, anything helps.

 

If you made it this far...

From the bottom of my heart THANK YOU SO MUCH for reading about my project and contributing in any way you can. I am so excited to get this dream moving and shaking and bring the bus to you!

See you on the road.

story:
Short Summary

**UPDATE** Thank you to all who have contributed so far. We have decided that, as well as donating a portion of all money raised during this fundraiser to Red Cross, we will also be providing a free family portrait and 8x10" print to anyone whose photos and albums were lost or destroyed in the recent floods.

The recent flooding has left our new studio in need of yet more renovations, as well as new backdrops, props and more. To raise funds in time for our grand opening, we're selling off goods and services at discounted prices:

  • Photography lessons
  • Portrait sessions
  • Prints from Raj's three days spent in the SE and SW of the city photographing the disaster
  • Rental time in our studio
  • VIP tickets to our grand opening celebration, where you'll get martinis, music, photo ops with local celebrities and more

But we're not the only ones who have been affected — in fact, we were lucky not to lose any of our electronics at all. So we've decided that for every $100 we raise, $20 will be donated to the Alberta Red Cross to help those who lost it all to these devastating waters.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Over the course of our renovations, we've faced setback after setback trying to take an old, slummy building and make it meet the province's building code as well as our own exacting standards. We were already behind schedule and over budget, and the flood was the straw that broke our collective back. We need help with finishing up Calgary's largest and most glamorous studio, and in exchange we'll give you all the goodies you need in your photo-related lives. A general breakdown of the average $100 donation:

  • First off, $20 goes to the Red Cross to help other Alberta flood victims
  • $20 to $30 goes to our overheads while we keep supplying eager learners with lessons, daycares with picture days and family portraits with our mobile studio, as well as costs related to your donation incentive (lessons, portraits, prints, etc.)
  • $40 goes towards our renovations
  • $10 to $20 is put towards making the most epic Grand Opening celebration Calgary's ever seen

 

The Impact

By helping us rebuild, you're helping us bring these beautiful realities to Calgary:

The Rental Studio: Calgary's a city of creatives, and not every hobbyist or amateur photographer can afford to buy all the top-of-the-line equipment they see in Pop Photo magazines. And not every photographer knows where to go when they want to do an in-studio session. That's why we've put such a focus on making our massive studio rental-friendly; as they say in Latin America, nuestro casa es tu casa. By providing more than any other rental studio in the area, and at a more affordable price than most, we feel we can give back to the community and support budding talent in a way we weren't when we were learning:

  • Three lighting setups tailored to your style, including up to eight studio strobes or five off-camera hotshoe flashes, all wirelessly triggered by any standard-hotshoe or PC-enabled camera
  • Your choice of a rainbow of 10-12' wide, 20-36' long backdrops, including green screen
  • Rent one of three 13x20' bays, or get a bit of extra privacy and breathing room by renting the entire 1000 sq. ft. studio area by the hour or by the day

Portraits: It's easy for a mall studio to get stuck in a rut: Nail down the lighting system and tear off the adjustment knobs. Lock the camera. Teach a monkey and/or high-school student to focus the camera, fire the shutter and sell print bundles, and you can sit on the beach in Rio and collect profit cheques. But what does that mean for you? Sub-par family portraits. And that just won't do. At Scratch, we don't have employees. We have partners, each with a deep and thorough knowledge of lighting and technical photography. Also, we're fun. Would you rather have an off-centre, awkwardly-cropped, pose-and-grin family portrait or a series of dramatically-lit photos of each member of your family drop-kicking a mango? Odd example, but I'm sure you get the idea. We like to do the latter.

Advertising and Stock: Yes, Calgary is home to iStockPhoto. But what if you don't want to use the same obscure stock photo as your competitor for your ad? Want something that looks a little more...local? Personal? We do that. Have you seen the photo our lead photographer took of his own baby girl screaming in a vat of pasta to help sell vegetarianism? No? It's on our site. Either way, what we're saying is that we hear your message and we commit. Need some fluorescent paint thrown at some live doves while meat cookies explode from the diamond-encrusted background? No problem. Need a photo of your star employee with the Calgary skyline in the background? Done. Need a model and/or hair and makeup services to capture the perfect scene as you've seen it in your dreams? We've got you covered. Just give us a call.

VIP and Promotional sessions: Our studio comes complete with a shower, makeup counter, hair and makeup services, and all the coffee and martinis you could ask for. With a VIP session with Scratch, you'll be pampered and primmed ahead of your photo session, including an in-studio session as well as up to four other locations around the city — all reached via limo. Perfect for talent, executives of any kind and honeymooners.

Weddings: Every wedding package we offer includes a three-location engagement session, as well as an hour of post-honeymoon studio time; makeup and hair services and photo booths at your reception are a little extra but well worth the investment. Got something out of the ordinary? Good. Themed weddings are our specialty.

Etc: We do it all. Daycares, grad photos, band promos, event coverage, budoir, babies, architectural; photojournalism to product photography. But we could do it all better if our studio was finished.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can’t contribute, we hear you. But if you just can't contribute, yet still believe in bringing a new level of photography to Calgary, there are other ways you can help:

  • Tell your rich mother, grandmother or significant other to contribute. We have perks
  • Tell your rich friends all about us
  • Tell your other friends about us
  • Share this campaign on every one of the pages where you have an online presence
  • Stay tuned for the Grand Opening date, and then stop by during that.
  • Convince Nenshi to come to our party

And that’s all there is to it. Thanks for listening, we're looking forward to seeing you around.

Need some fluorescent paint thrown at some live doves while meat cookies explode from the diamond-encrusted background? No problem. Need a photo of your star employee with the Calgary skyline in the background? Done. Need a model and/or hair and makeup services to capture the perfect scene as you've seen it in your dreams? We've got you covered. Just give us a call.
VIP and Promotional sessions: Our studio comes complete with a shower, makeup counter, hair and makeup services, and all the coffee and martinis you could ask for. With a VIP session with Scratch, you'll be pampered and primmed ahead of your photo session, including an in-studio session as well as up to four other locations around the city — all reached via limo. Perfect for talent, executives of any kind and honeymooners.
Weddings: Every wedding package we offer includes a three-location engagement session, as well as an hour of post-honeymoon studio time; makeup and hair services and photo booths at your reception are a little extra but well worth the investment. Got something out of the ordinary? Good. Themed weddings are our specialty.
Etc: We do it all. Daycares, grad photos, band promos, event coverage, budoir, babies, architectural; photojournalism to product photography. But we could do it all better if our studio was finished.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can’t contribute, we hear you. But if you just can't contribute, yet still believe in bringing a new level of photography to Calgary, there are other ways you can help:

Tell your rich mother, grandmother or significant other to contribute. We have perks
Tell your rich friends all about us
Tell your other friends about us
Share this campaign on every one of the pages where you have an online presence
Stay tuned for the Grand Opening date, and then stop by during that.
Convince Nenshi to come to our party


And that’s all there is to it. Thanks for listening, we're looking forward to seeing you around.

story:
"Those who dare having a project in life, foregoing everything to live their Personal Legend, will end up achieving anything. The important thing is to keep the fire in your heart and be strong to overcome hard moments." - Paulo Coelho 

MY STORY

I, Bodeene Berrevoets, an aspiring professional photographer residing in Portland, Oregon, am seeking a bit of help in procuring the means to acquire a professional SLR camera (a Nikon D700). Bodeene Berrevoets Photography simply wants to get down to business! But that's only possible with a professional SLR camera. In order to be competitive, to be able to shoot in all conditions, and to offer the highest quality images and products (nothing but the best results), I must shoot with a full frame high end camera (in addition to various professional lenses and lighting units) - that's the bottom  line! This level of equipment is expensive but it will be reflected in the quality of results I deliver.

YOUR LOVE

My beloved family and friends, your help (even a pledge of $5) will help enable my dream of a highly creative and sought-after wedding photography business become a reality. I have the vision and the passion and I'm ready (boy, am I ready) to get started, but I just need the right tool.

WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

I need $2,500, which will go entirely to the acquisition of a Nikon D700. If I don't reach my goal by April 30, 2012, I will continue saving all my pennies in order to meet the goal. What You Will Get in return for even the smallest donations are rewards! I am offering gifts in return for your generous donations!

story:
Photo Workshops by Kevin+Pansa

Pansa and I are photographers and photography teachers based in northern Thailand. We teach in-person workshops and online.

I started my career as a news photographer and it has spanned more than three decades with experience in editorial, commercial, documentary, travel, and many other photography genres. Pansa is a travel, documentary and art photographer and a fine teacher.

We love passing on our passion so much we are building a boutique resort in rural northern Thailand where we can create and teach our workshops. Come and experience it with us.

If you enjoy photography and travel we are the perfect vacation choice for you. Come, stay with us, experience exploring northern Thailand while learning to capture your adventures with stunning photographs that will be worth publishing.

The location, just next to Doi Inthanon National Park, (one of the most popular national parks in Thailand,) is prime for photography. The park is full of wonderful places to photograph and presents endless opportunity to learn. We are connecting with local guides and our immediate community to join together to enrich your experience staying with us. It's not only about photography, it's about discovering more about the culture and creating adventures you will cherish for life.

And, if you can' make it here to stay and learn with us in person, you can choose our new online photography course. It's designed to give you an experience of learning photography from professionals in such a way that does not need to interrupt your lifestyle or require long sessions of dedicated study.

As we continue to develop our teaching resources you have more and more opportunity to learn at our skill level and in your own time frame.

Keep reading to discover how our Indiegogo perks will help you grow your skills and become a more accomplished photographer.

Suan Sook Boutique Resort

We have purchased 3000 square meters (just under 1 acre) of land and begun building a boutique homestay/studio/gallery and guest accommodation. We are also incorporating Glamping (glamorous camping) on our property. All aimed at providing a base for our travel photography workshops.

The organic gardens and orchard are being laid out to be as photogenic as possible so that at every turn there's a new photo opportunity. We will be providing our guests with home cooked meals and the option to learn some country Thai cooking during their stay with us.

Surrounding us are farms and orchards and it's a wonderful location to explore on foot or by bicycle. Further up the mountain there's walking tracks, waterfalls, caves, hill tribe markets and villages, look-out points the Doi Inthanon Royal Project gardens and much more.

The Complete Photography Experience

A course of 365 easy steps and broken down into manageable, bite-sized lessons so it's easily digested and enjoyable. Don't worry! It's not a regular course you must finish all the lesson to gain the benefit from. We've designed it in modules so where ever you are on your photographic journey you can pick an appropriate module and continue to learn and grow as a photographer.

Based on the well known 365-day photography challenge this course is fashioned to encourage you to use your camera frequently. Anyone who's participated in our workshops will know this is something I am big on. The more frequently you are using your camera the more you will get to know the controls and settings, the more you will enjoy photography and the more creative you will become with it.

Lessons consist of essential teaching presented in video format, along with example photos, diagrams, and animations to clearly illustrate each step being taught. Accompanying each lesson is an experiment so you can put into practice what your learning and solidify it into your experience.

Each step is short and to the point, taking only about 5 minutes to digest, (so ideal for watching on your smartphone as you commute to school or work.) The experiments can take as little as ten minutes or as long as you have time for, (easy to work on during your lunch break.)

For more details about this course please visit our website.

Why Are We Crowdfunding?

We have a dream of creating a most beautiful and photogenic surrounding for our guests to come and enjoy. Either to just be in and relax or to be busy in photographing a vast selection of flowers, birds, insects, landscapes etc. and also enjoying what the nearby national park has to offer.

Our desire is to share our passion for photography and for northern Thailand. Being able to teach people about the local culture, cuisine and lifestyle will bring our guests into a unique travel experience. Teaching them how to record their memories with stunning photographs will enable them to cherish the experience forever.

Check out the regular building progress videos we've been making.
 

The Impact You Will Have

Funding our project with your help will allow us to employ locals to get the work done for us quickly and also install an efficient water management system so we can irrigate our organic gardens, (which is vital during the dry season.)

We are already becoming part of the local community. The district head man has reached out to us and invited us to integrate into village life, (which has totally put aside any anxiety I had of moving to this rural location and being accepted as a foreigner here.) He's impressed on us to that we are expected to join in with village life, smile and talk with people, go to their funerals when they die, take part in community events and generally participate. We are thrilled about this! We have already been employing the locals to work with us and want to do this more frequently as it genuinely helps us become a part of the community.

By employing locals we will:

  • More readily integrate into the local community
  • Provide much needed additional income for low earning local farmers
  • Complete the landscaping in a realistic time frame
  • Free us up to complete our new course

Depending on how successful our campaign is we will also be able to drill a well, install a solar energy system and build further guest accommodation.

Becoming Local

Having already made friends with quite a lot of the locals and with the recent encouragement of the district headman to integrate into the community, we are feeling better than ever about being in the location we've chosen to build.

Most everyone in the area farms rice and peanuts or has a longan orchard and many are curious as to how we plan to use our land. We've talked with them about what we do and that we'll be offering accommodation. They are watching us and are interested to learn how to emulate our business model. Even before we bought our land some of them have been researching how the village can become part of the booming tourism industry and have visited other districts where farmers are offering homestay accommodation to tourists.

Being so close to the Doi Inthanon National Park it is an ideal place to be offering accommodation because the park is so popular with both Thai and foreign tourists, but lodging within the park is scarce.

We are more than happy to share our experience and encouragement with them to help build up the local economy. Many of their children are now educated and no longer interested in working the family farm, so it makes good business sense to provide accommodation in such a beautiful part of Thailand.

Here's How You Can Help

Check out our cool perks and the great discounts only available through our Indiegogo campaign.

If you can't contribute financially we'd love it if you can consider these ways you can help:

  • Share our campaign on your social media
  • Email your friends and family who love to travel and/or love photography and give them a direct link to the campaign, (I'm sure you'll know some who do.)
  • Share the link to our campaign in relevant places such as photography websites you post on, travel blogs etc (but, please, only where it's relevant.)

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Davor Zupičić. I'm a Cinematography and Photography student at the Academy of Dramatic Art of the University of Zagreb, Croatia.

I've been working on 35mm film photography for the past eight years and continue to choose it for important projects.

As a topic of a photographic essay, I have decided to study the need for an organized animal shelter. Out of several major cities in Croatia, the capital city Zagreb is the best example. It has Dumovec, a city funded and organized animal shelter. Other cities, however, do not follow in its path.

Cities such as Rijeka, Dubrovnik, Zadar, Slavonski brod fail to provide better conditions. Dubrovnik is world-famous for its tourism and wonderful scenery and in all the wealth the tourist season brings, they have no animal shelter. Rijeka has a citizen-organized shelter which is on the verge of being illegal - if the city does not have a shelter it can also arrange to have an existing facility take care of the animals (the shelter in Lič, relatively close to Rijeka). Slavonski Brod is an example where politics have had their say - millions have been invested into building the shelter and still, after several years of construction, it is not operational.

It is very important to focus on this issue - the shelter in the town Beli Manastir has been recently closed for horrendous living conditions (dogs eating each other). Check out the article, even if you don't understand the language, photographs are powerful enough.

What I Need & What You Get

Like any photography project, materials are costly and consist of 35mm films (Fuji Pro400H), C-41 Development and Scanning of the negatives.

Also included are the travelling costs from Zagreb to Dumovec. As the project is finalized, I will organize public exhibitions.

Perks that you can acquire are prints of my previous photographs. For now, you can see my work on my 500px.com portfolio.

Funding required for this project is 1000€ and will be split into photographic materials, travelling costs and final prints for exhibition.

ADDITION TO THIS SECTION SINCE THE FIRST UPDATE

I have received several questions regarding funding - I want to clear it up. It is also in the first campaign update, so here it goes:

The required funding ($1000) reflects the following: 

  1. purchasing one 35mm film Fuji PRO400H which in Croatia is sold for $12 in stores, but can be bought online for about $9. I have been making photographs on film since 2010 when I first picked up a film camera and simply love the medium. I believe a story like this should be and deserves to be told on film. This specific film is wonderful - it provides beautiful colors and good results even if technically the photograph is not perfect.
  2. After a film roll is completed, it needs to be developed in standardized chemical process called C-41. Development and a basic scan of each film costs about $8. Basic scan means that this quality is purely for preview - this photograph cannot be printed on a large scale while retaining its characteristics and information - even on a very small format, loss of quality is noticeable. Quality of the print, among other things can be connected with the quality of the scan. A high resolution scan is priced at around $12 - but fortunately I can scan my negatives at the Academy where I study photography. I use the previews to see which photographs are good.
  3. Travelling costs. Fortunately, I live close to the center of Zagreb and own a car (my parents'). One round-trip costs about $6 if only fuel consumption is calculated. This cost is an estimate, but a fairly accurate one.
  4. Printing costs. In order to have an exhibition, I want to produce quality prints. For now, however, it is impossible to put a price for now. Quality prints are done on Hahnemühle paper and there are several print shops in Zagreb and prices there range from $20/print to $30/print, and that's not even counting the frame (if  it is even involved in the end). For now, I'd ask you to set aside this section as it clearly needs some testing. I need to run some tests once I have the final photographs.

In conclusion, these are the planned expenses. I can't tell you that I'm going to shoot through 100 rolls of film since film is not meant to be used like that for a project like this. Film is a slow, beautiful medium, it takes time and devotion. Since I started photographing this subject, I have gone through 7 films - and I was being extremely careful with that because I was paying for everything by myself. I plan out my photographs and have a vision what I'm trying to capture, even though I want to be surprised as well by what I find through the viewfinder. If you want to put it into strict numbers, one film is a combined expense of $17 (providing that the scan included is for previews and not the final scan for which I will have to invest hours into in order to make the photograph completely ready for print).

I will be spending more and more time in the shelter. So far every time I have been there, I stayed for a couple of hours. I want to go more often and spend more time. One very important aspect of this project is to follow the employees who bring the abandoned animals into the shelter so I will be going with them as well.

Also, an important notice: some of you might notice that the goal for this project is based on flexible funding - this means that even if the goal is not achieved, the campaign will receive the funds. You can read more about it here. Short version is: I will accept all the help I can get. In example for fixed funding, if this campaign raised less than the goal, all the donations would be refunded and then this project would definitely be extremely hard to complete on my own.

The Impact

It has been known through the decades of journalistic photography that a photograph carries strong influence. It has the power to change things, shift focus. With my photographs, I don't intend on focusing on the "cuteness" of animals - but on the need for basic living conditions and healthcare.

Risks & Challenges

I realize you're not donating directly to a shelter. You're donating to a photography project which puts focus on the issue of conditions in which animals live inside these shelters. Imagine if you lived in a shack with occasional food and a visitor or two. This is not normal - everyone needs  to feel safe and these animals are no different.

Consider helping in any way you can. You can choose my photographs through perks - my previous photographic series Lujzijana is about the old road that connected cities of Rijeka and Zagreb.

I plan to include new perks regarding the upcoming photographs so stay tuned for updates!

Project Timeline

As this project grows, I have prepared a project timeline in order to help you see how quickly you can expect to see specific results.

For now, this is the plan. One adjustment I might do is that I'd like to begin visiting other shelters in Croatia. This would be a big step for me so I will play it pretty close to the chest. For now it will remain on the drawing board as I first want to complete this project and then after it's done, I would maybe expand in that direction.

Infographic vector created by Freepik 

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize not everyone can help financially. If you have unused Fuji Pro400H 35mm films, every little bit helps. Also I'd like to ask you to share as much as you can - think of every animal organization which cares about shelter conditions.

After everything, I'd like to thank you for reading this! I hope this encourages you to get more involved with helping animals and investing in animal shelters. They all need care, medical assistance and food. They're like us!

Thank you.

For now, this is the plan. One adjustment I might do is that I'd like to begin visiting other shelters in Croatia. This would be a big step for me so I will play it pretty close to the chest. For now it will remain on the drawing board as I first want to complete this project and then after it's done, I would maybe expand in that direction.
Infographic vector created by Freepik 

Other Ways You Can Help
I realize not everyone can help financially. If you have unused Fuji Pro400H 35mm films, every little bit helps. Also I'd like to ask you to share as much as you can - think of every animal organization which cares about shelter conditions.
After everything, I'd like to thank you for reading this! I hope this encourages you to get more involved with helping animals and investing in animal shelters. They all need care, medical assistance and food. They're like us!
Thank you.

story:
How it began

In June last year Photography Center of Thessaloniki arranged a workshop with the young Danish photographer Jacob Aue Sobol from Magnum Photos, in a small village called Lafkos near the town of Volos in central Greece. In this workshop attended 20 of Greece's most talented photographers. Jacob gave them the assignment HOME. Photograph your home in a city you don't know, not your physical home but your mental end emotional home. The photographers worked for five days with the topic of HOME, photographing the entire village, the people, the streets, the animals, each other, everything was photographed and a home took shape. 

Photography Center of Thessaloniki have since the workshop been in dialogue with Jacob and together with editor Sun Hee Engesltoft and producer Stinus Duch Andersen they have developed this project. Jacob Aue Sobol and Sun Hee Engesltoft will curate an exhibition of images from the workshop and up til now titled HOME. The photographers have worked on the theme since last summer and is now ready to show there work. The municipality of Thessaloniki has granted a fantastic exhibition place in Thessaloniki called Casa Bianca in January 2015 (12.01.2015 - 10/02 2015) with the official opening the 19.01.2015. 

Jacob Aue Sobol will be present at the opening and keep an open master class presentation and a portfolio review to everyone interested.

The participating greek photographers are:

Manos Chrisovergis, Michalis Kalaitzakis, Lily Zoumpouli, Ariadni Pediotaki, Andreas Paradise, Eleni Onassoglou, Lukas Vasilikos, Georgia Panakia, Panagiotis Skalkotos, Thanasis Karatzas, Christos Vatalachos, Dareos Khalili, Panos Arvanitakis, Dimitra Hatzipavlou, Thanassis Raptis, Efthimis Mouratidis, Vasilis Karkatselis, Dimitris Symeonidis, Nikos Kotzampasakis, Sakis Dazanis, Maria Kappatou

© Dareos Khalili

©Andreas Paradise

© Ariadni Pediotaki

© Ariadni Pediotaki

The exhibition

The exhibition will feature 20 Greek photographers work on the theme HOME curated by Magnum photographer Jacob Aue Sobol and editor by Sun Hee Engesltoft. The photographers have worked on the theme HOME since the workshop last summer and has now each completed a series dealing with HOME. How is HOME in Greece right now? What is HOME to me? How does is look? How does HOME feel? Is HOME a place i want to stay? All these questions and many more have the artist asked themselves, and the exhibition is the result of their search for the meaning of HOME. 

Each photographer will show 1-15 pictures in different sizes printet on Hahnemühle 280gr fine art paper. The exhibition will be at a venue called Casa Bianca in the city of Thessaloniki in the central part of Greece. Thessaloniki is the second largest city in Greece after Athens with a population around 800.000. The venue Casa Bianca is the best exhibition place in Thessaloniki and used to host some of the most prominent exhibitions in Greece.  The Casa Bianca is a grand villa built in 1912 and is now funcitioning as  a municipal art gallery. The exhibition space is four rooms total around 70m2. 

We also want to produce a catalogue or a small book. The catalogue will feature a selection of the exhibited work and will be around 60 pages, including text by Jacob and text by the Photography Center of Thessaloniki. 

An exhibition like this cost money and therefor we are asking for your help. We need money for printing the exhibition, for designing and printing the catalogue, for return flights for Jacob and accommodation. 

We can only make this with your help

Our dream of making this exhibition can only come true with your help. Everything is set to go, the only thing missing is the funding. It is extremely difficult to raise funding for culture in Greece after the financial crisis and artists are suffering from this. It has up to now been impossible to raise money for this project, so now we hope for your help to see this exhibition come to life. 

The  project will also contribute to strengthening the bonds between Danish and Greek photography and bring Danish and Greek art closer together, learn from each other, creating and strengthening new communities and become a breeding ground for cultural exchange. 

© Dareos Khalili

© Sakis Dazanis

© Eleni Onassoglou


© Eleni Onassoglou

© Lily Zoumpouli

© Lily Zoumpouli

© Lily Zoumpouli

Jacob Aue Sobol on the HOME project :

Home is a place of memories. It is where we have our roots. It is a place we keep returning to. If we want to learn more about ourselves and the world we live in, this is where we look – in our own backyard. The place where our personality is shaped and dreams were built.

»Photograph your Home in a village you don’t know and where you have never been before. Show me what Home means to you«

Two years ago I began my own Home project. 

In my search to find a way to begin this project I found two pictures that inspired me. The first taken three years ago of my twin brother putting his hand on my grandmothers forehead as she was dying, and the other of my ex-girlfriends sister giving birth in Greenland back in 2002. For me the obvious existential character of these two images started off this project called Home. And so, since April 2011 I have been photographing family, friends, and acquaintances, but also encounters with strangers that I feel a connection with, and who invited me inside their apartments or houses. 

In my workshop in Lafkos I gave the artist the same assignment or inspiration. Photograph your Home in a village you don’t know and where you have never been before. Show me what Home means to you. Not how it looks like but how it feels. The project turned out amazing.  

In the process the artists did not only use their camera to take pictures, but also as an instrument to create intimacy and closeness in a poetic, direct and unsentimental way. In spite of photography’s seemingly concrete form they exposed layers in people that are not immediately visible, but nonetheless shape who we are and give meaning to our lives. 

This is their Home

Jacob Aue Sobol

© Manos Chrisovergis

  © Panagiotis Skalkotos

© Panagiotis Skalkotos

© Sakis Dazanis

 © Christos Vatalachos

© Panos Arvanitakis

© Panos Arvanitakis

© Panos Arvanitakis

©Maria Kappatou

©Maria Kappatou

© Maria Kappatou

© Efthimis Mouratidis

© Thanasis Karatzas

About

Jacob Aue Sobol

Jacob is a member of Magnum Photos. Yossi Milo Gallery in New York, Rita Castelotte Gallery in Madrid and RTR Gallery in Paris also represent him.

Jacob was born in Denmark, in 1976 and grew up in Brøndby Strand in the suburbs south of Copenhagen. He lived as an exchange student in Strathroy, Canada from 1994-95 and as a hunter and fisherman in Tiniteqilaaq, Greenland from 2000-2002. In Spring 2006 he moved to Tokyo, staying there 18 months before returning to Denmark in August 2008. He now lives and works in Copenhagen.

After studying at the European Film College, Jacob was admitted to Fatamorgana, the Danish School of Documentary and Art Photography in 1998. There he developed a unique, expressive style of black-and-white photography, which he has since refined and further developed.
In the autumn of 1999 he went to live in the settlement Tiniteqilaaq on the East Coast of Greenland. Over the next three years he lived mainly in this township with his Greenlandic girlfriend Sabine and her family, living the life of a fisherman and hunter but also photographing. The resultant book Sabine was published in 2004 and the work was nominated for the 2005 Deutsche Börse Photography Prize.
In the summer of 2005 Jacob traveled with a film crew to Guatemala to make a documentary about a young Mayan girl’s first journey to the ocean. The following year he returned by himself to the mountains of Guatemala where he met the indigenous family Gomez-Brito. He stayed with them for a month to tell the story of their everyday life. The series won the First Prize Award, Daily Life Stories, World Press Photo 2006.

In 2006 he moved to Tokyo and during the next two years he created the images from his resent book I, Tokyo. The book was awarded the Leica European Publishers Award 2008 and published by Actes Sud (France), Apeiron (Greece), Dewi Lewis Publishing (Great Britain), Edition Braus (Germany), Lunwerg Editores (Spain), Peliti Associati (Italy) and Mets & Schilt (The Netherlands)
In 2008 Jacob started working in Bangkok and in 2009 in Copenhagen. Both projects will be published as books in 2013. Jacob is currently working on the project Arrivals and Departures - a journey from Moscow to Beijing - in co-operation with Leica Camera.

Photography Centre of Thessaloniki

Photography Centre of Thessaloniki is a non-profit company running for the last twenty years in Thessaloniki, Greece, in the Balkans, Europe  and lately across the world.  Photography Centre of Thessaloniki became known due to the long struggle for artistic photograph.
Photography Centre of Thessaloniki has collaborated with almost all of the museums in North Greece as the Photography Museum of Thessaloniki, the State Museum of Contemporary Art, Museum of Byzantine Culture, Water Supply Museum of Thessaloniki, Folk life Museum of Xanthi, with foreign institutes (Goethe Institute, French Institute, Italian Institute), as well as with many municipalities and prefectures.

story:
An art exhibit & installation exploring the iconic photograph, A Great Day In Harlem through the lens of the A Great Day In Atlanta and little known legendary photographer, John Crooms as a tribute to Atlanta's art renaissance, and art communities across the globe.

I am Kemi Bennings, visionary, producer, poet, curator and arts activist residing in Atlanta and I have been working in the Atlanta arts scene since 1995.  I am passionate about shining the spotlight on the works of independent artists, and unsung art heroes, as well as, preserving what will one day be recognized as our legacy.  I produce thought-provoking and entertaining event programming that moves, touches and inspires people. Ten years ago, I was given a vision.  It was a powerful project that allowed an opportunity to reflect and recognize the power of artists in Atlanta and art communities in general…here is my story… 

In December 2002, I sat in the companyof artist trailblazers from the Washington, D.C. area; a hand full of artists, musicians, dream makers, movers, shakers and believers in faith. During the conversation, I noticed a framed picture of the iconic photograph “A Great Day In Harlem” mounted on the wall just behind the group.  As I sat and listened, and contributed to the dialogue, a common thread of Atlanta and Harlem began to niche itself out and weave its way into part of the African American legacy. Artists emerged like the days of the Harlem Renaissance, transcribing the “writing on the wall” into art and music and song. What I realized, whether we are conscious of it or not, is that in each moment, we are creating history; a unique story that will one day be recognized as a contribution to an era of our life’s importance. My thoughts then shifted to Atlanta.  It was in this moment that I envisioned a re-creation of this photograph as "A Great Day In Atlanta" based upon the vibrant Atlanta arts scene, and as a representation of what was happening in arts communities across the globe…

I've known John Crooms since the mid 90's, before the advent of the digital photography. I have always known him to be quiet, very humble and selfless when it came to photography. Most people amongst the scene can attest that we'd see John nearly EVERYWHERE; from all the premiere events to lesser advertised events or performances that were supposed to be on the "hush" or the "hum bug".  A man of few words, and an avid lover of arts and music, John was always in the know….  Has captured many ground-breaking artists, musicians, innovators, singers, etc...

Just so happened, I saw John at Moods Music (one of the last independent music stores on the planet) just before my leaving for Washington, D.C.  During our quick, but meaningful chat, I asked John when he was going to have an exhibit. I also impressed upon the magnitude and importance of his photographic contributions.  John silently shrugged, modestly sharing that he’d not ever had a solo art exhibit, that he'd get around to it "one" day…  

When I returned, it was as if two puzzle pieces had come together; that John would be the photographer befitting to capture A Great Day In Atlanta, and A Great Day In Atlanta being the precursor and the catalyst to honor the work of photographic historian, John Crooms.

Now ten years later, having captured the original 2003 AGDIA photograph, and this year’s 10-year anniversary re-creation, we have come back to finish what we started; to give John Crooms a proper solo art exhibit!

Check out this article on the project - http://clatl.com/cribnotes/archives/2013/03/19/...

Here's the skinny...

As his first ever solo art exhibit, I want to make this special for John Crooms.  A Great Day In Atlanta (AGDIA) will be both and photography exhibit and installation.  With the inaugural A Great Day In Atlana photograph (2003) and the unveiling of the 10th Anniversary photograph (2013) being the foundation, AND YOUR HELP, we will tell the story Atlanta's renaissance through the work of John Crooms. I will use people in the photographs; their careers, works, past events, etc. as inspiration in what will comprise the actual photographs used in the exhibit. I will then incorporate multimedia aspects, captions, things that might be now be considered our artifacts in representing the people in the arts and music scene, pop-up performances, a nice reception and congratulatory toast...that being said, we need $8000, which will go towards: printing and mounting photographs

  • exhibit and installation materials
  • creating supporting multimedia components
  • securing props and artifacts
  • all aspects of the production
  • AND if we are lucky, we can print a select number of coffee table books 

***If by some small chance we don't reach our goal, we will most likely have to condense the number of photographs and/or portions of the exhibit, but we will still present a memorable exhibit of John Crooms work. Of course I am shooting for to complete our greatest vision!!! :-)

The Impact

Since the 1996 Olympics, Atlanta transformed into a performing arts mecca of the southern region and later in the early 2000’s the city was known internationally as the esteemed place for the entertainment industry to acquire talent. According to John Crooms: “In the late 80’s early 90’s Atlanta was really emerging and bubbling and it was a fresh new frontier that was happening. I felt I was a part of it and I wanted to be a part of it.” What we are seeing in today, is as a result of the innovative works of many of the creators, visionaries, pioneers, tastemakers and independant artists, many of whom are pictured in A Great Day In Atlanta. Through the lens of A Great Day In Atlanta, we experience a mirocosm of what is happening in art scenes around the globe. 

Just for the record, and so you know the passion behind my work, my last curation was the acclaimed photographic art exhibit/installation entitled Ministers Of Sound, which opened February 2013, featuring the work of photographer, Annette Brown. A unique tribute to DJ's, through the inspiration of my late father, Ministers Of Sound is a parallel and contrast of DJ's to ministers; modern day, indigineous  and/or spiritual leaders.  In this installation, the space was transformed into a sanctuary, with spiritual aesthetics; stained glass windows, the pulpit (which was the DJ booth), ushers, etc.  This ongoing exhibit received local and national coverage.  Here are a couple of the articles.

Creative Loafing Atlanta  - http://clatl.com/atlanta/ministers-of-sound/Con...

NBC's The Grio - http://thegrio.com/2013/02/25/photo-exhibition-...

 

Pockets a little thin? No worries, you can still help us make this project a reality!

You're not being able to contribute, doesn't mean you can't be apart of A Great Day In Atlanta...

HELP US SPREAD THE WORD...help us by posting on any of the social media outlets (Facebook, Twitter, etc.), send to your family and friends.  Also, Indiegogo has share tools too!!!
