story:
EVENTOS DEPENDIENTES 

What is all this? - Y esto?

My name is Daniel Avilés. I'm a cinematographer and still photographer based in Quito-Ecuador. Welcome to my project "Eventos Dependientes" a photobook and photography exhibition.

Mi nombre es Daniel Avilés, soy director de fotografía de cine y fotógrafo. Actualmente vivo en Quito-Ecuador y este es mi primer libro y exhibición fotográficas. Bienvenidos a mi proyecto "Eventos Dependientes".

When I think about the pictures in this book, I also think a lot about probability: the chain of events that had to occur for me to have a camera in those specific moments, in those places, among those people. I think about the road you must travel to arrive to certain images, to a certain instant you want to remember. I think about how we select and build our own memory.

Cuando pienso en las fotos que están en este libro, pienso mucho en la probabilidad: pienso en la cadena de eventos que tuvieron que pasar para estar con una cámara en aquellos momentos, en esos lugares,con esas personas. Pienso en todo el recorrido que uno hace para llegar a ciertas imágenes y a ciertos instantes que quiere recordar.Pienso en cómo componemos nuestra memoria.

With your help. I could be able to finally acomplished a project that has been in my head for a long time. It's been a great journey and I am very close to reach the goal. But I need an extra lift.

Con su ayuda, finalmente podré completar el proyecto que ha estado en mi cabeza por mucho tiempo. Ha sido un viaje largo y estoy muy cerca de finalizar. Sin embargo, necesito un último empujón.

So, how can I help? - Entonces, cómo puedo ayudar?

I have dedicated my time and savings to work in this project for the last year and a half. The book is designed and ready to print. I've also been invited to exhibit my work in a local art gallery in November. However, on this final stretch, I still need some funds to pull it off. Here is when you come in! If I can raise $3000 dollars with this campaign, I will reach the ammount to finish my project. 

He dedicado mi tiempo y ahorros trabajando en este proyecto el último año y medio. El libro está diseñado y listo para la imprenta. Además, he sido invitado por una galería local a exhibir mis fotografías en Noviembre. Sin embargo, en este tramo final del camino, necesito de fondos adicionales para completar todo. Aquí es donde entras tú y me das una mano! Si logro levantar los $3000 que me hacen falta, el libro y la exposición serán una realidad.

There are great rewards waiting for you! Please check the perks section of the campaign to see what things you can get in exchange for your support. Some of them include: signed photo prints, digital-wallpapers and a deluxe hard cover-edition copy of the book! All of them delivered to your door.

Hay varias recompensas por su ayuda al proyecto! Revisen la sección "perks" de la campaña, ahi encontrarán varios items que pueden ser suyos: desde ampliaciones firmadas de las fotografías, salvapantallas digitales, hasta una copia de la edición de lujo-pasta dura del libro. Todo esto, cómodamente enviado a tu puerta.

I'm as broke as you are. How else can I help? - No tengo plata, cómo puedo ayudar?

You can tell your friends about the campaign, send them emails with the link, post the campaign in facebook, twitter or any other social network. The more people knows about it, you know, better chances to reach the goal. So if you can't contribute, make some noise!

Háblales a tus amigos y a tu familia del proyecto, mándales un email con el link de esta campaña; postéalo en facebook, twitter o cualquier otra red social. Mientras más gente se entere de la campaña, las posibilidades de alcanzar la meta son mayores. Si no puedes contribuir con dinero, pasa la voz!
story_txt:
EVENTOS DEPENDIENTES 
What is all this? - Y esto?

My name is Daniel Avilés. I'm a cinematographer and still photographer based in Quito-Ecuador. Welcome to my project "Eventos Dependientes" a photobook and photography exhibition.
Mi nombre es Daniel Avilés, soy director de fotografía de cine y fotógrafo. Actualmente vivo en Quito-Ecuador y este es mi primer libro y exhibición fotográficas. Bienvenidos a mi proyecto "Eventos Dependientes".
When I think about the pictures in this book, I also think a lot about probability: the chain of events that had to occur for me to have a camera in those specific moments, in those places, among those people. I think about the road you must travel to arrive to certain images, to a certain instant you want to remember. I think about how we select and build our own memory.
Cuando pienso en las fotos que están en este libro, pienso mucho en la probabilidad: pienso en la cadena de eventos que tuvieron que pasar para estar con una cámara en aquellos momentos, en esos lugares,con esas personas. Pienso en todo el recorrido que uno hace para llegar a ciertas imágenes y a ciertos instantes que quiere recordar.Pienso en cómo componemos nuestra memoria.
With your help. I could be able to finally acomplished a project that has been in my head for a long time. It's been a great journey and I am very close to reach the goal. But I need an extra lift.
Con su ayuda, finalmente podré completar el proyecto que ha estado en mi cabeza por mucho tiempo. Ha sido un viaje largo y estoy muy cerca de finalizar. Sin embargo, necesito un último empujón.
So, how can I help? - Entonces, cómo puedo ayudar?


I have dedicated my time and savings to work in this project for the last year and a half. The book is designed and ready to print. I've also been invited to exhibit my work in a local art gallery in November. However, on this final stretch, I still need some funds to pull it off. Here is when you come in! If I can raise $3000 dollars with this campaign, I will reach the ammount to finish my project. 
He dedicado mi tiempo y ahorros trabajando en este proyecto el último año y medio. El libro está diseñado y listo para la imprenta. Además, he sido invitado por una galería local a exhibir mis fotografías en Noviembre. Sin embargo, en este tramo final del camino, necesito de fondos adicionales para completar todo. Aquí es donde entras tú y me das una mano! Si logro levantar los $3000 que me hacen falta, el libro y la exposición serán una realidad.
There are great rewards waiting for you! Please check the perks section of the campaign to see what things you can get in exchange for your support. Some of them include: signed photo prints, digital-wallpapers and a deluxe hard cover-edition copy of the book! All of them delivered to your door.
Hay varias recompensas por su ayuda al proyecto! Revisen la sección "perks" de la campaña, ahi encontrarán varios items que pueden ser suyos: desde ampliaciones firmadas de las fotografías, salvapantallas digitales, hasta una copia de la edición de lujo-pasta dura del libro. Todo esto, cómodamente enviado a tu puerta.


I'm as broke as you are. How else can I help? - No tengo plata, cómo puedo ayudar?



You can tell your friends about the campaign, send them emails with the link, post the campaign in facebook, twitter or any other social network. The more people knows about it, you know, better chances to reach the goal. So if you can't contribute, make some noise!
Háblales a tus amigos y a tu familia del proyecto, mándales un email con el link de esta campaña; postéalo en facebook, twitter o cualquier otra red social. Mientras más gente se entere de la campaña, las posibilidades de alcanzar la meta son mayores. Si no puedes contribuir con dinero, pasa la voz!

story:
THANKS SO MUCH EVERYONE FOR THEIR SUPPORT! GOAL HAS BEEN REACHED! SINCE ITS GONE OVER ENOUGH, I AM ADDING SET 3 (8 new cards) TO EVERYONE'S ORDERS! IF YOU HAVEN'T ORDERED PLEASE TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE PERKS WHILE THEY LAST!


The second postcard set of "Pin-Up Show" is ready to print!

7 photo cards +1 artwork card. 4" by 6" with a classic postcard back. Words by horror legend Clive Barker.
 
Most everyone who sees this probably knows about "Pin-Up Show".
If you don't, please click this link here for info: http://trevorwayne.com/PinUpShow.html

For those of you who want to see the images UNCENSORED 18+ please click here: http://trevorwayne.tumblr.com/


One of the perks is the mini-mag that started the postcard series. I have stock left but have taken sales down off my site. I'm using the remaining mags as promotions to gain money to further my products.
Once the mags are all given out they will not be reprinted. "Pin-Up Show" will only live on in postcard form. Fun and kitschy, the way it should be.

All items will be sent out a week after close of this fundraiser/presale. If the goal is not met however, the perks will be sent out, and I will repost a new fundraiser/presale for the remainder of the amount I need to print. IndieGoGo is the only option for getting set 2 printed. Otherwise it surely will not be happening this year. I'm shooting for Oct. because I'd like to have these done to present at a convention I will have a table at.

Thank you all so much!!

Please repost and spread the word!

story:
Hello friends! My name is Vanessa Tam and I'm a writer and photographer based in Vancouver, Canada. 

I always considered taking photos to be more of a hobby until I started taking writing more seriously and began to use my photos to support my words. Being accepted as a participant into the first ever Pow! Wow! School of Photo! in Long Beach, California July 21-28, 2019 is a huge accomplishment for me and kind of a dream come true. 

Growing up with immigrant parents, it took me a long time to realize I was a creative person. Because there's so much cultural and societal pressure to be a traditionally educated and successful person, discovering what you're truly capable of as a creative human is still so hard to come by. 

This program will take me out of my comfort zone and really push me to discover how far I can take my art and my creativity and I can't wait to push myself there. 

 

What I Need Help With

Because this trip is kind of an unexpected expense (I submitted a last minute application June 19th and was accepted June 27th) I'm asking for help from y'all so I can spend 100% of my time creating and not worrying about my next meal or where I'll be sleeping at night. 

Here's the break down for my trip:

$1500 CAD for accommodations. Ideally I'd like to get an Airbnb in Long Beach proper so I don't have to worry about transportation and parking (LA traffic, amirite?) and can walk everywhere during the program and focus on the art. 

$600 CAD for travel. I plan to drive down to Long Beach instead of flying so this will cover gas and accommodations there and back. 

$600 CAD for food. Ya girls gotta eat.

$300 CAD for printing perks. I only want the best for my supporters when it comes to print and paper quality so you can enjoy your perks for years to come. 

 

Perks for You!

I'm seriously so stoked on the perks of this project because it's one thing to see your work live it's life on the internet, but it's just another level of satisfaction when you get to see your work printed out on a wall in all of it's glory. I can't wait to thank all of y'all for your support with a physical piece of my work to enjoy IRL. 

$25 CAD for a personalized thank you photo postcard. I'm gonna choose a couple of my best shots from my time in Long Beach, turn them into postcards, write personalized thank yous and sweet nothings and send 'em directly to you. 

$50 CAD for a 8" x 10" thank you photo print. I'll give you 5 options of my best work from the program that you can choose a favourite to get professionally printed out 8" x 10" and sent straight to you with love and gratitude.

$125 CAD for 3 x 8" x 10" thank you photo prints. I'll give you 5 options of my best work from the program that you can choose 3 favourites from to get professionally printed out 8" x 10" and sent straight to you with love and gratitude.

Come hell or high water, ya girl is gonna make it to the Pow! Wow! School of Photo! So any funds raised will go towards travel, food, printing perks and accommodations in that order regardless if I achieve my full goal or nah. All perks will be fulfilled no matter what.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word to your friends and fam! Every little bit and every little share helps more than you know.

story:
Each exhibitor within this exhibition is a second year student studying Photography for Fashion and Advertising at the University of South Wales, Newport. 'Transcendent' will showcase the result of a number of group projects that involved working with live clients including Griffin, Sebastian Professional, Ally Capellino, Crisis and Lo Recordings.
     We need to raise money to construct all aspects of the exhibition including printing, displaying and refreshments on the day. The exhibition will be open from Wednesday 21st May till Friday 23rd May 2014, at the Riverfront Theatre, Newport. Opening night: 21st May 6pm, refreshments will be provided.

     The clients involved in this exhibition are:

Sebastian Professional

Griffin

Crisis

Ally Capellino

LO Recordings

story:
My Story

As a frequent traveler, I find postcards to be a relatively inexpensive souvenir. They capture the essence of the place I'm visiting, and I appreciate the creativity each one possesses. Because I find them so interesting, it's clear that it would be the perfect outlet to put my own photos to use.

I absolutely love our planet and the parks service is extremely important to me. Being in a position where I regularly help protect, preserve and learn about the planet is a wonderful experience and I love that I am able to share that through photography. Being that shooting film can really dig into my pockets, being able to share my photos with others makes it a little more worth while. Knowing that I'm not only doing this for my own interest, my motivation has increased exponentially to better myself and my photos.

Environmentally Friendly(ish)

Given that I'm a steward of the Earth, I really appreciate sustainability in every aspect of life. Nice Butte Postcards will be printed on sustainable, ECF, chlorine free paper. Keeping in spirit, the packaging is 100% recycled material. However, being that my plan is to produce photo prints at home, Nice Butte Prints is currently in the process of acquiring sustainable and affordable photo paper. 

Mission

In addition to making shooting film more sustainable, this campaign is, more than anything, to get my name and my mission out there; for people to see my photos and become more interested in our public lands. My life has completely changed since realizing how important our parks are. It'd be awesome if I could get others to realize their importance, as well. Even possibly getting more people interested in sustainability efforts would be amazing. The monetary goal isn't super important to me. What is important to me is simply paying it forward.

Paying it Forward

Parks are very important to me and I strongly believe that it's important to preserve and protect them. Every little bit counts in sustainability efforts, so 10% of the funds raised from this campaign will go directly to the National Parks Foundation. Once the website is up, 5% of all purchases will also go to the National Parks Foundation, with prints and cards of certain parks going to those park specific foundations. (Ex): Profits from photos taken on the Blue Ridge Parkway will go to the Blue Ridge Parkway Foundation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any support is always much appreciated. The reason I felt confident enough to start this business is because I've had people close to me encourage me and push me on my photographic journey. Regardless of whether you can afford to contribute monetarily, any other support is always appreciated. Simply reaching out and letting me know you appreciate what I'm doing, or a share on social media can go a long way.

story:
Your support will help me raise money to fund a 160-page book of photographs that celebrates the spirit and strength of South Africans who face endemic violence, extreme economic hardship, and racism that has not abated, while all the time maintaining dignity, hope and courage.

About me:
I have been working as a documentary photographer for nearly thirty years.  Over the past decade I have photographed life in the townships of Langa, Khayelitsha, Philippi and Mitchell's Plain outside of Cape Town, South Africa.  My work there began during a Guggenheim Fellowship year for my exploration of the culture of amateur boxing. During my trip,  I met people living in Langa and Khayelitsha and began photographing the Luvuyo Boxing Club in Khayelitsha. I felt uncomfortable as yet another white person with a camera,  photographing people with less resources and access to power.  Subsequently, I cut my trip short, unsure of the work I was doing and who would actually benefit from it.  Upon my return to the States,  I looked at the pictures I had made and decided to go back to learn more, to further explore post-apartheid life in  black communities.  After over a dozen trips and more than a thousand rolls of film, I began to believe that the pictures mattered-they were not about people as victims, or about poverty, or any of those things one imagines life in black South African townships to be. 

Outside the cities frequented by tourists and business travelers, in vibrant townships, I found beauty and strength and all the contradictions of being human in the people I photographed; a preacher testifying to his rapt congregation;  a couple's loving embrace at day’s end; the proud regard of my friend Sindi in her traditional Xhosa dress; the moving funeral of a young Sotho man; the poetry and grace of a girl dancing on a warm Sunday afternoon;  and the striking face of “Dream Girl,” a young woman studying to be a traditional healer, a “sangoma."

This work has taken me into classrooms of overcrowded schools, the emergency room of an underfunded government hospital, burgeoning churches and the homes of those who live there. With South Africa’s current political climate, economic instability and increasing social unrest, these images serve as a reminder of all that is at stake in this fragile new democracy.

From my first body of work, on Basque life and culture in southwest France, to this current project, I have worked in the humanist tradition of photographers such as Dorothea Lange, Eugene Richards and Peter Magubane, striving to make images that foster empathy, understanding, and social change. I endeavor to honestly  portray the rich and full range of day-to-day experience of the people I encounter. I have launched this campaign to raise money to defray the costs of a book of these photographs that I am thrilled to be co-publishing with Editions Clémentine de la Férroniere. 
Clémentine de la Férroniere is a fine art photography gallery and book publisher based in Paris. She produces high quality, beautiful books (http://www.galerieclementinedelaferonniere.fr/Edition) and I am honored to be working with her. 
Your generous contributions will pay for a portion of design costs, high quality scans, paper and printing, binding and shipping costs for a duotone, clothbound, 160 page book. The book is slated for release in May of 2016. 
Any funds raised beyond my goal will pay for the exhibition of these photographs in Langa and to micro finance the  development of a women's sewing cooperative in the heart of Langa Township. 
Website with photographs, publication, award and grant information

story:
Who are we?

Sputnik Photos is an international collective founded in 2006 by documentary photographers from Central and Eastern Europe. We are united by a desire to observe and describe what surrounds us, as well as by our common experience of living in post-transformation countries.

Our achievements to date include important international awards, such as World Press Photo and Pictures of the Year International. Together we have organized several exhibitions around the world and published 8 photobooks. Our projects have been featured at photography festivals, in galleries and magazines worldwide.


About our project.  

We would like to invite you to support our artistic project in post-soviet countries of Central Asia. Twenty-five years after the fall of the USSR five Sputnik Photos photographers are setting out on a journey to five former soviet republics: Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan, Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan.  

For a number of years, we have been documenting changes taking place in post-communist countries, particularly in the former republics of the Soviet Union, always referring to our own individual experience of the transformation period. Recently, we have focused on Belarus, Ukraine, Moldavia, Armenia and Georgia. In the face of an increasing political tension in the region, photography documenting everyday life, and the changes and myths of the countries still falling under Russian influence, becomes even more relevant.

Rafal Milach - from the series “Black sea of concrete.”


At the current stage, we are planning further trips to the former Soviet empire, focusing on Central Asia, and we hope you will support our efforts. 

We are interested in what is happening in the countries that used to be part of the Soviet Union, and still remain under Russian influence, because their history is also our history and it concerns us directly. We are immersing ourselves in this complex and multi-faceted world. We are uncovering the nations’ nostalgia for the empire, their drive to democracy, traces of former propaganda, poverty, but also the emergence of the new and hope for a better future. We are aware that our project will give neither a diagnosis nor simple and straightforward answers to the questions relevant for the region. Yet, we want to make discoveries and show them to others. We believe that 25 years after the change is a perfect time to sum up the efforts our nations have made to date.

Your help can make it happen!

Agnieszka Rayss - from the series "I reminesce and cry for life."


The funds raised will enable each of us to go on a single trip to one of the countries we focus on:

Kazakhstan: Agnieszka Rayss

Uzbekistan: Michał Łuczak 

Turkmenistan: Rafał Milach

Tajikistan: Adam Pańczuk

Kyrgyzstan: Jan Brykczyński

Adam Panczuk - from the sersies "I_AM_IN_VOGUE@BELARUS.BY".


The amount will cover return flights, films, their developing and scanning, accommodation and guides. In other words, a minimum that allows 5 people to make 5 independent trips and create 5 extraordinary stories.

Jan Brykczynski - from the series "Primary forest".

The project will be rounded off in 2016 by a mobile exhibition and a photobook for audiences across the globe. It will show all the 15 countries that used to be part of the USSR.

Michal Luczak - from the series "Spitak".

REWARDS

SET OF SIGNED POSTCARDS (from Distant Place  project)


SET  OF 5 STICKERS + SIGNED POSTCARD
Set of 5 stickers with "Indiegogo Campaign Animals" designed by Sputnik Photos photographer Rafal Milach and the "Lost Territories" postcard (signed). I


‘PSOPLAAINND’ catalogue for Sputnik Photos exhibition at Photoespana 2014.


ORIGINAL POLAROID (signed)

An original instant print, taken by one of us during our Cenral Asia trips and signed by the artist . Estimated time of delivery - Dcember 2015


BOIKO - book by Jan Brkczynski, regular edition, 1 copy!

SOLD OUT

more about the BOIKO project here.


STAND BY book
(check the updates section to see the video describing how we worked on the project).

STAND BY limited edition (50 copies) + PRINT

print of one of Sputnik photographers, random choice

IS (NOT) regular edition,  RARE book!

SET OF SPUTNIK PHOTOS BOOKS

AT THE BORDER, PSOPLAAINND, U (sold out!), No1 (sold out!), No2, One, -  Two, Buckle My Shoe, DISTANT PLACE, IS (NOT) sold out!, Stand By

FINE ART PRINTS!


Collector's print by Adam Panczuk from the project "Very hidden people". Print size: 57x70 cm / 22.4x27.5 in. Signed ink print, edition 1/9. More details about the project "Very hidden people" here.

Collector's print by Agnieszka Rayss from the project "Femen warriors". Print size: 80x100 cm / 31.5x39.4 in. Signed ink print, edition 2/9. More details about the project "Femen warriors" here.  POYI winner in 2012!


Collector's print by Michal Luczak from the project "Brutal". Print size: 55x70 cm / 21.6x27.5 in. Signed gelatine print, edition 2/5 + 2AP. More details about the project "Brutal" here.

Collector's print by Jan Brykczynski from the project "Arnes". Print size: 47x60 cm / 18.5x23.6 in. Signed ink print, edition 2/10. More details about the project "Arnes" here.


The collector's print by Andrei Liankevich from his Belarus portfolio. Edition 3/10 Lambda print, 90 cm x 128 cm (35.4 in x 50.4 in), signed.

WYPOZYCZENIE APARATU WIELKOFORMATOWEGO GRAFLEX SPEED GRAFIX!

W ramach pomocy w zdobywaniu pieniędzy na projekt propozycja od naszego kolegi, świetnego portrecisty Marka Szczepańskiego! - wypożyczenie kamery wielkoformatowej Graflex Speed Graphic. Aparat jest w niezłej kondycji i ma bardzo jasną matówkę. Obiektywy są dwa: standardowy 135mm Schneider Xenar - 135mm/4.7 i Schneider Angulon 90mm/6.8. Do aparatu jest pięć kaset formatu 4 x 5 " i kaseta Polaroid 545. Jeśli zaproponowana cena będzie przyzwoita dorzucam trzy ładnunki Polaroid Polapan 55. Jest to aparat, którym pracowało wielu fotografów min ze Sputnika. Rafał Milach fotografował nim na Islandii "In the Car with R" , Jan Brykczyński fotografował swój zwycięzki projekt "The Gardner".


ALBOM.PL book - only ONE copy available

SOLD OUT!

Albom.pl book is the result of "Photographic archaeological expedition to the Polish-Belarusian border area." Album.pl was issued by the Association of Cultural Education WIDOK in 300 copies, not intended to sale. The Association offered us one the last copies to support LOST TERRITORIES project. Thank you, friends!More images and more about the project here.

THE WINNERS by Rafal Milach (rare book) SOLD OUT!

BLACK SEA OF CONCRETE + PRINT SOLD OUT!

BRUTAL book by Michal (rare book!) ONLY ONE COPY AVAILABLE, THE LAST ONE!!
A once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for collectors and photography lovers. This book became a legend years before it came into being. Seriously.

Katowice Railway Station constructed in 1972 was a high-standard building. Raw concrete constructions were at the time a symbol of modernity and prosperity of Polish Peopleos Republic. Only a decade later neglected building began to fall into ruins.

SOLD OUT!
A ruin in the city center of the biggest, postindustrial coal-mining district in Poland started to live its own life. On one hand it was still a place were people got on and off the trains but on the other it became an area of uncommon "passengers" who didn't have any tickets and never got on any train. They where the ones who created there some kind of a parallel world which existed on the sidelines of normal life.
Katowice Railway Station was destroyed at the beginning of 2011, it was the last significant example of brutalist architecture in Poland.
More about the projecthere
story_txt:
Who are we?

Sputnik
Photos is an international collective founded in 2006 by documentary
photographers from Central and Eastern Europe. We are united by a desire to
observe and describe what surrounds us, as well as by our common experience of
living in post-transformation countries.
Our
achievements to date include important international awards, such as World
Press Photo and Pictures of the Year International. Together we have organized
several exhibitions around the world and published 8 photobooks. Our projects
have been featured at photography festivals, in galleries and magazines
worldwide.









About our project.  
We would like to invite you to support our artistic project in post-soviet
countries of Central Asia. Twenty-five years after the fall of the USSR
five Sputnik Photos photographers are setting out on a journey to five former
soviet republics: Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan, Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan.
 
For a number of years, we have been documenting changes taking
place in post-communist countries, particularly in the former republics of the
Soviet Union, always referring to our own individual experience of the
transformation period. Recently, we have focused on Belarus, Ukraine, Moldavia,
Armenia and Georgia. In the face of an increasing political tension in the
region, photography documenting everyday life, and the changes and myths of the
countries still falling under Russian influence, becomes even more relevant.



Rafal Milach - from the series “Black sea of concrete.”


At the current stage, we are planning further trips to the
former Soviet empire, focusing on Central Asia, and we hope you will support
our efforts. 
We are interested in what is happening in the countries that
used to be part of the Soviet Union, and still remain under Russian influence,
because their history is also our history and it concerns us directly. We
are immersing ourselves in this complex and multi-faceted world. We are
uncovering the nations’ nostalgia for the empire, their drive to democracy,
traces of former propaganda, poverty, but also the emergence of the new and
hope for a better future. We are aware that our project will give neither a
diagnosis nor simple and straightforward answers to the questions relevant for
the region. Yet, we want to make discoveries and show them to others. We
believe that 25 years after the change is a perfect time to sum up the efforts
our nations have made to date.
Your help can make it happen!





Agnieszka Rayss - from the series "I reminesce and cry for life."

The funds raised will enable each of us to go on a single trip
to one of the countries we focus on:
Kazakhstan: Agnieszka Rayss
Uzbekistan: Michał Łuczak 
Turkmenistan: Rafał Milach
Tajikistan: Adam Pańczuk
Kyrgyzstan: Jan Brykczyński



Adam Panczuk - from the sersies "I_AM_IN_VOGUE@BELARUS.BY".


The amount will cover
return flights, films, their developing and scanning, accommodation and guides.
In other words, a minimum that allows 5 people to make 5 independent trips and
create 5 extraordinary stories.


Jan Brykczynski - from the series "Primary forest".




The project will be rounded off in 2016 by a mobile
exhibition and a photobook for audiences across the globe. It will show all the
15 countries that used to be part of the USSR.



Michal Luczak - from the series "Spitak".REWARDSSET OF SIGNED POSTCARDS (from Distant Place  project)

SET  OF 5 STICKERS + SIGNED POSTCARDSet of 5 stickers with "Indiegogo Campaign Animals" designed by 
Sputnik Photos photographer Rafal Milach and the "Lost Territories" 
postcard  (signed).  I



‘PSOPLAAINND’ catalogue for Sputnik Photos exhibition at Photoespana 2014. 




ORIGINAL POLAROID (signed) 
    An original instant print, taken by one of us during our Cenral Asia trips and signed by the artist . Estimated time of delivery - Dcember 2015



BOIKO - book by Jan Brkczynski, regular edition, 1 copy! 
SOLD OUT

more about the BOIKO project here.

story:
THE PROJECT

 

A multimedia exhibition Corrientes: Movement with Purpose is the celebration of a man in motion, moving to the beat of Miami. The man is world-renowned Spanish Flamenco Dancer, Jesús Carmona. 

Your contributors will help us to realize this exhibition and with it to engage our community. 

All contributors are invited to the Centro Cultural Español (1490 Biscayne Blvd, Miami, FL 33132) on opening night, from April 26th to May 17th.

Opening Night: Thursday, April 26th from 7pm - 11pm

 

The exhibition stems from the 5-minute film by audiovisual artist, Lulo Rivero, called Impetu’s: Flamenco’s Driving Force, wherein the dancer is presented as the film’s protagonist. 

In addition to printed still frames and short clips, the exhibition includes 25 photographic works taken during the video shoot process and captured through the lens of a synergistic team of talented photographers Luis Olazábal, Osmany Torres and Ricardo Cornejo. 

They were inspired to enrich the outlook of Carmona’s artistic show, Impetu’s, which is now touring the United States. 

 

THE PHOTOGRAPHY

Photo: Luis Olazábal

 

Photo: Osmany Torres

 

Photo: Ricardo Cornejo

 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

 

One of the purposes of this exhibition is to inspire collective work in these times of individualism and exclusion. 

We have started this fundraising campaign in order to help us bring our multifaceted visual arts exhibition to the community. Our purpose is to take Flamenco dance outside of its traditional context and to bring it closer to the everyday rhythm of a vibrant city like Miami.

The importance of this exhibition stems not only from its visual impact but also from the multicultural roots of its origins. 

Your generous contributions will cover our technical and production costs. 

Total Budget:                              $7911

Photo printing and framing   $5,661

Installation costs:                     $750

Marketing and promotion:    $1,500

 

 

Please consult the PERK list on the right margin of this page.

 

THE TEAM

 

We are a group of multidisciplinary and multicultural artists who decided to dedicate our time to an artistic collaboration.

Lulo Rivero (Buenos Aires, Argentina) Video Artist  www.lulo.us

Luis Olazábal (Lima, Perú) Photographer www.luisolazabal.com

Osmany Torres (Havana, Cuba) Photographer www.osmanytorres.com

Ricardo Cornejo (Quito, Ecuador) Photographer www.contemporad.com

Jesús Carmona (Barcelona, Spain) Flamenco Dancer www.jesus-carmona.com

 

A HUGE THANK YOU TO YOU 

FOR YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT!!

story:
Summary

Hi! If you don't know me, my name is Victor. I'm an artist working primarily in photography. I've been attending Brown University for the last 4 years, studying Visual Art. At Brown, I discovered the importance of printing my images, in small and large sizes. Printing and arranging images on a wall has taught me how to make new meaning out of my work. Now that I'm close to graduating, I'm losing access to the tools I need to keep up my newfound art practice. I've never been good at asking for help, but I'm asking for any and all contributions for this campaign. Please help me continue developing my art practice post-grad by contributing to funds for a large-format photo printer. As a first-generation, immigrant college student, graduating from Brown is a tremendous achievement for me. I aim to continue achieving the best things I can within my art practice, but I need your help to get started!

This is an installation shot of my senior capstone exhibition in the LIST Art Center at Brown this past April.

What I Need & What You Get

The total amount of $3,000 I'm looking to raise will be used as follows:

  • Epson Surecolor P6000 24" Large-Format Inkjet Printer - $2,050 (B&H)
  • Epson 3-Year Protection Plan - $180
  • MOO Postcard Making Service, 50 copies - $60
  • MOAB Juniper Baryta Rag 8.5x11" Paper, 100 sheets - $95
  • MOAB Juniper Baryta Rag 11x14" Paper, 25 sheets - $65
  • MOAB Juniper Baryta Rag 13x19" Paper, 25 sheets - $80
  • MOAB Juniper Baryta Rag 17x22" Paper, 25 sheets - $105
  • Partial shipping costs - $150
  • IndieGoGo Fees - $200

I am offering the following perks:

  • For $10 contributions, a 5x7" postcard with a personalized thank you note.
  • Unique, limited edition runs of personally printed images at the listed sizes. The edition will be determined by the number of contributors for that print. Prints will be signed, numbered and dated. No new prints will be made at the sizes offered, making these editions unique!
    • For $25, an 8.5x11" print.
    • For $60, an 11x14" print.
    • For $100, a 13x19" print.
    • For $150, a 17x22" print.
  • For generous contributions of $200, I am offering a custom print of any image on my website/Instagram on a 17x22" paper.
  • For three generous contributors of $300 in Los Angeles, I am offering a 1-hour personal photo shoot of any kind, along with a single 13x19" print from that shoot.

You can also contribute without claiming a perk by clicking the "Back It" button near the campaign goal. If you wish to claim a perk, you must select the perk first!

Should I not reach my entire goal, I will pursue other loan/financing options to cover the remaining cost and follow through on my reward promises.

The Images

"Old Timer", 2019 – available as a 5x7" postcard or 13x19" print  for a $10  or $100 contribution.

"Tierra Brandt", 2019 – available in 8.5x11" and 13x19" size for a $25 or $100 contribution.

"La Paz", 2019 – available as a 13x19" print  for a $100 contribution.

"La Luna", 2018 – available as a 13x19" print  for a $100 contribution.

"San Diego Sunset", 2017 – available in 8.5x11" and 13x19" size for a $25 or $100 contribution.

"Janet Todd, IFS 21", 2016 – available in 17x22" size for a $150 contribution.

"Body Hook, Glory 61", 2018 – available in 11x14" and 17x22" size for a $60 or $150 contribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Share my campaign on social media! Use the share links listed on this page.
  • Email my campaign to someone you think might be interested.
  • Consider me and my work for future commissions.
  • Share my website: www.victorisaacalvarez.com with anyone that might be interested in my work as I develop my career.

story:
Hello!

And thank you for looking at our funding page! Let us tell you some more about our very exciting project:

The Media Medicum Photo Exhibition

Media Medicum is a group exhibition which will be set up by 5 Edinburgh based female photographers going under the name Panopticon. All 5 are currently enrolled at Napier University in Edinburgh - 3rd year Photography BA(Hons). This is our end of the year degree project and we really need all help we can get to make it successful. We appreciate all help - both funding contributions and/or people sharing our page on social media to make it grow.

Why an Art project in Medicine?

The 19th century was a historically momentous period in the development of various medicinal theories and practices. By investigating and researching these elements we aim to bring light to some lesser known theories and practices that are the basis of modern medicine.

Each member intends to explore a particular theory or practice. By creating a photographic response to our chosen subject matter, every work will re-frame the history of the past into a modern context. The project will bring to life an era that made modern medicine what it is today! 

Who are Panopticon?

Salka Arnarsdóttir, Finland

Samantha Calvert, Scotland

Katie Matthews, Scotland

Malena Persson, Sweden

Rebecca Sandelin, Finland

Exhibition dates

April 2 - April 8 (2015): Gallery Seventeen, Dundas street, Edinburgh. 

The Impact

The purpose of our collaborative exhibition is to look to the past in order to understand the medicine of today and of the future. In doing so, we intend to explore the public perceptions and ideologies of illness, disease and the most basic of medical practices. We intend to communicate, challenge and educate the public audience’s knowledge and understanding of 19th century medicine.

The use of the Funding

We aim to raise £2,000 which would cover the following:
- Exhibition space rental: 10 days.
- Printing and mounting all photographs on high quality paper from pro print lab. 
- Materials for hanging all photographs.
- Promo & advertising of the exhibition.
- Printing of our high quality exhibition catalogue at professional print lab.
- Expenses such as travel costs, material for creating the work, opening night etc.

Risks & Challenges - and the solutions

This is currently a work in progress and all photographers are in the middle of producing the photos which are to be exhibited in early April. The group finds that this is what also makes this project interesting as the public can continuously follow updates of the development of the body of work. To get this project off the ground the group does need funding. However a detailed plan B does exist - and if funding goal would not to be met then an alternative exhibition space is available to lower cost, as well as printing will be made by photographers themselves instead of using professional print lab. 

Other Ways You Can Help

The group understands that not everyone has the means to help out financially. But if anyone would like to support this project then a great way would be to simply spreading the word. Share it on Social Media! Tell your family, friends and colleagues! Any help is great help! Thank you.

Stay tuned! 

This page will be continuously updated with images and video footage from our work in progress.
story_txt:
Hello!
And thank you for looking at our funding page! Let us tell you some more about our very exciting project:
The Media Medicum Photo Exhibition 
Media Medicum is a group exhibition which will be set up by 5 Edinburgh based female photographers going under the name Panopticon. All 5 are currently enrolled at Napier University in Edinburgh - 3rd year Photography BA(Hons). This is our end of the year degree project and we really need all help we can get to make it successful. We appreciate all help - both funding contributions and/or people sharing our page on social media to make it grow.

Why an Art project in Medicine?
The 19th century was a historically momentous period in the development of various medicinal theories and practices. By investigating and researching these elements we aim to bring light to some lesser known theories and practices that are the basis of modern medicine.
Each member intends to explore a particular theory or practice.
By creating a photographic response to our chosen subject matter, every work
will re-frame the history of the past into a modern context. The project will bring to life an era that made modern medicine what it is today! 

Who are Panopticon?
Salka Arnarsdóttir, Finland
Samantha Calvert, Scotland
Katie Matthews, Scotland
Malena Persson, Sweden
Rebecca Sandelin, Finland

Exhibition datesApril 2 - April 8 (2015): Gallery Seventeen, Dundas street, Edinburgh. 


    The Impact
The purpose of our collaborative exhibition is to look to the past in order to understand the medicine of today and of the future. In doing so, we intend to explore the public perceptions and ideologies of illness, disease and the most basic of medical practices. We intend to communicate, challenge and educate the public audience’s knowledge and understanding of 19th century medicine.

The use of the Funding
We aim to raise £2,000 which would cover the following:- Exhibition space rental: 10 days.- Printing and mounting all photographs on high quality paper from pro print lab. - Materials for hanging all photographs.- Promo & advertising of the exhibition.- Printing of our high quality exhibition catalogue at professional print lab.- Expenses such as travel costs, material for creating the work, opening night etc.

    Risks & Challenges - and the solutions
This is currently a work in progress and all photographers are in the middle of producing the photos which are to be exhibited in early April. The group finds that this is what also makes this project interesting as the public can continuously follow updates of the development of the body of work. To get this project off the ground the group does need funding. However a detailed plan B does exist - and if funding goal would not to be met then an alternative exhibition space is available to lower cost, as well as printing will be made by photographers themselves instead of using professional print lab.    
Other Ways You Can Help
 The group understands that not everyone has the means to help out financially. But if anyone would like to support this project then a great way would be to simply spreading the word. Share it on Social Media! Tell your family, friends and colleagues! Any help is great help! Thank you.

Stay tuned! 
This page will be continuously updated with images and video footage from our work in progress.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brandi Watson. After I began having kids, I started dreaming about having a nice camera of my own to take professional looking photos at home. Over the past year or so I've realized how many people in my community aren't able to get family pictures taken because of the cost or drive involved. I started thinking about how I would like to bless others in our community with low cost but professional family portraits. I have been asked to take family, senior and maternity portraits for family and friends recently but have always had to borrow others equipment. I would love to have a nice camera, tripod and photo editing software on hand to be more available to others when the opportunity arises. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need funding for a Canon Rebel T3, a tripod, a bigger memory card and Photoshop Lightroom editing software. If I exceed my $ goal, all extra funds will be used for additional equipment. 

The Impact

Your contributions will help me to be able to provide quality photos for families in our community who may not be able to do so otherwise. 

Please feel free to share this campaign with others. Thank you so much for your time!

story:
Sometimes You Need To Build Your Wings    
                  On The Way Down



Just before last Christmas we decided to move to Southern California with our animal family;  2 cats and a German Shepherd Dog. We packed up our apartment and our photography/digital art studio and made the journey. That first night in Southern California impacted our lives permanently.  Our fully loaded moving truck was stolen from a residential neighborhood.  EVERYTHING we worked all our lives for was taken from us. The insurance refused to pay claiming that theft is not covered in the policy.   

©mikelvandenhaak                                   

Aside from the loss of our furniture, all of our clothes, household items, electronics, bikes, and the usual personal belongings everyone has, we also lost 20 years of photography work and equipment; our Mac computers, laptop, tablets, hard-drives and all of our camera and lighting equipment. Twenty years of work stolen.  A lifetime of photos, slides and digital images, art books, art collection, and a collection of classical music CD’s. There were all the photos with so many memories and the precious items like a wooden camera from Mikel’s grandfather and a watch from Iyesha’s mother, things from the people we love who are no longer with us… the list goes on. Just imagine that you wake up one morning and no longer have even a spoon or a towel, everything you know and cherish has suddenly disappeared. 

For a visual representation of our story please click the Gallery Tab at the top of this page.

story:
BOOK PREVIEW HERE

 

What I'll do

I shooted dancers for the last 10 years. My passion for dancers, for their exceptional bodies, the grace, the energy... that's what I want to put in my first photo book. 

All the images will be in full colour, printed on silk finished paper. The book will be in A4 size, paperback binded. 

I always shoot dancers with maximum passion... I'll put this passion on each page. 

------------------------------------------------------

Scatto fotografie di danza da 10 anni, La mia passione per i danzatori, per i loro corpi meravigliosi, la grazia, l'energia... questo è ciò che voglio portare nel mio primo libro fotografico.

Il libro sarà in formato A4, rilegato in brossura, stampato su carta patinata. Conterrà immagini in bianco e nero ed a colori.

Who I am

It was only a couple of years after I started shooting as freelance photographer that I opened my first studio in Verona, Italy. At age 30 I wasn't too young and I wanted to become a pro soon. And that's exactly what I did. I'm a self-taught photographer.

Now, working out of an even bigger studio in my country house, I photograph a wide range of subjects - from performing arts to still life and architecture. My favourite genres, however, are dance photography and portraiture. Dance photography is the first kind of photography I did professionally and that's why these are the photographs I love the most.. Beginning with dance school shows and recitals, I then progressed to photographing professional dancers and dance companies.

------------------------------------------------------

Sono un fotografo freelance, autodidatta. Ho parto il mio studio qualche anno fa a Verona. Ora ho realizzato uno studio più grande nella mia casa in campagna. Pur fotografando vari soggetti, la mia specializzazione è la fotografia di danza e di ritratto. Ho iniziato fin da subito a fotografare la danza, prima con le scuole di danza dellam ia città, poi, via via, collaborando con danzatori professionisti e compegnai edi danza.

 

What I Need 

I'll need $ 2.500 to print at least 200 A4 paperback books. That's my goal!

But obvioulsy I hope to print more books. Raising 500 copies I could print a better quality book at the same price!

------------------------------------------------------

Punto a raccogliere $ 2.500,00 per stampare almeno 200 libri. Ovviamente spero in risutati più importanti. Riuscendo a "pre-vendere" almeno 500 libri potrei, manenendo lo stesso prezzo, aumnetarne la qualità

 

What I'm Doing

I'm shooting new pics, working with amazing dancers. Classical ballerinas, hip hop dancers, breakdancers, Flamenco dancers and more. Everybody works for free... we only want to take our passion to dance lovers and to fine art photography lovers.

------------------------------------------------------

Sto scattando nuove foto, lavorando con fantastici danzatori. Ballerini classici, di hip hop, breakdancers, danzatrici di Flamenco ed altro. Tutti lavorano gratis, non si tratta di un progetto con fini di lucro, vogliamo solo portare la nostra passione ad altri amanti della danza e della fotografia.

Other Ways You Can Help Me

I'd love it if you'd pass this along your Facebook, Twitter, etc etc to any and all people who may be interested, or even just people that you know. Even your Grandma may love it!

------------------------------------------------------

Oltre a contribuire (o se non puoi farlo) puoi aiutarmi condividendo questa campagna sul truo profilo Facebook, Twitter, qualsiasi altro social network, sito, e-mail. Anche solo dicendolo ai vostri amici, compagni di danza, classe, lavoro ecc... Potrebbe piacere anche alla vostra nonnina il mio libro, no?

 

Per chi non parla inglese:

Come funzionano i contributi:

COME CONTRIBUIRE
Puoi contribuire ad ogni campagna attiva cliccando su “Contribute Now”.
Potrai quindi inserire l’importo con cui vuoi contribuire, richiedere la tua ricompensa (Perk) e scegliere come vuoi pagare. Accettiamo carte di credito Visa, MasterCard e American Express; oppure puoi pagare con PayPal. Tutte le transazioni possono essere in $USD, €EUR, £GBP o $CAD, in base alla campagna.

LA SICUREZZA DELLE TUE INFORMAZIONI
Teniamo alla sicurezza dei tuoi dati ed informazioni. Abbiamo sistemi di sicurezza che proteggono le informazioni che raccogliamo on-line, prevengono accessi non autorizzati, mantengono l’accuratezza dei dati ed assicurano il corretto uso delle tue informazioni.

COME VALUTARE UNA CAMPAGNA
Abbiamo un completo sistema di valutazione delle campagne, per proteggere i nostri contribuenti da potenziali frodi. Potete però aiutarci segnalando ogni campagna che possegga contenuti proibiti, cliccando sul link 'prohibited content' nella parte destra delle pagina di ogni campagna.

LE TASSE, COME FUNZIONA
Non tutte le tasse delle campagne sono deducibili. Normalmente le tasse sono deducibili solo per campagne di organizzazioni No-Profit. Ogni paese potrebbe avere regole proprie. In ogni caso Indiegogo non emette mai ricevute in relazione ai contributi, le ricevute vengono emesse direttamente dall’organizzatore della campagna.

COME FUNZIONANO I RIMBORSI
I contributi non vengono rimborsati. Possiamo rimborsare solo i contributi che per errore siano stati fatti due volte oppure relativi a campagne che non hanno raggiunto l’obiettivo entro il tempo stabilito e quindi non realizzeranno il progetto e non distribuiranno le ricompense.

story:
The Story

I was in class my leaving my photography class on Monday, a student asked me how to export edited images from lightroom so I put my gear down in effort to help him. After the task was complete I said my goodbyes and put my camera bag over my shoulders, although the camera bag was zipped up the camera only compartment was not, and crashing went my X-T1 and 56 1.2. 

The first feeling I felt was embarrassment, I was in a beginners photography class and everyone knew I had the most experience, except when I dropped my camera I felt as if my credibility had fallen, it was the worst thing ever. A round of cringe worthy sounds blurted out of the student's mouth, I reassured them nothing was wrong and that it would be okay, I strictly remember saying "Don't worry it's a Fuji" but deep down inside I was as worried and as scared as they all appeared to be.

I went to the hall to test my camera and lens and to no avail, it went crashing face down, lens first, then bouncing to the cameras rear end, this fall was high, shoulder up I'd say... 

I was crushed, tears almost, I've quit everything from my job to my friends to pursue my career as a wedding photography. A successful Reddit campaign has resulted in me booking a few weddings later this year, and now I no longer have the equipment to do so, nor do I have the funds to purchase another body, rather it be less expensive or not.

The truth is, I'm unemployed, at least I am now because yesterday I was self-employed. It's only been 24 hours and I don't know what to do, or think or how to even feel. I've been placed in rough situations before, but I've always had photography to get my mind off of things. Except now, I don't have it, and my dreams seem further away than ever.

Perks

I don't have much to offer, I'm a struggling artist. The perk section is the thriving idea behind crowdfunding. I assume if you're local then I can offer free photo shoots, or a meet up, but for the masses I will gladly make a blog post thanking each and everyone of you individually. I run a photography website/blog RIVALSvs. Check it out, your name and contribution will get it's own page and your kindness will not be overlooked.

Risks & Challenges

Obviously the goal isn't guaranteed, purchasing the equipment that was broken would cost a total of $2300 or so brand new, with $1800 being a goal to purchase the items used. I'm hoping you all can understand what I'm going through and understand that I'm not asking for $2300 from each of you, but $3-5 from each individual could go a long way and can turn this goal from fruition to reality. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't spare the $3-5 no problem, looking at the campaign and sharing it is an effort that won't go over looked. Everyone doesn't have the means to sharing income, but word of mouth is an avenue we can all participate in. An artist in each of us!

*** With you all's support and the faith I have in this campaign I was able to purchase my X-T1 with a little added cash I made from selling unnecessary gear. The 56 1.2 is still a goal of mine, thanks for the support thus far, it means the world to know that my friends and the community believes in me!!!***

story:
THE STORY

 

Four years ago, I embraced the mobile photography world through Instagram and I was fascinated by the power of photography as a way to interact. More importantly, I realized that behind the huge stream of photographs posted everyday right from the phone was hidden real talents.

As a former printer of many photography books, I came upon the idea of a publishing house dedicated to mobile photography, to make art books out of mobile phone imagery. OUT OF THE PHONE publishing house was born. Our Mission is to bring to life these volatile digital snapshots by engraving their trace on paper.

Since then, we have published photo books dedicated to mobile photography. We also highlight some talents on our Instagram page which hopefully set some of them on the road to more recognition. We are always on the lookout for talented mobile photographers. Now we want to go further.

 

OUT OF THE PHONE PROJECT

 

Everything now is viewed on phones, tablets or computers. Photographs are beautiful on retina screens but our pictures get lost and it's getting very hard to keep track of the best moments. We believe that making photo books is the most emotional way to save and tell your stories.

MAKE STYLISH PHOTO BOOKS MEETING THE MOBILE SPIRIT

As we haven't find any photo book creation platform meeting our requirements, we have decided to build our own to enable photographers to easily create and publish next-generation photo books. We want to offer different objects and alternative solutions to the cumbersome books printed on heavy glossy paper.

The project starts with a stylish travel notebook for presenting a series of 30–50 photographs.

BECOME PART OF THE WORLD'S FIRST PHOTO BOOK COLLECTION DEVOTED TO MOBILE PHOTOGRAPHY AND GET DISCOVERED

We want to build a genuine collection of photo books over time: after creating their book, people will have the possibility to submit their work and to become part of the world’s first photo book collection devoted to mobile photography. Our online bookshop will sell selected stories.

The creation of a Print-on-Demand platform for the mobile generation has become a matter of course… to provide something tangible to share with your network and your loved ones and to collect over time.

 

OOTP TRAVEL NOTEBOOK

 

OOTP first print-on-demand photo book is a travel notebook enabling photographers to present series of about 30 to 50 pictures.

Designed to be collected, both format and pagination are specific. High priority is given to high-quality artisanal work. The travel notebooks are made in France. Papers are FSC certified, made with environmentally friendly ECF pure cellulose.

Specifications:

  • Size: 5" x 8 ¼" (13 x 21 cm)
  • 52 pages
  • 90 gsm premium offset paper
  • 300 gsm Fully coloured paper
  • Sewn binding
  • Round corners

 

OUT OF THE PHONE IN THE PRESS

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

 

By contributing to our project you will be joining us on a fabulous journey. If you love to take pictures with your mobile phone, this project is your project!

  • €12,500 is our goal to enable us to:
  1. Build our first web application allowing you to design your own photo books on line.
  2. Print the pre-ordered travel notebooks 

In exchange of your participation, we offer different kind of perks. From travel notebooks to tailor-made professional photo books, these contributions make our dream come true!​

All funds will be used to print your photo notebooks, and then to develop the web application.

If we do not reach our entire goal of €12,500, whatever we raise will still go to the production of the pre-ordered travel notebooks. That's why we chose a flexible funding mode. 

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

 

Years of  meticulous work have gone into the OUT OF THE PHONE Project. 

All the production process has been tested and is ready. We have built a strong partnership with passionate graphic designers and printers. Out Of The Phone can handle the layout for you in a tailor-made approach.

That is why we make a commitment to respect the delivery of our perks.

The challenge is to build the web application enabling people to both create their books on line and to become part of the OOTP book collection. In accordance with the mobile spirit, we are working on a great yet simple user experience.

With your support, we can make it. Our passion for this project, along with your help, will get us over every hurtle in our way.  

 

SPREAD THE WORD. IT ALL HELPS!

 

Please take the time to share this site with friends and family and help spread the word. Your individual help can make a huge difference to the success of this project and is greatly appreciated.

Please share our story and this site on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn and any other social media you are comfortable with.

By all means, spread the word worldwide to any media source that might be interested!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

http://www.outofthephone.com
story_txt:
THE STORY Four years ago, I embraced the mobile photography world through Instagram and I was fascinated by the power of photography as a way to interact. More importantly, I realized that behind the huge stream of photographs posted everyday right from the phone was hidden real talents.As a former printer of many photography books, I came upon the idea of a publishing house dedicated to mobile photography, to make art books out of mobile phone imagery. OUT OF THE PHONE publishing house was born. Our Mission is to bring to life these volatile digital snapshots by engraving their trace on paper.Since then, we have published photo books dedicated to mobile photography. We also highlight some talents on our Instagram page which hopefully set some of them on the road to more recognition. We are always on the lookout for talented mobile photographers. Now we want to go further. OUT OF THE PHONE PROJECT Everything now is viewed on phones, tablets or computers. Photographs are beautiful on retina screens but our pictures get lost and it's getting very hard to keep track of the best moments. We believe that making photo books is the most emotional way to save and tell your stories.MAKE STYLISH PHOTO BOOKS MEETING THE MOBILE SPIRITAs we haven't find any photo book creation platform meeting our requirements, we have decided to build our own to enable photographers to easily create and publish next-generation photo books. We want to offer different objects and alternative solutions to the cumbersome books printed on heavy glossy paper.The project starts with a stylish travel notebook for presenting a series of 30–50 photographs.BECOME PART OF THE WORLD'S FIRST PHOTO BOOK COLLECTION DEVOTED TO MOBILE PHOTOGRAPHY AND GET DISCOVEREDWe want to build a genuine collection of photo books over time: after creating their book, people will have the possibility to submit their work and to become part of the world’s first photo book collection devoted to mobile photography. Our online bookshop will sell selected stories.The creation of a Print-on-Demand platform for the mobile generation has become a matter of course… to provide something tangible to share with your network and your loved ones and to collect over time. OOTP TRAVEL NOTEBOOK OOTP first print-on-demand photo book is a travel notebook enabling photographers to present series of about 30 to 50 pictures.Designed to be collected, both format and pagination are specific. High priority is given to high-quality artisanal work. The travel notebooks are made in France. Papers are FSC certified, made with environmentally friendly ECF pure cellulose.Specifications:
Size: 5" x 8 ¼" (13 x 21 cm)
52 pages
90 gsm premium offset paper
300 gsm Fully coloured paper
Sewn binding
Round corners
 OUT OF THE PHONE IN THE PRESS WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET By contributing to our project you will be joining us on a fabulous journey. If you love to take pictures with your mobile phone, this project is your project!€12,500 is our goal to enable us to:

Build our first web application allowing you to design your own photo books on line.

Print the pre-ordered travel notebooks 
In exchange of your participation, we offer different kind of perks. From travel notebooks to tailor-made professional photo books, these contributions make our dream come true!​All funds will be used to print your photo notebooks, and then to develop the web application.If we do not reach our entire goal of €12,500, whatever we raise will still go to the production of the pre-ordered travel notebooks. That's why we chose a flexible funding mode.  RISKS AND CHALLENGES Years of  meticulous work have gone into the OUT OF THE PHONE Project. All the production process has been tested and is ready. We have built a strong partnership with passionate graphic designers and printers. Out Of The Phone can handle the layout for you in a tailor-made approach.That is why we make a commitment to respect the delivery of our perks.The challenge is to build the web application enabling people to both create their books on line and to become part of the OOTP book collection. In accordance with the mobile spirit, we are working on a great yet simple user experience.With your support, we can make it. Our passion for this project, along with your help, will get us over every hurtle in our way.   SPREAD THE WORD. IT ALL HELPS! Please take the time to share this site with friends and family and help spread the word. Your individual help can make a huge difference to the success of this project and is greatly appreciated.Please share our story and this site on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, LinkedIn and any other social media you are comfortable with.By all means, spread the word worldwide to any media source that might be interested!Please use the Indiegogo share tools!Thank you!http://www.outofthephone.com

story:
If you had to pick your one favorite object, what would it be? What would that say about you? What object would join you for posterity? Would it be a favorite food, a book, an instrument, something from your trade or a guilty pleasure?

Well, I'll be going around Europe to find out exactly that. I will capture with my Graflex the personal, sweet, sad and odd portraits that will arise from the combination of a person and the object they chose.

Where the Funds Will Go

Film. The amount of money I'll raise will be directly related to how far this trip will go. The more film I have, the more I can extend the project, both in time and space.

The Gear

The camera is an early 1900s Auto Graflex. It's an American press camera that was built by Folmer & Schwing. It is a large format camera, taking 4x5" pictures.

The lens is a large format uncoated Bausch & Lomb Zeiss Tessar model 1C.

And together they take photos like these

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What happens then?

I'll keep a blog and post regular updates about the progress of the project.

Once back, a selection of photos will be exhibited in Belgium around mid-2014.

I'll also create a limited-edition book about the trip and the photos that were taken. The most interesting stories of people and their object will be included as well.

story:
Expedition: Danajon Bank

Did you know that nearly half a billion people around the world depend on coral reefs for their survival? Or that over 30% of reefs and other vital coastal habitats have been degraded or destroyed worldwide?

Help us protect one of the world’s most threatened reefs and send an ocean conservation message to the world!

Expedition: Danajon Bank is an international photo exhibition, book, and advocacy campaign to protect a rare and threatened double-barrier coral reef in the Philippines and educate the world about marine conservation, one of the most important issues today. It's a collaboration between the world’s top nature photographers and marine scientists.

Little-known to the outside world, the Danajon Bank is one of only six double-barrier reefs in the world, and one of the most important marine ecosystems in the entire Pacific Ocean. Species found all over the Pacific are thought to have first evolved here. Unfortunately, Danajon Bank faces many threats, including overfishing and destructive fishing practices (such as blast fishing with explosives), as well as overdevelopment, and climate change. The reef is home to at least 200 threatened animals, such as the elusive Tiger-tail seahorse. 

Our project aims to capture Danajon Bank in all its fragile beauty and share the images with the world to raise awareness about the threats facing this important ecosystem and many thousands of fragile marine ecosystems around the world.

Following a two-week expedition in spring 2013, we will produce a beautiful hardcover photo book and launch a series of large-scale photo exhibitions at aquariums in London, Chicago, Hong Kong, Manila, and beyond. 

The result will be a powerful photographic legacy that will help conservationists to push for increased marine protections in the Philippines and around the world.

Who We Are

Organized by Project Seahorse and the International League of Conservation Photographers, our award-winning team includes legendary photographers Thomas P. Peschak, Luciano Candisani, Claudio Contreras, and Michael Ready, as well as  leading conservation experts Dr. Amanda Vincent and Dr. Heather Koldewey.

What You Get

As part of our IndieGoGo campaign, we’ll be producing postcards, limited edition original photo prints, posters, signed copies of the book, and much more. Our backers will also receive behind-the-scenes updates from the expedition team, and an exclusive digital preview of the photos. For full details, see the “Perks” sidebar.

The funds raised by our campaign will help to cover some of the costs associated with the expedition as well as the printing of the book and production of the exhibition prints. We hope you'll help our cause!

Thanks!

Tom, Amanda, Luciano, Heather, Claudio, Mike
and the entire Expedition: Danajon Bank team

 

ABOUT THE TEAM

Thomas P. Peschak

Thomas Peschak is a contributing photographer to National Geographic Magazine and a Fellow of the International League of Conservation Photographers (ILCP). He was recently named by Outdoor Photography magazine as one of the 40 most influential nature/environmental photographers in the world. Thomas is a multi-award winning photographer, receiving awards from the BBC/Veolia Wildlife Photographer of the Year, Fujifilm Photographic and Environmental Photographer of the Year competitions. In 2011 he won the nature/environment category of the World Press Photo Awards. Portfolio: http://www.thomaspeschak.com/

Luciano Candisani

Luciano Candisani is a wildlife photojournalist from Brazil. Luciano Candisani’s photo stories on wildlife and biodiversity conservation are published internationally in magazines including National Geographic ,Geo and BBC Wildlife. One of the pictures of his recent coverage about Caimans for National Geographic Magazine won him the first place in a category of the  2012 Veolia Wildlife Photographer of the year competition. He has also won the prestigious Abril Journalism award for his story on the rare and critically endangered “Muriqui” Monkey, a work that led to support for this species conservation in the Atlantic Rain forest of Brazil. He is author of seven photo books and is a Fellow of the International League of Conservation photographers (ILCP). http://www.lucianocandisani.com/

Michael Ready

Michael Ready is a naturalist and photographer based in San Diego, California.  From vanishing amphibians to bioluminescent squid, Ready's collection of images seeks to reveal the diversity of life and particularly its smaller and lesser-known forms. Ready's field expeditions have taken him to locales around the world, including the Amazon Basin, Cental America, South East Asia, and Japan, where he was honored to swim in mountain streams and photograph giant salamanders as old as he. Portfolio: http://www.michaelready.com/

Claudio Contreras

Claudio Contreras is a Mexican conservation photographer, based in Mexico City.  For more than fifteen years he has been documenting his country’s biodiversity, wildlife and plants, terrestrial and aquatic environments with the aims of promoting conservation. He works in close cooperation with the Mexican Federal Environment Agency and several NGOs.  He has joined iLCP on two other Photographic Expeditions in the past, one in British Columbia’s Sacred Headwaters region and the other one in the US/Mexico Borderlands. Portfolio: http://www.claudiocontreras.com 

Dr. Amanda Vincent

Director and co-founder of Project Seahorse, Dr. Vincent was the first biologist to study seahorses underwater, uncover their extensive commercial trade, and initiate a seahorse conservation project. She was named a Leader for the 21st Century by TIME magazine, in 1999. The following year she was awarded a Pew Fellowship in Marine Conservation, the world’s pre-eminent award in that field. She has held many leadership roles in international conservation, and has published extensively in scholarly journals. Dr. Vincent has received many awards for her own work and as Director of Project Seahorse. As a professor at the University of British Columbia, Dr. Vincent supervises graduate students and teaches. She co-founded Project Seahorse in 1996.

Dr. Heather Koldewey

Through her work with Project Seahorse and the Zoological Society of London, Dr. Koldewey has played a central role in advancing the role of aquariums in fish conservation globally, holding leadership roles on many key committees. Dr. Koldewey also continues to be active in research, supervising graduate students within Project Seahorse. She has recently been involved in the designation of the world’s largest marine protected area in the Chagos/British Indian Ocean Territory and she continues a role in developing a research strategy for the region. She co-founded Project Seahorse in 1996.

Dr. Nick Hill

Nick has spent many years working on some of the most beautiful, as well as some of the most degraded coral reefs in the world. Having started his professional life as an ecologist, Nick became increasingly interested in the socioeconomic dimensions of conservation, and spent his PhD years investigating the livelihoods of people on Danajon Bank. Nick now works in ZSL’s International Marine & Freshwater team, where he manages one of the “good news” projects for Danajon Bank, which is helping to reduce the environmental impacts of plastic waste by recycling discarded fishing nets into carpet tiles whilst seemingly generating a few additional benefits along the way. Nick is the lead field scientist on the expedition to Danajon Bank.


ABOUT DANAJON BANK

One of only six double-barrier reef formations in the world, Danajon Bank is thought to be an evolutionary point of origin for many marine animals found all over the Pacific Ocean. According to the IUCN’s Red List of Threatened Species, it is home to 196 threatened species and ecosystems, including Anacropora spinos, a highly endangered coral, and the Tiger-tail seahorse (Hippocampus comes), which is listed as vulnerable.

The Danajon Bank is also home to hundreds of thousands of people, who depend on it for food and livelihoods. Unfortunately, overfishing, pollution, and development threaten both the future of the ecoyststem and the fishing communities who depend on it for survival.

The Danajon Bank encompasses many of our oceans’ most important and threatened marine habitats, such as mangroves, seagrasses, and coral reefs. Its biodiversity, and the threats it faces from human activity, make it a powerful example of the beauty of the world’s coastal marine ecosystems and the threats they face in the 21st century.


ABOUT THE ORGANIZERS

Project Seahorse: Marine conservation experts

Winner of the Whitley Award in Animal Conservation and the Rolex Award for Enterprise, Project Seahorse is a marine conservation organisation committed to the conservation and sustainable use of the world’s coastal marine ecosystems. Led by Dr. Amanda Vincent and Dr. Heather Koldewey, global experts on seahorse conservation, we generate cutting-edge research and turn our findings into highly effective conservation interventions — usually in collaboration with other researchers, governments, and local communities. By working to protect seahorses, Project Seahorse supports marine conservation more broadly.

Over the past 15 years, Project Seahorse and partner PSF have catalyzed the creation of 34 marine protected areas in Danajon Bank and gathered one of the world’s most comprehensive, long-term datasets on any marine ecosystem in the world. Using these MPAs and this data to study how reef habitats, fish species, and seahorse populations thrive — or struggle — with and without protection, we monitor reef health and take direct conservation action to protect one of Philippines’ rarest and most ecologically significant ecosystems. 

iLCP: World-class image-makers

The International League of Conservation Photographers is a U.S. based non-profit organization whose mission is to further environmental and cultural conservation through photography.   Our programs are built on the participation and contributions of our 100+ Fellows, an elite group of the world’s top wildlife and nature photographers who, in addition to displaying remarkable photographic skills, have each demonstrated a deep commitment to conservation efforts around the globe. 

At iLCP, we put a lot of thought into communications strategies, identifying the key audiences and the most effective use of the assets gathered during the expedition. We help our Conservation Partners, like Project Seahorse, better communicate their conservation goals and achievements.  We have the capacity to create traveling exhibits, mini and full-length documentaries, messaging multimedia, blog series, online galleries, and social media buzz, depending on the needs of the campaign.

iLCP’s Conservation Photography Expeditions have been covered by National Geographic (most recently as the cover story of the August 2011 issue), Outside Online, American Photo, The Guardian, ABC Nightline, Huffington Post, Tree Hugger, and numerous blogs that cater to people who care about the world we live in and the conservation challenges it faces. 

Project Ocean Philippines (PSF): Danajon Bank specialists

The Project Seahorse Foundation for Marine Conservation (PSF) is a key partner of Project Seahorse. This Filipino non-governmental organization is committed to conservation of marine ecosystems through equitable, sustainable use. Collaborating with stakeholders and partners in coastal communities, it undertakes research and management initiatives for marine resources within an ecosystem framework. PSF focuses on Danajon Bank because this region encompasses critical marine conservation issues for the Philippines. It uses the seahorses in this region as a flagship species to inspire and engage people in finding solutions to marine conservation problems.
