story:
Our Story

For women, aging brings with it an inner grace and beauty that is more than skin deep. From birth to old age, women transition through many physical, psychological, and emotional phases that are recorded on their faces.

Never before has a book so vividly projected the images of women in all stages of life in a way that reveals who they really are as women.  Feminine Transitions: A Photographic Celebration of Natural Beauty is a refreshing and inspiring, full-color book of photography. Its pages present a series of portraits that reveal the elegance and subtly honest beauty of female faces between the ages of 7 weeks and 105 years.

Author and photographer Alyscia Cunningham has truly unmasked the natural beauty of aging. “In a world filled with ‘Photoshopped’ images of women who are heavily made up, this book is a breath of fresh air,” says Trista Hendren, author of The Girl God and writer at the blog Elephant Journal.

The process of photographing the portraits for the book turned out to be a transition for Alyscia. “I simply wanted to put together a body of work that fosters a woman’s love for herself and encourages women to believe in their own beauty, despite the signs of aging,” says Alyscia.  “But as I looked through my lens, I couldn’t see the women. All I could see was their makeup.  Their masks.”

Alyscia then made the decision that all of her subjects remove their makeup for their portraits. That was when the book project really took shape. The importance of a woman’s “natural” beauty took center stage.

Feminine Transitions unmasks women and exquisitely demonstrates that young is beautiful, old is beautiful, and natural is beautiful.

Read Alyscia's bio. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am so proud and excited to produce my first photography book that was originally scheduled for release in March 2013, Women's History Month, but has been extended. I am also coordinating traveling exhibitions showcasing the images from my book. With your help and contributions, I hope to be able to raise the money for my shows and book production. The funds will be used for printing the first 500 copies of my book, rental space, framing, invitations, marketing, installation and all of the other things that go along with launching major solo exhibitions. 

If I do not reach my entire goal on this round, I will purchase 100 copies using Blurb to publish. However, Blurb's prices are far higher than going to a traditional printer. Nonetheless, have a few copies in hand will be beneficial as people would rather see a product in hand.  From there, I will continue to collect the funds until I reach my goal by holding future funding campaigns. I've also submitted applications via my local arts organizations for grants and currently awaiting the status. 

For your generous contribution, you will receive signed and personalized copies of Feminine Transitions along with recognition in the book’s marketing materials, which will be distributed to hundreds of media outlets. Higher-level sponsors can take advantage of tickets to the Feminine Transitions book launch party, prominent logo placements and even a full photography session from Alyscia Cunningham Photography.

In order to spread this important message of self-confidence to communities around the country, this project relies on support from individuals and organizations like yours. Please help make an impact and be part of this global movement by supporting Feminine Transitions at one of the perk levels. To contribute or to find out more information, please don’t hesitate to contact me directly at AlysciaC@aol.com. Thank you for your consideration and your generosity.

 

The Impact

As a valued contributor of Feminine Transitions, you can play an essential role in helping thousands of girls and women love what they see in the mirror and feel more comfortable in their skin. Your donation will directly fund the book’s production and the Feminine Transitions exhibition, which is currently slated to appear in ten U.S. cities, including DC, CA, OH, IL, NY, NC, SC, TN, GA, AL and UT.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth goes such a long way.  Now a days, social media is the way of the future. In other words, you can really help to make this campaign successful by spreading the word.  Do you have Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Tumblr, LinkedIn...or even an email?  The biggest help you can give, other than making a financial contribution, is telling others.  Post it on any or your social media sites and send info for my campaign via email.

I sincerely thank you for coming to my page to take a look at my project. I want to share the beauty of Feminine Transitions with the world. Your contribution is helping to make this happen.
story_txt:
Our Story
For women, aging brings with it an inner grace and beauty that is more than skin deep. From birth to old age, women transition through many physical, psychological, and emotional phases that are recorded on their faces.
Never before has a book so vividly projected the images of women in all stages of life in a way that reveals who they really are as women.  Feminine Transitions: A Photographic Celebration of Natural Beauty is a refreshing and inspiring, full-color book of photography. Its pages present a series of portraits that reveal the elegance and subtly honest beauty of female faces between the ages of 7 weeks and 105 years.
Author and photographer Alyscia Cunningham has truly unmasked the natural beauty of aging. “In a world filled with ‘Photoshopped’ images of women who are heavily made up, this book is a breath of fresh air,” says Trista Hendren, author of The Girl God and writer at the blog Elephant Journal.
The process of photographing the portraits for the book turned out to be a transition for Alyscia. “I simply wanted to put together a body of work that fosters a woman’s love for herself and encourages women to believe in their own beauty, despite the signs of aging,” says Alyscia.  “But as I looked through my lens, I couldn’t see the women. All I could see was their makeup.  Their masks.”
Alyscia then made the decision that all of her subjects remove their makeup for their portraits. That was when the book project really took shape. The importance of a woman’s “natural” beauty took center stage.
Feminine Transitions unmasks women and exquisitely demonstrates that young is beautiful, old is beautiful, and natural is beautiful.
Read Alyscia's bio. 
 
What We Need & What You Get
I am so proud and excited to produce my first photography book that was originally scheduled for release in March 2013, Women's History Month, but has been extended. I am also coordinating traveling exhibitions showcasing the images from my book. With your help and contributions, I hope to be able to raise the money for my shows and book production. The funds will be used for printing the first 500 copies of my book, rental space, framing, invitations, marketing, installation and all of the other things that go along with launching major solo exhibitions. 
If I do not reach my entire goal on this round, I will purchase 100 copies using Blurb to publish. However, Blurb's prices are far higher than going to a traditional printer. Nonetheless, have a few copies in hand will be beneficial as people would rather see a product in hand.  From there, I will continue to collect the funds until I reach my goal by holding future funding campaigns. I've also submitted applications via my local arts organizations for grants and currently awaiting the status. 
For your generous contribution, you will receive signed and personalized copies of Feminine Transitions along with recognition in the book’s marketing materials, which will be distributed to hundreds of media outlets. Higher-level sponsors can take advantage of tickets to the Feminine Transitions book launch party, prominent logo placements and even a full photography session from Alyscia Cunningham Photography.
In order to spread this important message of self-confidence to communities around the country, this project relies on support from individuals and organizations like yours. Please help make an impact and be part of this global movement by supporting Feminine Transitions at one of the perk levels. To contribute or to find out more information, please don’t hesitate to contact me directly at AlysciaC@aol.com. Thank you for your consideration and your generosity.
 
The Impact
As a valued contributor of Feminine Transitions, you can play an essential role in helping thousands of girls and women love what they see in the mirror and feel more comfortable in their skin. Your donation will directly fund the book’s production and the Feminine Transitions exhibition, which is currently slated to appear in ten U.S. cities, including DC, CA, OH, IL, NY, NC, SC, TN, GA, AL and UT.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Word of mouth goes such a long way.  Now a days, social media is the way of the future. In other words, you can really help to make this campaign successful by spreading the word.  Do you have Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Tumblr, LinkedIn...or even an email?  The biggest help you can give, other than making a financial contribution, is telling others.  Post it on any or your social media sites and send info for my campaign via email.
I sincerely thank you for coming to my page to take a look at my project. I want to share the beauty of Feminine Transitions with the world. Your contribution is helping to make this happen.

story:
Short Summary

Protesto is a photography project aimed at creating social change, by providing a platform for individuals to speak-out.

 

Project Goals

The goal is the creation of a reportage of images and stories documenting truths of the human condition. 

Captured from a grassroots, philosophical and humanistic perspective, allowing the viewer a windows into anothers life.

Unlike our main-stream-media the project is focused on the individual.  By providing a voice to those who are ignored or whos voice has been surpressed Protesto hopes to create a functional tool for social change.


Protest also hopes to serve as historic documentation to life in a 21st centuary civilization.  If we start to acknowledge our mistakes we are able to make steps to change them.

Finally, Protesto hopes to empower its users by listening and providing sponsors the opportunity to direct through crowd-steering.

 

What is the approach of Protesto?

Each subject will be documented through the medium of photography combined with personal audio narrative recorded from the individual. 

The two seperate perspectives will merge into the creation of a single audio photofilm, providing a very personal and humanistic view into the subjects life.

Photofilms will be made freely available on the project website, allowing use for education and awareness of our species.

 

What We Need

To start this project I require two pieces of equipment.

A portable computer with relative software, for:-

  • Image editing & storage
  • Photofilm creation
  • Audio editing
  • Website & Blog / Creation & Management
  • Interation with project sponsors

A portable high quality audio recording device:-

  • To record interviews in high definity audio formats

 

Funding

Funding will be used to purchase the required tools, enabling me to start creation of the project.


If funding does not meet the defined target, the most affordable tools will be purchased allowing the project to move to the next stages.

In the case funding exceeds target, funds will set aside for use on project expeditions, defined though crowd-steering by project sponsors.

 

Why are you doing this

Each and every one of us leaves an impression on life.   In doing so we have the  oppertunity to shape the future of our species. This project represents the footprints I wish to leave and the future I wish to shape.
 

What are the next steps

Once the required equipment has been purchased I will immediatly start to build the project structure and content by recording photofilms in the city of Lisbon Portugal. 

Lisbon is a city at the heart of European austerity.  By initiating the project close to home I am able to build the framework of the project while at the same-time creating content for sponsors to review and provide feedback.  

 
After the initial set-up and content creation, additional promotion and crowdfunding will be sought to fund the first expeditions.  The destination and section of our human society choosen will be co-ordinated with project sponsors.

What you get back

Every single person, sponsor or not, will have the oppertunity to access the complete collection of photofilms for educational purposes.

 

  • Sponsors will have access to exclusive photographic content collected during expeditions to be used for personal use.

 

  • Crowd-steering, enabling user interaction through technology

 

  • Exclusive 35mm film shot while on project assignments, This will be straight out of the camera and never developed.

story:
Who is E.E. Norris?

That's me!  My name's Eugene, I work under the name E.E. Norris as a creative photographic artist in the greatest town on the planet, New York City.

What is Persona?

Persona is, at its most basic, a prospective intimate (read: small) photography studio in NYC.  A soon-to-be-open room in my apartment will be converted into a full-time studio space and serve as its location.  Simple.

What makes Persona Studio different?

In short, the photographer.

You often see the human body, especially in the realm of contemporary photography, portrayed as and mistaken for a reduction of who one is, inviting a kind of valuation that I never found fair or accurate.  It's because of this the human form hadn't been a favorite subject for me to photograph.

That all changed when I was given the opportunity to take a number of portraits in a setting I controlled.  To my surprise, my differing interpretation of people and the human body actually translated to the end result of what appeared in the frame.  What I saw was imagery that, for me, expanded thoughts on what it was to be human.  That the reduction of people is not something inherent to photography as a medium, but maybe the result of the perspective of those taking the pictures.

You see, to me our bodies and how we present them are best characterized as a performing art piece; an ever-evolving physical culmination of an individual's creative decisions coupled with the biological decisions of our ancestors along with the dents and scrapes we may have picked up along the way.  A person's creative mind brushing paint upon a given physical canvas.

And that might alter a viewer's perspective.  A body or picture of one isn't "who you are", but merely a visual statement given by its owner.  And yet by lessening what we think a portrait can accurately yield we gain something far greater: a collection of diverse creations of the human mind made physical.  The more diversity in these visual statements from individual to individual we see, the more wonder, perhaps even hope and vision we may elicit for humanity's potential.

Like I mentioned before, this interpretation resulted in shots that seem to me a little different from the rest.  Rather than photos whose primary mission is showcasing physical aesthetics or mechanics, they were shots that attempted to illustrate the physical manifestation of each individual's creative mind.  And that's something I thought was worth pursuing and sharing.

That's why I want to begin this project.  To open up how people view their own bodies and to change how they're perceived by others, and perhaps have some of those others join in and so on and so forth.  To unlearn notions of physical beauty and in its stead offer the far great breadth and depth to be found in the realm that is human creativity.

Anyway, that's the aim.

I'm Interested!  What Now?

Great!  If you're in or plan to visit the NYC area, just select the "featured perk", a full studio session with me, and you're now in line to be part of The Persona Project!  If you won't be in the NYC area, consider the "photographer to your door" option where I bring myself and my equipment to you, to shoot either in a studio set up in your home, or wherever else you might want to be photographed!

The first step of any photo session at Persona will start with an interview so I might begin to know you and you get to know me a bit.  This "interview" will start off as a casual chat and can be done anywhere any time or day before the shoot, but I believe it's an important part of the process whether we've never met or we've known each other for a long time.  If you like, you may consider it a bonus addition built into your perk: a pleasant conversation over a beverage on me!

At the end of the chat, we'll discuss and schedule a time convenient for you, and the photo shoot will be carried out in one session, up to 3-hours on site at the new Persona Studio.

A comfortable and convivial experience is important and will be fostered, as I know being in front of the camera presents plenty of challenges even in the best of circumstances.  Another big thing I've learned in the course of studio photography is that modeling is not easy!  But the people I've worked with have all left with positive feelings about the shoot and are eager to shoot again soon.  You can be rest assured I'm going to keep doing what I do to keep that record intact.

After the session is done, you get to go home as I get to work picking the best of the images captured and processing them.  After about a week, the results along with the rest of the raw shots not picked will be put on a portable usb flash drive for you to keep, print, share as you wish!

What if I'm Looking for Something Specific, Like Headshots or a Product Shoot?

Actor in need of headshots?  Or perhaps you're looking for corporate headshots?  Or you're a business owner and are seeking out high-quality product shots.  In any of these cases, we'll knock them out and they'll be fantastic, whether you'd like the shots to be purely functional or you'd like them to really stand out, we can make it happen.  And if you like, any additional time afterwards can be used to shoot more thoughtful pieces as explained above.

The same goes for family portraits, or any specifically utilitarian studio portraiture you'd like done.  Exceptions would be things like boudoir or any heavily stylized photography, as photography along those lines would be speaking in a creative voice that isn't really mine.

If you aren't sure whether your specific requests can be done or you have any questions at all, just click the "ask a question" link above and I'll be more than happy to answer any queries you might have!

What Exactly Will the Start Up Contributions Go Towards?

The relatively low number to Persona's startup target are in part due to the fact I already own almost all of the lighting and photo gear necessary for this endeavor.  So, the $1,200 accounts for ~$250 worth of backdrop rig and the rest to cover a month of the rent for the room (this is actually not bad, NYC is a crazy expensive place!)

Anything beyond that will pay for the room's rent in the months beyond and assure that Persona has a home.

Beyond that... maybe I print a book featuring you in it.  But we're getting ahead of ourselves

Anything Else I Should Know?

Firstly, you should know I'm excited about this project and I'm excited for any of you who want to be a part of it!  That said, it's prudent to be transparent about any risks involved when presenting any new enterprise.  Nice thing about this project is that its so simple that there's not a lot of moving parts when it comes to getting things off the ground.

  1. The room will be cleared out save for whatever useful furniture that will remain, and the equipment such as backgrounds, lighting, and tripods will be moved in.  Photography studios are good that way, less is usually more.
  2. The room is on the small size for a studio, but I've tested it and it should get the job done for the vast majority of shot ideas.  Limitations are cause for improvisation, which I do well, so while this may crop up as a challenge from time to time, I don't think of it as any sort of road block.
  3. So all that leaves is your support and participation!  Not only is your monetary contribution essential in starting the studio and assuring its financially viability, your participation in making images to share with your family, friends, and the world is central to the central mission of the studio and collection, that is to visually evoke wonder for the real potential of humanity through human creativity.

Thank you so much for your time.  I hope for even those unused to the idea of being in front of a camera that you've been swayed in this take on studio photography, and I look forward to your unique part of it.

Extra Thanks!

To the models in the video and on the page, I look forward to working with you again soon!  You can see more great photos of them at theartcartnyc.com/persona

And To Asa Wember who took out an entire day to help construct an awesome pitch video.

And of course the donors, Benjamin Mathes, Corey Smith, Chris Biddle, Ken Sander, Jenny Butler-Cole, Denise Lim, Megan Guinta, Eddie Sloan, Mo Yvonne, and Laura Pelli.  And for those of you thinking of donating, I can't wait to put your names right here!

story:
Pourquoi ce projet?

Cliquer pour entendre l'entrevue du 26 mars à Radio-Canada


Qui suis-je

Simon Emond est un photographe autodidacte né à Hébertville le 6 avril 1992. Depuis quatre ans, il consacre sa vie professionnelle à ce médium. Il a obtenu une nomination en 2014 au Gala des lauréats de la Chambre de Commerce Lac-Saint-Jean Est dans la catégorie choix du public - entreprise de services et  il a gagné le prix de la Fondation de l'Entrepreneurship du Québec en 2015.  

Emond ancre sa production artistique dans son milieu, notamment à travers la production de calendriers permettant de soutenir financièrement la Maison des jeunes d’Hébertville et celle d’Hébertville-Station. La ville d’Alma a également fait appel à lui pour son calendrier soulignant son 150e anniversaire.

Il a lancé un projet d’hommage photographique dont les portraits grands formats sont exposés à l’entrée du dépanneur le Campagnard, plaque tournante du village. Ces portraits mettent en évidence des villageoises et villageois jouant un rôle particulier dans la vie de la petite communauté. Il est aussi depuis 3 ans le photographe attitré pour l’équipe Nutrinor lors du grand défi Pierre Lavoie et certaines de ces images ont été choisies par l’organisation pour sa couverture médiatique nationale.

Le projet de ce journal s’inscrit parfaitement dans cette démarche.
 

Pourquoi une campagne de sociofinancement ?

La prévente permet de financer l’aspect global du projet et la production de copies qui seront remises gratuitement dans la communauté.
 

Les types de soutien et leur impact dans la communauté

Selon votre don, vous permettez l'édition de copies du journal qui seront distribuées gratuitement dans des lieux publics. Cette diffusion permettra de lever le voile sur des réalités vécues en région découlant d'orientations sexuelles minoritaires.

 

Si l'objectif est atteint, à quoi servira les fonds supplémentaire ?

Plus nous récoltons d'argent, plus de copies pourront être imprimés et plus l'impact du journal sera important.

story:
About Me

Hello! My name is Jesse Hurler, and I am a 22 year old student at William Paterson University currently pursuing my Masters Degree. Although I am pursuing a career which is separate from the creative world, I have recently fallen in love with photography as a hobby, an art form which has opened up a whole new world in which I can express myself creatively. It is something that I am fairly new to, but completely inspired by.

I have recently been given the incredible opportunity to have some of my photos displayed in a photo gallery as a solo exhibition for a two month installment. This is a great honor which is not only a high personal achievement for myself, but will help me to expand my audience of viewers and open new doors to creating and sharing my photos with the world.

Visit My Flickr Page

What We Need  

The reason I have created this page and why I am reaching out to you is because I am in great need of funding in order to make this gallery show a reality and a success! 

The funds raised here will go directly to the different costs involved in preparing for and setting up the photos for the gallery space. These preparations include: 

  • The purchase of individual matted frames for the photos
  • The costs of printing high-quality/high resolution copies of the photos
  • Transportation to and from the gallery for setup 
  • The gallery's fee for allowing me to hold my exhibition in their space

My fundraising goal is set at $600, an amount which I believe will be sufficient to cover all costs. Even if my goal is not reached, the money will still go towards the gallery exhibition preparation costs.

What You Get

To show my great appreciation to those who choose to help contribute to my efforts, there are perks involved for you which vary according to the amount that is contributed! These perks are outlined along the right side of the page, and involve free prints of my work in a range of sizes according to each level of contribution!

As I stated earlier, every little bit helps, and even if I do not reach my goal the money will still go towards my gallery show costs. If, however, my goal is reached or exceeded, the extra funds will go towards YOU, the contributors, in the form of extra personalized prints of my work to be sent to you as perks for your great kindness and generosity! 

To take advantage of your perks, please visit the link to my Flickr Page: where you may have your choice of any of my photos found there, and email me at jessecarrollhurler@gmail.com in order to send me the link to your photo of choice and let me know which size(s) you wish to be printed (if applicable). 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that money is tight these days, and I realize that not everybody may be able to contribute funds to my effort - It's OK! But this doesn't mean that you can't still help out by spreading the word about my cause! Getting the word out to others about my campaign is just as valuable to me as a monetary contribution -- You can do this on your own by word-of-mouth, or through the use of the Indiegogo share tools, which will allow you to let others know about my fundraising page via social networking sites like facebook and twitter, or through email or any other type of web-sharing process!

story:
This project has already been funded via another crowdfunding platform beginning with 'K'. We want to give the growing community of Meyer Optik lovers another chance to get the wonderful Lydith 30 lens to a price that will never come up again. Moreover we are more than happy to introduce this lens to the Indiegogo community and to bring new magic into the images of photographers that never heard about us before. But now, let us tell you something about the Lydith 30 f/3.5 - a wonderful art lens.

In this project, we want to introduce you to a very special lens - a lens that has the potential to add new dimensions to your photography.
By design, its focal length of 30mm gives your pictures an interesting perspective. But moreover, its unique ability to display simply stunning colors, catch exceptional lights and capture glimpses of a magical moment will offer you undreamt of artistic options.

Its a lens to capture magic in your images like no other. 

 

 

 

Meyer-Optik knows that many people merely evaluate lenses for their optical specifications. Our goal is to enable artist photographers to express what's inside them. We see a lens as a supporting tool for your photographic vision - a paintbrush to bring images from your imagination to life. We made the Lydith 30/f.3.5 available for almost all modern mounts.

The new Lydith fulfils all of this criteria. However, in our prototype test shootings, photographers came back and said: Wow, this little art lens outperformed my expectations so much that we had trouble finding words to express how special it performed.

Sharpness? Contrast? Yes, the Lydith is maybe the sharpest and most contrasty lens in our historic art lens portfolio and of course, as a Meyer-Optik lens, it can produce extraordinary bokeh. But in combination with its ability to capture light - it grows to its full potential.

And we have another treat for you: The Lydith has an extremely low minimum focusing distance of 0.16m. So you can get very close to your object, while still displaying a good portion of the surroundings. If you have a lens at a focal length, you might have things in mind you want to shoot with it. But due to the Lydith's performance, you will try out setups you wouldn't have shot with any other lens at this range. Come on, join us on the journey where the Lydith takes us.

 

 

the Lydith is even perfect to shoot close-ups

What is a magic moment for you? How do you preserve it? There are situations which you simply want to make last forever. Probably, the more special they are, the more fleeting they are or vice versa. It is maybe the most difficult task for a photographer to capture more than a reflection of reality but the underlying spirit of the moment. The Lydith is able to add this third dimension to your pictures.

 

 

The Lydith has always been famous for its amazing ability to catch colors. Colors are the central element to create aesthetic results in your images. The Lydith is able catch colors like no other historic art lens can. But convince yourself.

 

 

The Lydith's character for close-ups is just stunning. Due to its minimal focusing distance of only 0.16m, the Lydith is perfect for intimate close-ups giving your shots a personal and emotional touch. Due to its compact size, it won't intimidate your subjects - a huge advantage when shooting children or anybody who is not a professional model. As a result, you will create natural, fascinating pictures so close that you can look in your model's heart and soul.

 

 

 

To portray people in their natural environments is perhaps one of the most interesting jobs in photography. Those pictures tell an entire story, including attitudes, moods and the spirit of a person. The Lydith is the perfect lens if you have a story to tell. It can capture little details, conveying emotion and adding an artistic touch to your pictures while maintaining a natural flavour.

 

 

Those who already follow us on social media know that we have an affinity for extraordinay nature shots. So, of course, the Lydith masters this class on an equal level. Oh boy, and how it does! Even everyday scenes become magic. Look at these scenes and enjoy!

 

 

Painting with light is the very meaning of photography. The Lydith can create a very soft bokeh, similar to a watercolor picture. In backlit situations the bokeh appears like it was painted with an art brush, while the focussed object is sharp. Therefore, the Lydith is the perfect lens to play with bokeh and to design your pictures from fore to background.

 

 

 

The Lydith 30mm f3.5 is built using the same platform that we used for our Trioplan 50 and 35mm lenses. Thus we take advantage of some economies of scale and can offer this breathtaking lens to our backers at a very special price. Following our design principles, this lens is compact and light and weights just above 220g.

The historical Lydith and its construction

We have set extremely tight standards in our lens design that can only be met by using the best Schott and Ohara glasses and having them produced under the toughest quality measures. We will be using a special coating in the front and back lens that will make the lenses extremely durable and tough for a lifelong enjoyment.

You certainly can imagine that running such a project is only possible thanks to the help of many helping hands.
Our special thanks goes to our prototype test photographers. Their feedback of you is essential to create these wonderful art lenses.
Let us introduce a few who have contributed pictures to this campaign, ladies first:

Tamara Skudies
Tamara has assisted us with test shoots from the very beginning. Always hands-on, she develops tons of creative ideas from scratch. Tamara is a nature photography enthusiast, well known for her ability to see colours in her own, wonderful artsy way.

Raffaele Horstmann
Raffaele has worked for us as a consultant photographer since the very beginning. He assists us with his direct feedback as a photographer and is one of the first to get his hands on Meyer-Optik lenses.

Firat Bagdu
Firat is a Cologne based portrait photographer, who has worked with us for almost a year now. You can distinguish Firats shoots by his incomparable ability to convey emotion in pictures. 

Benedikt Ernst
Benedikt, is one of the pillars when it comes to testshootings.
As a professional fashion photographer, he has a weakness for historic lenses. What a fit for us.

 

Shipping Information

The new Lydith 30 will be available worldwide. Your lens will be shipped internationally from Germany. Since local regulations vary, please note that we cannot be held responsible for additional sales taxes or import/customs fees added by your country. If you have a question about shipping or handling, please don’t hesitate to contact us! 

Deliveries to the European Union: Shipping costs within the European Union are $20 USD. For our supporters from the European Union, please note that VAT is not included. So please add an extra of 19% (VAT Germany) to your pledge for deliveries within the European Union.

Deliveries to the U.S.: Shipping costs of the lenses in the U.S. are $20 USD. Please note that sales tax is not included and must be added in line with local regulations.

Deliveries outside U.S. and the European Union: For deliveries to regions outside U.S. or the European Union the shipping costs are $50 USD.

Please note there may be extra import costs/customs/taxes to pay upon delivery, depending on your location. Customs and taxes are subject to possible change and applicable law at the time of delivery will have to be taken into account. If you have a question about shipping or handling, please don’t hesitate to contact us! If you have forgotten to add VAT/sales tax to your pledge, you can just raise it as long as the Indiegogo project is live.

 

Risks and Challenges

Any new venture or innovation includes an element of risk. The Lydith is no different.

Meyer Optik has a strong and experienced team of manufacturing, photography and business professionals. We have carefully evaluated and mitigated all foreseeable risks and challenges, but may face unforeseen events. We have already successfully designed, created and tested the several prototypes of the lens. Each of the final lenses will be hand-made in Germany, and we have already started to set up serial production. Each lens is carefully made and is of high-value and we will take extra precautions to ensure each one is shipped carefully.

Our delivery dates, as outlined in the campaign, are based on careful planning and our manufacturing experience with the Trioplan 100, but may change due to materials, suppliers and unforeseen events. We will ensure that we keep each of our supporters fully updated. Conversely, it is important that all backers keep us updated of their address before we ship the final rewards. Any reshipping will require additional payments.

story:
THE FLINT PORTRAIT PROJECT IS GUARANTEED TO COME TO FRUITION. I AM COMMITTED TO MY BACKERS AND THE CITIZENS OF FLINT AS MY PHOTOGRAPHY IS FOUNDED IN THE INTEGRITY OF MY WORD...


The Plan:
In June of 2016, I will be in Flint, Michigan making photographs. I have allocated 7 days to  shoot portraits, complying as many portraits as possible. The photographs will consist of street and environmental portraiture. Many people I will meet in transit, others in their homes, or place of business. All participants will be residents of Flint. These portraits will then be taken a step further utilizing lead contaminated Flint water for the completion. Further process details can be found in the campaign's Gallery section. Every individual photographed will be mailed a print of themselves free of charge for their participation in the Flint Portrait Project. The Flint Portrait Project will bridge the waters between Fine Art Photography and Documentary Photography creating a timeless, unique, and engaging record of strength and perseverance. Once complete the project will be pitched for exhibition to media outlets, galleries, community centers, and museums. The groundwork for exhibition and media distribution has already begun...

Who Am I:

My name is Matt Ivey I am 34 years-old, hold an MFA in Photography, am a Documentary Photographer, Professor of Art, Community Education Instructor of Photography, Artist, Husband, Father, and Stranger to None. In November 2015, my wife and I were granted the surprise of a lifetime. Told a little lady was soon to join our family a baby boy was born. Since becoming a Dad each day is a surprise, and at this time in my life I can confidently declare I am one of the luckiest men on earth. Unfortunately, a portion of my luck is derived from the suffering of others. Fatherhood has made the Flint water crisis much more impactful to me. Fortunate, I am able to draw a bath for my son and if needed mix a little water with his milk, all with an absence of concern for lead poisoning.  Sadly, Flint endures a daily crisis for which I struggle to fathom, through their suffering I am reminded of my family's good fortune, and am galvanized to use my skillset to benefit Flint in some manner. 

What's in it for You, What's in it for Me:

Declare that you not only think about needed change, but in fact support/ed real change. The Perk you purchase will serve as a reminder in times of doubt that people truly do care and you are in fact one of them. No matter what Perk you have or plan to purchase I am eternally grateful for your support! As a work of art each Perk will meet and surpass professional standards. Every Perk a unique item, with not one created via mass production. All prints will be archival capable of standing the test of time, after you and I are gone your Perk much like Flint, will remain.

I have extensively whittled away at the budget producing a figure that I can effectively achieve the Flint Portrait Project on. Here is the Flint Portrait Project's Budget Breakdown...

  • Prints for Flint Participants: Flint residents that are photographed will be mailed a portrait of themselves. Each resident photographed will be given my contact info so they can update their shipping address if needed prior to the print being shipped. Flint residents will be provided this print FREE of charge.
  • The Perks: In order to supply my amazing backers with their purchased Perks I must be able to clear the costs of production. Production costs will be the Postcards, Prints, Mounting, Mattes, Shipping Materials, and Shipping Costs.
  • 8 Nights in a Motel: I have secured lodging for under $40 a night in Flint. I will not be staying in a lavish hotel, as that would be extremely hypocritical given that the people I will be photographing are not provided with luxurious living. 
  • Gas for my 98' Camry: Yep, she keeps on ticking. Flint is 770 miles from my home in Memphis. Since I will be driving to Flint and once there around Flint, I will be putting around 2000 miles on the odometer. Still, much cheaper than flying and renting a car. 
  • Meals:  Admittedly, I must eat, and when on assignment I honestly do little of that. Once I start photographing it becomes all-consuming, usually an energy bar for breakfast and dinner once the sun sets. 
  • Bottled Water: I will need to purchase safe drinking water, I also aim to purchase enough so that in the event an individual needs a drink of water to offset the June heat I will be able to provide them with hydration. 
  • Cigarettes (Not for Me): While I do not smoke, nor advise people to smoke, I will purchase a few packs to take to Flint. You would be amazed as a documentary photographer the avenues cigarettes and a lighter can lead you down. If asked for a smoke and you provide, an immediate connection is solidified. This connection often leads to an amazing story. 
  • Lens Rental: I plan to rent a wider lens from the trusted folks at lensrental.com. Mainly I will be shooting with my 32mm f1.8 lens on my mirrorless camera, but I need to have a wider lens on hand for shooting in tighter spaces.
  • Campaign Fees: As we all learned long ago, "Nothing in life is free." Both Indiegogo and the payment processors charge me a service fee on all transactions. 
Impact:
Together we can shed light on the faces of Flint. The citizens of Flint deserve acknowledgement for the injustices that have been committed against them. My goal is to bring the faces of Flint to a broader demographic via artistic means. The media has already begun it's migration away from the Flint Water Crisis, and aid to Flint will gradually decrease. My hope is that the portraits I create will continue to resurface, reigniting the conversation about clean water. This reemergence will hopefully assist in assuring continued resources to the citizens of Flint and beyond. It is unclear to me what the impact will be in the end, however I know if I do not complete the Flint Portrait Project than I will I have squandered away an opportunity to create some level of change. Please join me in creating change. 

Sharing is Caring: 

I ask that you please share the Flint Portrait Project via social media, email, word-of-mouth, and by any/all means necessary. Your networking is as, if not, more important than my own. You will aid me in making or breaking this endeavor. This effort is about community and can only be achieved TOGETHER. Again endless thanks for the support! 

Special Thanks To:

  • The citizens of Flint for not stepping down and fighting on!
  • Water You Fighting For and Melissa Mays.
  • Professor Marc Edwards for giving a damn when so many did not.
  • My wife Jenny for her endless support of my endless eccentricities.
  • Craig Mammano for his words of wisdom over the years.
  • Seba Kurtis for encouraging me to turn personal passion into photography.
  • Pieter Wisse for his humility, and overwhelming dedication to photography.
  • Family and friends who continually boost my often battered and bruised ego.
  • Memphis College of Art for the opportunity to educate and learn from others.

Gas for my 98' Camry: Yep, she keeps on ticking. Flint is 770 miles from my home in Memphis. Since I will be driving to Flint and once there around Flint, I will be putting around 2000 miles on the odometer. Still, much cheaper than flying and renting a car. 

Meals:  Admittedly, I must eat, and when on assignment I honestly do little of that. Once I start photographing it becomes all-consuming, usually an energy bar for breakfast and dinner once the sun sets. 

Bottled Water: I will need to purchase safe drinking water, I also aim to purchase enough so that in the event an individual needs a drink of water to offset the June heat I will be able to provide them with hydration. 

Cigarettes (Not for Me): While I do not smoke, nor advise people to smoke, I will purchase a few packs to take to Flint. You would be amazed as a documentary photographer the avenues cigarettes and a lighter can lead you down. If asked for a smoke and you provide, an immediate connection is solidified. This connection often leads to an amazing story. 

Lens Rental: I plan to rent a wider lens from the trusted folks at lensrental.com. Mainly I will be shooting with my 32mm f1.8 lens on my mirrorless camera, but I need to have a wider lens on hand for shooting in tighter spaces.

Campaign Fees: As we all learned long ago, "Nothing in life is free." Both Indiegogo and the payment processors charge me a service fee on all transactions. 


Impact:
Together we can shed light on the faces of Flint. The citizens of Flint deserve acknowledgement for the injustices that have been committed against them. My goal is to bring the faces of Flint to a broader demographic via artistic means. The media has already begun it's migration away from the Flint Water Crisis, and aid to Flint will gradually decrease. My hope is that the portraits I create will continue to resurface, reigniting the conversation about clean water. This reemergence will hopefully assist in assuring continued resources to the citizens of Flint and beyond. It is unclear to me what the impact will be in the end, however I know if I do not complete the Flint Portrait Project than I will I have squandered away an opportunity to create some level of change. Please join me in creating change. Sharing is Caring:  I ask that you please share the Flint Portrait Project via social media, email, word-of-mouth, and by any/all means necessary. Your networking is as, if not, more important than my own. You will aid me in making or breaking this endeavor. This effort is about community and can only be achieved TOGETHER. Again endless thanks for the support! 
Special Thanks To:

The citizens of Flint for not stepping down and fighting on!

Water You Fighting For and Melissa Mays.

Professor Marc Edwards for giving a damn when so many did not.
My wife Jenny for her endless support of my endless eccentricities.

Craig Mammano for his words of wisdom over the years.

Seba Kurtis for encouraging me to turn personal passion into photography.

Pieter Wisse for his humility, and overwhelming dedication to photography.
Family and friends who continually boost my often battered and bruised ego.

Memphis College of Art for the opportunity to educate and learn from others.

story:
UPDATE  - 11/2/2014

 Just over halfway through the campaign, and I think I am starting to gain a little traction. I was getting discouraged at first, wanting to give up, but I realized that I will have plenty of time to sulk once the campaign is over, and I can still make this happen. 

I just wanted to point out that my goal is not something that is set it stone, but rather a cushion that I feel will help me really get this thing off the ground should I reach my goal. Even if I only make 25-50% of it, it will be a good start and I will still do everything I can to get this thing off the ground. You guys are just helping me get closer and making it more accessible to someone like me. 

Since I have started, I have been slowly adding to a fund that will go directly towards this project and will only be used to get these books printed. However, I do not plan to add it to this campaign because there are too many 3rd parties that want their cut from whatever comes through this campaign. Indiegogo takes 10% and I think Paypal takes 2%, so instead of giving them even more, everything I have saved will go in the pile once the campaign is complete and I receive the funds that I have raised. So far I have $500 from my own personal stash saved up, and I have been adding to it whenever I have a little extra cash. So just so you know I am not relying 100% on you guys. 

I am extremely grateful for all of my supporters who are helping me out and want to see me succeed here, your kindness has brought tears to my eyes, and not just from those that have contributed, but those that have said kind words about me and my work that continues to blow me away every day. You are all amazing and keep me pushing to succeed instead of wanting to give up like I feel sometimes. Even if I don't make my goal, or even come close, just the words alone have lifted me up so much. I don't even know what to say anymore...THANK YOU ALL!! Let's see what happens from here...



Salt n Meat

Hey everyone! thank you for checking out my campaign! Before we begin, I would like to tell you a little bit about myself and why I am here. For those who do not know me, My name is Adam and I am a music photographer, raised in the heart of the Rocky Mountains in beautiful Colorado. I attended Colorado Mountain College for Professional Photography, and graduated in the spring of 2014 with an Associates of Applied Science. I am currently finishing up my second AAS in Graphic Design.

Music is MY LIFE. It is the only thing that truly matters to me more than anything. In close second is photography, and third is travelling, I have found a way to combine all three by photographing live concerts and musicians on stage as well as off. I have travelled thousands of miles all over the US chasing my favorite bands and photographing them as well as my travels. There is no greater feeling than putting miles and miles behind you while the stereo is blasting and the wind is in your hair; well, except for seeing your favorite band live!!

One of the greatest experiences of my life was the first ever Farmageddon Records Music Festival in July of 2012. I never met a group of people so friendly and welcoming, people who I had never met before in my life suddenly became family. And to make matters worse, it was four days FILLED with intense, powerful, and inspiring music. Definitely a life changing/eye opening experience!! I had been to tons of music festivals before, but nothing even touched this one. I was hooked, and I wanted to share my experience with others through my photography. 

After the festival, I compiled a book of my photographs from my experience for a Self Publishing class. It originally started out as a personal project, and after showing it to my friends and classmates, it turned into something much bigger. After a lot of struggle, and with the help of a very good friend, I eventually got my first book printed so that others could enjoy my work for themselves. I sold a few copies but it did not take off like I thought it would. My original plan was to take all the money made from the first book to fund the second book, and then take the money from the second book to fund the third, and so on....But by the time I got the 2012 book finally printed, FF13 had already came and went, and we were now gearing up for 2014. I was able to sell some of my books here and there, but it was not enough to cover the cost of the next production.



Farm Fest 2012 Book Preview


So this is what brings me here. My idea is to raise all the funds to get BOTH 2013 and 2014 Farm books printed at the same time, that way I don't have to struggle two more times, I can just do it once and get it over with! Obviously this is a very expensive project, it will take a lot of hard work and patience. But I love seeing people enjoy my work, and I love sharing these memories with the people that helped create them, so I am dedicated to this project 100%. I'm hoping that this campaign will help me get this project off the ground. Because I have had so many people express interest in these books, I am fairly confident I will not have a problem reaching my goal.


Farm Fest 2013 promo poster

It is important to me that I reach this goal because I have put so much time and hard work into this project. Countless hours spent editing photos from ALL 3 festivals, designing the content and layout of the books, research and endless emails trying to find the right company to print my books, not to mention the hard work just creating the photographs, but that was the fun part! So many people have been interested in these books, I want to make sure every person that supports me can be a part of it and have something to cherish for the rest of their lives: a book full of amazing memories and moments that they can share with their friends and hopefully get more people interested in supporting this scene. I have gotten a lot of encouraging words from my friends and the musicians I have worked with, and I know that I have a lot of people that will back me up. 


Farm Fest 2014 promo poster

Ragz N Bones:

In order to keep the price of these books affordable, I have found a company overseas that will print them for significantly cheaper than in the US. It is still not cheap, but it is more realistic for someone who is doing this all on his own. The bulk of the funds I receive will be used to print the 2013 and 2014 books, all at once, so I can get them both done in one shot. There is a minimum order of 100 books per order, so I plan to order 100 of each book, totalling 200 books. This will be around $4000-5000, not including shipping. (I am still waiting to hear back on a quote. I will update this as soon as I find out what that is.)

The remainder of the funds I receive (within the goal) will go towards all the expenses that come with it. Getting the books shipped to me (from another continent=not cheap!) All of my shipping costs to get the books to you; and all of the miscellaneous supplies needed to complete the campaign, (shipping envelopes, prints and photo mailers to keep your prints safe, postage, etc.)

And we can't forget Indiegogo's cut. (you know those bastards are making a KILLING right now.)

Anything beyond my goal will be used to put in a second order for the 2012 books, and possibly more of the others if there is a high demand for them.

If I do not reach my goal, whatever funds I do receive will go directly towards printing up as many books as I can anyway, even if it is not as much as I had originally hoped for. And if I still can't afford the 100 book minimum, The money will be set aside until I can afford the order myself. This project is far too important to me to fail now!

I have never been a big fan of crowdfunding in general. There have been some pretty interesting campaigns, but for the most part I feel like it is just people begging for money with nothing to give back. It is important not to look at my campaign this way, but instead as a form of pre-order. You pay for the product in advance to help fund the production, and afterwards you receive the product that you paid for. I absolutely hate asking for handouts. I believe that you should always get something in return for your hard earned cash. To alleviate this hatred I have created a list of perks at various levels so that everyone can get something in return for their contribution. Some are kind of silly, but the rest are pretty straightforward. All of these perks are unique to this campaign, and offer a special book discount not available anywhere else. (Original book price is $40 per book) I've even set it up so the more books you buy, the more you save. 

I have also been working with some of the bands for all you hardcore music fans out there. They have put together some surprise merch packages for me to mix it up a bit and add something a little different. Some of the items offered are rare or out-of-print, so you may just score a sweet treasure with your package! Keep checking back because I may be adding new ones throughout the campaign!!

All perks will be shipped out immediately after the campaign ends, with the exception of the new books. As I am getting closer to my goal, I will be able to get the production started before the end of the campaign so that when it is over all I will have to do is pay the balance for the books and they will ship them out to me. I am hoping that they will be shipped out to you before the holidays, but with a production of this size, it can sometimes be unpredictable and things can happen. But you can expect to have your books around that time. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you're like me, and you have been saving up all summer long to make it to Farm Fest (or Muddy Roots, or BOTH) you probably don't have a lot of extra money lying around. And that is totally understandable! You are not completely useless to me (yet!) You can still help by spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends and family. Every single share makes a difference, so please don't hesitate to post this on your facebook, twitter, g+ or whatever form of social networking you currently use. There are plenty of tools to make this process very easy!


    I would also like to mention that for every book sold I will be donating $1 to the Farm House Transitional Living organization to help people in need get back on their feet. Check out their facebook page here and be sure to give them a like!

    If you have any questions about the campaign, the perks or anything else, please feel free to contact me at info@silverandcold.com! Thanks for checking out my campaign and I hope to see you at Farm Fest 2015!!!

story:
Let's open this pit!
Hi, my name is Michelle Olaya and I'm a hc-punk photographer actually based in Bayern, Germany.

Since 2007  I have been taking pictures at several hardcore and punk shows/festivals in Spain, Germany and other European countries. Few years ago I started shooting photos of people with tattoos related with hardcore and punk bands. We know that music and tattoos are linked in some way. We know how hardcore and punk music have caught a lot people all around the world and some of us want show our love and passion to those bands getting tattoos in our skins as a tribute for the 'blood & sweat' we give to.  HC-PUNK shows are full of energy, every single kid enjoy to see his/her favorite band and singalong or stage diving with  while that awesome song is blasting in our ears, as well as every musician spreading the adrenaline while playing on the stage. All these things are reflected in this book.
I believe in the ethics of the D.I.Y of the hardcore-punk scene and that's how this book is gonna be published, no big publishing companies or so, just by HC KIDS for HC KIDS. Therefore this fundraising campaign together with the support of CRUZADE RECORDS from Spain will be the help for publishing the book. All money  raised (even if the total amount of the goal is not reached) will go entirely to cover the expenses of the printing which will be a limited edition.

You can see a sneak peek of what you will see inside the book on the following link and video:
http://music.michelleolaya.com



Some info about:
Color and Black&White photographs.
Texts by Scott Vogel - TERROR and Martijn Van den Heuvel - NO TURNING BACK. Greg StraightEdge. 
Cover Design by Staffan Snitting & Jacob Bondesson.
Print Length: around 144 pages. 
Book Size: 20x20cm
Hardcover
Release date: tbc, SUMMER 2015.

How much you could be your contribution? 

Any cent counts! You can donate any amount of money you want. I offer a couple perks if you interested to get something further for your cooperation.

No money? no problem!

If you have not money to contribute, it is not problem mate!

HARDCORE-PUNK is a community and giving a helping hand as sharing this champaign through your social networks or by email to you friends will be so good too! I would be very grateful with you if you spread the word about this fundraising and share the link so that way more people who can know about it.

story:
ASB at UIUC

ASB is a program of the University YMCA as well as a registered student organization with the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, working to provide university students the opportunity to directly work with and learn about a variety of social justice issues.

Alternative Spring Break's mission is to educate students about social, political, and environmental issues through direct service, group reflections, student leadership, diversity, and engagement beyond the local community. Participants will develop empathy and be motivated to action with the local community.

Our Trip

The UIUC 2013 Spring ASB Trip to Selma, AL is raising money to donate to Freedom Foundation. Students from the University of Illinois will be volunteering at in Selma with Freedom Foundation for the entire week of our Spring Break. After our experience we are going to write a check from Alternative Spring Break to the Freedom Foundation to show our support for their cause. Any funds raised over $200 will be put into the ASB Maria Somma Scholarship Fund.

Freedom Foundation

Freedom Foundation is a completely volunteer based organization and is dedicated to seeing that the next generation has an equal chance at life. They participate in several activities that the children wish to engage in, such as plays, presentations, etc. Participants on this trip will see the history of Selma, Alabama and learn how children are actively engaging in the decisions of our future through outreach.

story:
Thank you everyone who donated! The final total donated was $3,125. I learned a lot doing this fundraiser (this was my first crowd funding project ever!) and I'm definitely grateful to everyone who supported, shared, critiqued, and contacted me about this project. Although $3,125 is obviously short of my goal, I get to keep most of the donations (minus a 9% fee)  thanks to IndieGoGo's Flexible Funding system. 

I have been asked if I'll do another fundraiser. The answer is YES ~ but I'm not sure when I'll put another one online. The biggest lesson I learned from doing this one is to break up my funding goals into chunks so the next fundraiser will probably be for $3,000 or less so that it will be easier for me to meet the goal and to get all the money donated.

For right now, I'm concentrating on traveling and interviewing cosplayers during the last few months of 2012. You can keep up with my travels via the Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/BreakingAllTheRulesCosplay or my blog: http://www.seventhmoon.org/blog where I post my con reports and various articles about people I meet on my journey. Also please visit the main book page, http://www.seventhmoon.org/cosplayphotobook. 

Thank you again for all your support and interest in this book!

------------------------------------------------

Costume Play - a Japanese word originally coined describe the hobby of designing and dressing up in costumes. While that may bring up images of Halloween, costume players - or "cosplayers" - now go all out with painstakingly accurate replicas of their favorite costumes from TV shows, cartoons, comics, and movies. Cosplay has moved from a niche corner of Japanese geekdom to a global pop culture phenomenon that includes the United States.

Breaking All the Rules is a photobook that showcases the people behind the costumes. Cosplay is a hobby that breaks all the rules: anyone of any size, any race, any age, any gender, any background, can cosplay. For the past year, I've been traveling around the East Coast taking photos of cosplayers in costume and asking them why they're so in love with this hobby and the culture around it. I'd like to expand my travels to the rest of the country and interview cosplayers around the United States about their personal cosplay stories, and discover more about the history behind cosplaying and fan conventions.

This book will be a compliation of all those photographs and interviews, showcasing cosplayers in their own words. I'm raising funds here on Indiegogo to take the photographs needed for the book, and then design, print, and publish them in a full-color photobook. I don't have the money to make this book happen on my own, but thanks to Indiegogo, I want to make this project a reality.

 

This is a book for cosplayers, people who love cosplayers, and also those asking what cosplay is. While it may seem strange to express oneself through a costume designed for a fictional character, those characters are the most important part. People's lives are changed by stories, factual or fictional, every day. Those characters in those stories - the characters who they cosplay - have helped people discover new, different parts of themselves. Cosplay is the ultimate tribute, to say that yes, my outlook, my friendships, and my life have forever changed because of this story.

In this book, I'm sharing the new stories that have come about because of these tributes. The cosplayers I'm photographing and interviewing are everyday, ordinary people. They're students, waitresses, software engineers, musicians, chemists, retail assistants, and managers who, several times a year, put on a costume and become outlaws, fallen villains, ingenues, femme fatales, knights, and heroes starting out on their journeys. They are all extraordinary.

Even in the United States there are many hundreds of thousands of cosplayers, more than I could ever fit into a single book. But I hope this book is a beginning. I hope it can start dialogues between people, no matter how diverse their backgrounds. When asked, "why do you cosplay?" I hope someone can flip through the pages of this book and point to the cosplayers describing in their own words how cosplay has profoundly changed them and made their world a better place.

For more details on the project, please visit the official book website or the Facebook page.

I hope you'll join me in producing this celebration of self-expression all across the USA.

 

About me

I'm a cosplayer and photographer from Boston, MA. I started cosplaying in 2007 and attended my first convention, Anime Boston, in 2008. Being both a cosplayer and photographer has given me a unique perspective on the cosplay culture in America, and I hope to bring that to life in this book.

 

You've got more questions? Here are some answers!

Q: How is this book any different from other books on cosplay, like Cosplay in America?
A: The last thing I want to do is for this book to be perceived as a threat or slight against other people who have published books on cosplay! I don't think that we should stop writing books simply because one or two have already been published on the subject - if that were the case, bookstores would be out of business! I deeply respect the authors of books like Cosplay in America; without people like them, cosplay wouldn't be as widespread as it is today. This book is meant more as a way for cosplayers to tell their stories in their own words. I plan to put emphasis on the interview, with the pictures as an accompaniment. I want to give a voice to cosplayers around the country.

 

Q: $23,244 is a lot of money. Why do you need so much to publish a book?
A:  If the funding goal is reached, Indiegogo takes a 4% cut of any donated funds. Paypal also applies fees (around 3%). I intend to devote the donations first to completing the photo project itself; this inclues airfare to conventions around the country, lodging and other travel costs, equipment maintenance, and photo processing. The remaining funds will go to printing the book, packaging, shipping, and marketing at conventions around the country. I am publishing and printing this book myself in a limited run, and self-publishing is unfortunately incredibly expensive. I absolutely can't make it happen without donors like you.

I have a full funds breakdown and timeline of the project that you can see here on the book website

 

Q: What happens if the donation limit isn't reached?
A: Indiegogo has a wonderful option called "flexible funding," which allows me to keep the money that is raised even if the deadline passes without reaching the goal. However, since most of this money is going to print the books, less money means fewer books, or perhaps lower quality books. I really want to do justice to the cosplayers featured in the book, so I'm crossing my fingers we reach the goal and I can print a really high-quality batch of books.

 

Q: How do I get featured in the book for an interview?
A: All my images are from photos I've taken or will take of cosplayers mostly at different conventions around the country. If you're a U.S. resident, you can fill out the survey form: http://goo.gl/XlRIZ. The survey runs until August 1, 2012. Not all cosplayers who I photograph will be featured, as I'm trying to represent as large a cross-section of the fanbase as I can, but I'll try to fit as many in as possible. Ideally, I'd like there to be around 50 cosplayers in the book. If you're interested in having a photo of yourself in the book by donating $50 or more, please see the next question!

 

Q: How does the $50 photo perk work?
A: Because I can't possibly feature everyone who wants to be in the book, I'm adding in a special perk for cosplayers who I won't have the chance to interview. By donating $50 or more, you will have the option of sending one photograph of you in costume to be included in a special user-submitted photo section of the book (size tbd, minumum 2"x3", maximum 4"x6"). The photos will include your name, your hometown, and the year you started cosplaying. Photos may be color or black&white, and may be taken by anyone provided that the photographer gives permission for it to be published. Full information about this perk will be emailed to everyone after the campaign ends on August 30, 2012.

 

Q: I want to donate but I see that rewards at the higher tiers are limited. Why?
A: I wish I could reward every single person who wanted to donate, but unfortunately, I have to factor in costs such as shipping the reward, adding extra pages to the book for names of donors, and giving away free books, which takes away from the number of books I have to sell. If the book does well, perhaps I'll have more projects and books to give out in the future!

 

Q: I want to donate, but I only have $1. Is that okay?
A: Absolutely! Every dollar helps. And even if you don't have money to donate right now, you can still help by letting people know about this campaign, and what I'm trying to do with this project. Sharing the website link and Facebook link are a big help in spreading the word.
story_txt:
Thank you everyone who donated! The final total donated was $3,125. I learned a lot doing this fundraiser (this was my first crowd funding project ever!) and I'm definitely grateful to everyone who supported, shared, critiqued, and contacted me about this project. Although $3,125 is obviously short of my goal, I get to keep most of the donations (minus a 9% fee)  thanks to IndieGoGo's Flexible Funding system. 
I have been asked if I'll do another fundraiser. The answer is YES ~ but I'm not sure when I'll put another one online. The biggest lesson I learned from doing this one is to break up my funding goals into chunks so the next fundraiser will probably be for $3,000 or less so that it will be easier for me to meet the goal and to get all the money donated.
For right now, I'm concentrating on traveling and interviewing cosplayers during the last few months of 2012. You can keep up with my travels via the Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/BreakingAllTheRulesCosplay or my blog: http://www.seventhmoon.org/blog where I post my con reports and various articles about people I meet on my journey. Also please visit the main book page, http://www.seventhmoon.org/cosplayphotobook. 
Thank you again for all your support and interest in this book!
------------------------------------------------
Costume Play - a Japanese word originally coined describe the hobby of designing and dressing up in costumes. While that may bring up images of Halloween, costume players - or "cosplayers" - now go all out with painstakingly accurate replicas of their favorite costumes from TV shows, cartoons, comics, and movies. Cosplay has moved from a niche corner of Japanese geekdom to a global pop culture phenomenon that includes the United States.

story:
My Story

Hi my name is Cristobal  I'm a photographer and graphic designer. I'm asking your help to replace my camera so that I can continue photographing my project called Streets of Joy & Outrage which will eventually become a self published book. 

Streets of Joy & Outrage is about the art and creative expression that can be a vital part of what drives these street gatherings. The creative expression of joy that happens in carnivals can also light up a crowd in a demonstration. It helps people find their common dreams and struggles and express their outrage. It can challenge conventions, routine and the status quo, helping people find their voice and identity, I want to convey the search of that voice in a book, a collective voice that can go from Joy to Outrage. Most of the photos occur here in New York and also in Washington DC.

The Impact

New York City's diversity is so well known that sometimes we take it for granted. Carnivals are a great place to see the best of it. Political Demonstrations have a negative connotation among those that don't participate even though they are valuable venues for social change and for communities to come together. I hope that my project contributes to the awareness of diversity and our common voices.


What I Need & What You Get

Last year my SLR camera stopped working, disrupting my project. I am dedicated to raising my children and work part time, so buying a new camera has been difficult. Since then I have been using borrowed cameras and my cell phone. Recently, using my cellphone I struggled to photograph a police repression of a demonstration, it really is not the best tool for those moments. 

With your help I will buy an SLR with a quality lens. For this I am looking to gather $2000. The other half will cover for the thank you gifts that I will send to each project backer. In case the full amount is not reached, I will save the money so that I can buy it later. All the money I gather will go to buying photo equipment and making test prints for the book.


Other Ways You Can Help

I love the idea of having a book about crowds to be supported by crowd funding, it also gives me a chance to be in contact with the people that like my project. To support the project you don't have to be rich, anyone can do it, since donations start at only $10. It is vital that it reaches as many people as possible, so please make some noise, share it with your social networks and tell your friends, let's make it go viral!

Thank you!!!!!!!!


All of the photos will be online at www.streetsofjoy.us. The book will be self published using a service like Blurb or Lulu.
